column1: [SAK-966] Cannot add tools to pages
column6:
The following happens in project and course sites logged in as admin.

1. Create site in WS setup and add tools
2. Go to Sites area, select site and add a page to the site
3. Add a tool to a page

I get the following message:

These are the Tools defined in this Page. Click on one to edit. Use the up and down arrows to re-arrange.

There are no tools to edit.
column10: Cannot add tools to pages
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Joanne, this is a high priority one.
column45:
You can still add new tools into this page, although the page shows a wrong message. Clicking the "new tools" button on the top will show you the interface of adding a new tool.

So my understanding of this ticket is, to show the proper message when there is no tool existing in the current page.
How about this: "There are no tools defined in this page. Click the 'New Tool' button to add one. "?

-Joanne
column49:
Fix was checked in. A proper message would be displayed when no tools exist in the page.

Joanne

column1: [SAK-965] JavaScript Error: Permission Denied when loading SAMigo Tool
column6:
I created a new project site and added the SAMigo tool. When I click on that tool, I get a JavaScript error which I believe is from some code that the Charon portal is running to resize the window. Here is the error:

Line: 241
Char: 3
Error: Permission Denied
Code: 0
URL: http://nightly2.sakaiproject.org/portal/tool/848bede0-ad35-41c8-80f9-86ea9c2c34b2/jsf/index/mainIndex

This error does not occur under Firefox. I think we are bumping into the IE security model somehow. Thanks, L
column10: JavaScript Error: Permission Denied when loading SAMigo Tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: FYI, this issue is not specfic to SAMigo. I got this same error when I was testing the Profile Tool. I think it is the code that tries to resize the frame. L
column45: Jon, I am still seeing this error under 2.0.0a4 on whisk this morning. Could you take another look? Thanks, L
column49: This is not fixed in a4; that is why I had it marked as fix version of 2.0. Thanks, L
column71:
Lance,

I don't see the bug on nightly, and I'm also using XP Service Pack 2.

Can you check your IE security settings?

What zone is the site in? On my machine its in the "Internet" zone. When I go to "Tools", "Internet Options...", "Security", "Custom level...", I see that I'm using the "Medium" security level. Are you using some other setting, such as "High", or your own tweaked security?

Can you try resetting your security to "Medium", and see if that fixes it?

Maybe we can narrow this down to a particular security setting that Sakai is tripping in IE Windows.
column75: I am not seeing the problem on nightly2. However I am seeing it on the STABLE Oracle instance. L
column79: I have verified this from another XPSP2 machine and it works fine. There seems to be an issue with my local IE install (maybe google or msn toolbar?). This is ready for QA verification. Thanks, L
column83: I'm not able to reproduce this in either IE or Firefox on on the oracle stable build. It sounds like this was a specific issue with Lance's machine.

column1: [SAK-964] IE iframes are very small - no way to change size through preferences
column6: The gradebook frame is very small and has scroll bars to scroll through the gradebook. See screen-shot for details.

column41:
Nihar, for this kind of problem it would be useful to include information on your browser version and your operating system.

John, the Gradebook application knows nothing about what iframe it's in. That's entirely up to the presentation framework. So this has to go elsewhere – probably to whoever's in charge of the "portal" code.
column45: I've noticed a short window in Samigo as well, in IE. Sending this to Glenn and cc'ing Jon (I think). Not sure who would take a look at this. Or is it a Gonzalo thing?
column49: Changing the component and summary to reflect the extent of the problem.
column71:
The frame size seems right on 2.0.0.a4 - both in IE and Mozilla-based browsers. Unfortunately, it still appears in certain special-cases in IE - like when a user does a hard-refresh by hitting shift-refresh. Then a permissions error occurs.

Needs further investigation to isolate every situation in which the bug occurs.
column75: Could someone update the status of this?
column79:
Its fixed - except for one special-case that should maybe be filed as a new bug.

When a user manually refreshes the gradebook page on Windows IE, there is sometimes a permissions JavaScript error that causes the frame to be small. It appears to be a browser timing issue. Not a big deal in my opinion.

column92: From lack of comments, I assume this is resolved.

column1: [SAK-963] HOME-7 has options not in spec / text is incorrect
column6:
This report follows up on a previous report about HOME-3, where I stated that the synoptic chat tool does not automatically show whichever chat room is selected in the Chat Tool.

Because the synoptic chat tool does not show the currently selected Chat Room, the user instead has to go into HOME-7 Recent Main Chat Room Options and select which chat room to display from a set of radial buttons. This is not in the spec.

The text fields for number of days in the past, number of chat messages, and number of characters per message should be on the same line as their labels. Instead, they are on the next line down.
column10: HOME-7 has options not in spec / text is incorrect
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I don't know that synoptic chat can show messages from whatever room is showing in the Chat tool because there could be more than one chat tool.

The label thing - I'm guessing is due to wrapping. Maybe the entry fields can be smaller. They seem kind of wide for the values that will be typed in.
column45: Reduced the size (but not the maxsize) of the inputs so that wrapping is less likely - thanks for the hint, John.
column49: The issue with the text fields was resolved. I have created SAK-1247 Closed to catch the issue of the synoptic chat automatically displaying the chat room selected in the Chat Tool.

column1: [SAK-961] Recent Announcements Options does not match spec
column6:
What is currently online for HOME-5 Recent Announcements Options does not match the spec in a number of ways.

The description for this tool should be "You are currently setting options for announcements in site <current site name>" instead of "You are currently setting options for recent announcements"

The first option in this tool should be labeled "Show Announcement Body" rather than "Show Body"

Instead of "Characters in body," the next option after that should be "Show About" followed by a pop-up menu with "One Line" and "Two Lines"

The text fields next to "Number of Days in the Past" and "Number of Announcements" should appear on the same line as their labels. Currently, they appear on the next line below.

The button at the bottom of the form should be "Update" rather than "Save"

column1: [SAK-959] Typo in HOME-4 and text appears on wrong line
column6:
On HOME-4 Worksite Info Options, there is a typo in the phrase "suggested length 15 characters."

Also, this text should appear on the next line below the text field. Currently, it is displayed on the same line and there is a line break in the middle of the text.
column10: Typo in HOME-4 and text appears on wrong line
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Done.
column45:
Although the typo has been fixed, the text is still being displayed too far to the right and is getting a line break right in the middle. I looked at this on my computer and on a computer with a larger display; both were getting line breaks.

The text is actually supposed to be on the next line under the text field for "Title," and aligned the left side of the text field.
column49: label x field x text tripplet at 1024x768
column71: label x field x text tripet at more than 1024x768
column75:
The problem here is that at certain resolutions the label and field will align left (good) - but this looks right only if the text instruction also does.

At other resolutions the label field pair will occupy only one line - this looks right only if the text instructions are indented the same as the field. See screenshots.

So - either text field looks funky in large resolutions (because it aligns left under the label) or funky al low rez (because it aligns underneath where the field used to be at high rez. Pick.

Since the label input pair collapses at 1024x768 I would recommend assuming collapse. Our baseline is 800X600 after all.
column79: After review, I think we need to leave these directions left-justified as Gonzalo suggested. This is inconsistent, but the inconsistency is a smaller usability issue than the problems introduced by trying to align it with the text field.
column83: Josh says fine. Display is a compromize, but best can be done.
column92: Closing, as the current configuration is acceptable to all parties.

column1: [SAK-954] There's a confirmation request when removing a schedule field, but its already been removed
column6:
In Schedule tool Fields page -
If I add two fields, and then click the checkbox for one to remove it, and click save updates, I get a confirmation alert (which doesn't mention which field I am removing), asking if it's ok to remove it, but the field is already gone from the list.

Not sure why we are listing all the fields on that page. There doesn't seem to be any reason to list those that the user will never be able to remove. The list just pushes everything down, requiring a scroll that otherwise wouldn't be needed.
column10: There's a confirmation request when removing a schedule field, but its already been removed
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I can answer the first question: why the confirmation alert?
Actually the fields won't be permanently removed, until the alert shows up and the user clicks save updates.
If the user clicks "Cancel" instead "save updates" after seeing the alert, the "removed" fields won't go away.

-Joanne
column45:
Daphne, can you please check this ticket out? The alert thing turns out to be not a bug. And the left is more about the design thing.
Thanks,
-Joanne
column49:
Hi Joanne,

Can we add the name of the field being removed to the alert users see?

As far as showing all fields...even the ones users can't affect...it gives them context when making decisions about what to add and to remove. This is the intended design. Expecting users to recall (from previous screen) rather than recoginize the complete list is additional cognitive load we want to alleviate from users. As far as scrolling, while not great, people are used to scrolling when using the web. The key is showing enough information scent that users know they need to scroll which the desing takes into consideration.
column71:
Per Daphne's suggestion, the fields to be removed will be displayed in the alert message. So the users can get a better idea of what would happen.
The fix has been checked in.
My person feeling is, the whole flow of fields editing still needs to be optimized. But that is more like a design issue, other than the bug. So the task of this ticket is done. I am returning it back to QA testing.
column75:
Verified on all 3 db versions of Sakai 2.0.1-rc3

Fix works as specified above. I agree that the process is a little cumbersome.

Unassigning & closing item.

column1: [SAK-953] Mislabeled buttons and items on wrong lines in SCH-6
column6:
On SCH-6 View Event, there are the following discrepancies between the spec and what's up:

The Go To Today button should be on its own line, above the Last Activity, Back To List, and Next Activity buttons.

The Back To List button currently reads just "Back"

There should not be a Go To Today button beneath the body of the event, at the bottom of the page.

The description of the event should appear above the Activity Type, Frequency, and Location. Currently, the ordering of the fields is:
Date
Time
Frequency
Event Type
Location
Description
but should instead be:
DAte
Time
Description
Activity Type
Frequency
Location

Finally, the description of the event should appear next to the label Description, and be indented so that it aligns with the date, time, etc. Instead, it is labeled as "Message," and appears beneath a light grey line aligned all the way to the left.
column10: Mislabeled buttons and items on wrong lines in SCH-6
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: All fixed. Doubt remains - how could we have gotten it so different? Were we working from old mockups?

column1: [SAK-950] No time column and showing entire body of schedule item
column6:
On SCH-1e List View, the table of events does not match the specs in 3 ways.

The specs call for 3 columns, Date, Time, and Description. Currently, there are only two, "Date" and "Activity and time".

Currently, Sakai is showing the entire body of the event, but the specs indicate that only part of the first line is shown (I'm going by the first item in the table, which shows part of a sentence followed by an ellipses).

There is a triangle next to the Date label in the spec which indicates that the columns in this table should be sortable.

column1: [SAK-943] Format of top menu bar of a component's window
column6:
Almost all components have a horizontal menu at the top of the window. There should be a pipe character ('|') between the labels in these menus and each label should be underlined. For example, under 'schedule' the menu is : "New Event Merge Fields Permissions". Should look like: "New Event | Merge | Fields | Permissions" (Each label underlined also).
The underline does take effect but only after you click on one of the items. After you click any of them then all become permanently underlined, but not in the initial state.

column1: [SAK-940] Characters causing problems in filename in Resources
column6:
I was able to upload the file named Try 'this' `or`; ^&() $#@s.pdf ok, but once it was in Resources, I couldn't delete it. It seemed to prevent me from doing anything with the files after it in the list as well.

See jlclass 100 001 on nightly2 (5/19 10:35am) or I can reupload as needed.
column10: Characters causing problems in filename in Resources
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: The changes that attempted to fix this were backed out. We should discuss how to approach it and when to work on it.
column45:
The characters that cause problems are:

/** These can't be encoded in URLs safely even using %nn notation, so encode them using our own

  • custom URL encoding, which the ParameterParser decodes */
    protected static final String ESCAPE_URL_SPECIAL = "^?;";
column49: Jim, Can we have a status update on this?
column71: John, Is this still an issue?
column75: Still a problem on nightly and stable rc2. The problem is that once it is in Resources, you can't get rid of it, aside from not being able to open it.
column79: I'm pretty sure you can delete them through WebDAV however
column83: I just confirmed that you can delete these resources using WebDAV.
column92: It seems like the best solution to this would be to prevent the creation of resources whose id's contain those characters. Does anybody object to that approach? Does anybody have a better solution?
column96: well, we saw this issue with a filename with a "..." in it. I'm attaching two screenshots, one of the file as it looks in resources, the other as what you get when you click on it. On the user's filesystem, the filename just had three ... in it, so I'm not sure if Sakai added those characters or? The file was uploaded thru WebDAV.
column127:
I know lots of people who would object to blocking those characters. Foreign language instructors, for example.

We are hoping to move this site to Sakai http://fas-digiclass.rutgers.edu/ - you can see the instructors there use non-English and special characters very heavily in the titles. If Sakai cannot do the same it becomes unusable.

I think a better solution would be to create "display title" that has nothing to do with the id, and merely gets displayed as the link text.
column131: This ticket has to do with a fairly small set of character that are escaped in a non-standard way. That set may be limited to the carat (^), the question mark and the semi-colon (. It's possible there are others, but I'm not sure. Other characters are escaped correctly so they do not present the same problem, I think. If you are having problems with other characters, it may be solved by specifying UTF-8 in the tomcat properties file.
column135:
We now believe this issue may be limited to the '' character when it appears as part of a filename (and therefore becomes part of a resource-id). We added the '' character to the list of illegal characters for resource-id's. It gets escaped into an underscore.

This should be QA'd by attempting to upload files whose names contain various odd characters, especially punctuation (';', '(', '{', '[', '~', '$', '@', '^', '&', etc). Also test by attempting to create folders, HTML resources, simple text resources, etc, with such characters in their names.
column139: Checked with different illegal characters (^,%,?,') and they get replaced with an underscore. Works fine.

In order to change the left side menu bar, you have to go inside either Site Info tool or Admin Worksite Setup tool to modify the tool.
column92: Good point... yeah, I understand the logic of this. Maybe we should make it clearer in the Options menu that you're only changing the title of the frame, not the tool itself (which you can do in other places, such as during site creation or in Site Info).
column96: The interface seems inconsistent on this... when you set up the tool during site creation or go into Site Info to edit it, you can change the title of the tool and the title of the frame at the same time. However, in Options, you can only change the title of the frame. It just doesn't distinguish between the two very well, and without knowing that there was a rule against the Options menu altering the title of menu items, I wouldn't understand why it was working this way.

column1: [SAK-919] Recent announcement options have changed - don't allow display of motd
column6:

We need to correct the MOTD problem. These are 2 different tools (MOTD & Recent announcements) so if they share code we'll need to use an if statement to leave MOTD as is. The changes made to the options in recent announcements are design decisions that were made for 2.0 in the refactor project. It should not be rolled back without a design discussion.

The bug here is to return MOTD to the interaction/format it was using previously in 1.5.

column41:
"Under profile, when I enter in my personal information, even if I leave the "Hide only my personal information" box unchecked, it still doesn't show my personal info when I click Show Profile."

Profile Tool specification states that it should be like profile in Oncourse classic. In Oncourse profile, User does not see his own personal information in his profile summary.

"In addition, if I check the box that says "Hide my entire profile", my Public Information still shows up when I click Show Profile. It appears that neither one of those check boxes has any effect on what shows/doesn't show up in the profile."

Hiding option are for other users and not for the owner of the profile. "Show Profile" brings user back to his/her profile from any view. User will always be able to see the summary and hide option don't apply for viewing own profile.

Thanks Rashmi

column1: [SAK-910] session timeout weirdness in delivery
column6:
version: Sakai 1.5.1-m2-oracle - Sakai 1.5.1-m2 zh2

New and exciting errors when the session times out in the middle of delivery. I know that Sakai has a fairly short idle timeout, but things like this shouldn't happen.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Take a timed assessment (ex: 5.16 Linear Anon Test)

2. When the timer reaches 5 minutes, a popup saying so appears.

3. Leave the assessment alone at this point (after all, it looks like it's paused!) for >5 minutes.

Expected behavior: Either the delivery timer should be paused, or it should continue counting down to 0. Sakai should either auto-submit the assessment or just exit delivery, depending on the assessment settings.

Actual behavior: The delivery timer is paused until you hit OK on the popup box. Now the timer bar appears red and the timer display is screwed up (see screenshot). Click on any button or link, and you get a blank screen with just the save and exit button. (At this point the session's clearly timed out and you have to close and restart your browser to fix things.)

Lots of exceptions in logs (see attached):

2005-05-16 16:27:28 ApplicationDispatcher[/samigo] Servlet.service() for servlet Faces Servlet threw exception
javax.faces.FacesException: #

{delivery.saveAndExit}

: javax.faces.el.EvaluationException: java.lang.Error: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: ""
at com.sun.faces.application.ActionListenerImpl.processAction(ActionListenerImpl.java:78)
at javax.faces.component.UICommand.broadcast(UICommand.java:312)

column1: [SAK-908] Email-archive tool should change the smtp return path for outgoing mail
column6:
[This issue has been resolved in Sakai as of 2.1.0. See SAK-2726 for details.]

The E-mail Archive tool does not change the smtp envelope from address (return path) for outgoing mail. Consequently, a user who sends an email to a site email address will receive any bounces that happen to be generated because one or more user email addresses are invalid, or the message is bounced for other reasons (spam/virus filters, etc.).

This is undesirable because the user sending the email message is emailing a group address, and has no control over the individual destination addresses.

The E-mail Archive tool should have a config option to allow the return path address to be configured so that bounces go to a site owner (similar to mailing lists) or a globally defined bounce address rather than the original sender address.

This problem is currently visible on collab.sakaiproject.org - emailing to a DG (e.g. sepp-ui@collab.sakaiproject.org) produces a string of "out of the office" and other auto-replies.
column10: Email-archive tool should change the smtp return path for outgoing mail
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Patch for BasicEmailService.java in 2.0.0 which allows setting a global smtp mail from (return path) address in sakai.properties, e.g.

mailfrom@org.sakaiproject.service.framework.email.EmailService=sakai-bounces@some.domain
column45: how about a "Precedence: List" header should take care of some of the auto repliers
column49: This functionality is now in 2.1.0. (Do contributed patches ever get closed?)
column71: This issue has been resolved for 2.1.0. See SAK-2726 Closed for details.

column1: [SAK-907] Support for url resources with protocols other than http
column6:
When adding a url resource in the resources tool, the url is validated and urls not starting with "http://" are rejected.

Sometimes it is useful to add a url resource that refers to a resource using another protocol than http. For instance:
mms://
rtsp://
webcal://

The validation should allow for urls using other protocols than http.
column10: Support for url resources with protocols other than http
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: The code to add a URL screens inputs to make sure they are valid URL's. It does this by trying to create a Java URL object using the input in the URL field. It seems to me that the Java URL class must validate against some set of known protocols and it doesn't recognize these protocols. I tried ftp, https, mailto, gopher, and a few others that worked fine. If I changed the protocol to mms, rtsp or news, it gave the error. Seems like we may have to stop validating URLs if we want these to be accepted.
column45:
Developed new validation in case java.net.URL constructor throws exception:

1) Split user input into two parts – protocol and rest.
2) Attempt to construct URL substituting "http" for user's protocol.

If that validates, then use the URL (including the protocol specified by the user). Otherwise, add alert as before for an invalid URL.
column49: fix verified

Steps to verify:

column1: [SAK-35921] "high security" settings conflicting
column6:
versions:
SA 1.5 nightly build on aam-dev
1.5.1 integrated hsql instance at MIT

The "Allow only specified IP addresses" setting is conflicting with the "Secondary username and password" setting in some circumstances.

Steps to verify:

1. Publish an assessment with both these settings turned on. For the "Allow only specified IP addresses" setting, choose something that doesn't match your computer's address, like 35.*

2. As a student, try to take the assessment.

Even though you put in the secondary username and password correctly, you still get the "incorrect password" message.

3. Now, go back and re-publish the same assessment. This time either turn off the IP setting, or set it to something that matches your computer's address (171.* will work for desktops in Meyer).

4. Try and take the republished assessment as a student.

This time you can get in with the same username and password that weren't working before.

So what you should have seen in step 2 was the "unauthorized IP" failure message. Instead you got the "incorrect password" one.
The "unauthorized IP" failure message will only show up if you turn off the username/password setting.

Let me know if this is confusing - it's a weird bug!
column10: "high security" settings conflicting
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column71:
Yes, we didn't set this. What is a reasonable setting? Is this supposed to be an administrator?

  1. worksite setup requests email address
  2. this is used in worksite setup - where emails go when an instructor
  3. 'manually' sets up a class site (types in the class info rather than picking
  4. from a list of classes
    #setup.request=nobody@nowhere.org
column75:
The target auidience for the setup.request address is the group of people responsible for verifying that a person requesting a class manually is authorized to setup a site for that class. Generally this would be a Support group, rather than system administrators.

The postmaster address is one that should be directed to the system administrators. It is where problem reports with email delivery will be sent for one thing.

For both of these good, usable defaults are probably not possible. For the purposes of testing here and for the default configuration, both should probably be pointed to the same place. For instance, root@localhost is a good guess for Unix machines; not sure what a good default for a Windows machine would be. Whatever the choices, the documentation and comments in sakai.properties need to be updated to indicate what these values are for, and that they most likely need local customization.
column79: Resetting the server seems to have cleared up the problem.

column1: [SAK-901] Sakai's css interferes with gradebook css
column6:
The standalone gradebook's css was implemented to match the spec, and does so admirably (nice job, Ray!). However, when the default sakai css is added to the gradebook app, the look of the tool is all wrong.

A potential solution is to not include the sakai css declaration in the gradebook pages, but this means that any skinning done to sakai will not apply in the gradebook. Another option is to rework the gradebook's css to more closely match the css styles defined in the styleguide. And a third option: since Ben defined the look and feel of the gradebook, and since Ben just published v1.5 of the Sakai Styleguide, perhaps we should revisit the css classes defined in the default sakai skin so they can support tools that exercise (and push) what's expressed in the styleguide.
column10: Sakai's css interferes with gradebook css
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Josh,

I think Ben and Gonzalo need to address the CSS conflicts between the Sakai stylesheets and the Gradebook stylesheets. They both work on the styleguide, and as you can see, there are two implementations that need to be reconciled.

Ben and Gonzalo have a conference call scheduled for Friday. If it turns out that it would require a lot of work to fix, and we don't have time to reconcile, then we can consider the less-than-optimal solution of GB & Samigo having their own stylesheets that don't participate in skinning. Hopefully though the GB styles and the Sakai styles can be reconciled. Gonzalo has been working on a more detailed specification that more fully specifies the technical details of the CSS definitions (allowing for skining), which the 1.3 and 1.4 did not fully specify.

-Jon
column45:
The sakai tool_base.css that all tools share is now (as of today noon EST) a clone of the css used in the examples, from which all tools are supposed to draw.

This should address the issue. Let me know -we will be hashing out things tomorrow.
column49: Jon's made it possible for non-legacy tools to participate or not in skinning, so there is no interference if they do not at the moment, there will be no interference if they do in a few days more.
column71: Josh - maybe you can verify that things are ok now and close this.

column1: [SAK-893] Add callback interfaces to SiteSetup API and impl
column6:
Glenn,

Not only is this a requirement for IU but I have alse heard the need from Foothill. If possible, I would like to get these changes into the sakai2 release. Thanks! L

----------------------------------------------------------------------
From: Poland, Andrew J
Sent: Monday, May 09, 2005 5:11 PM
To: Speelmon, Lance D
Subject: Callbacks needed for sitesetup

I need to be able to execute custom code whenever the following events occur in sitesetup:

1) A site is created
2) A site is deleted
3) For each new member that is added to a roster
4) For each member that is deleted from a roster
5) Each time a member's role is changed

Here are examples of our existing signatures. It would be great if the new callbacks would include these parameters.

void addToOncourseRoster(SessionState state, String userId, String role)
void deleteFromOncourseRoster(SessionState state, String userId)
void createOncourseCourse(SessionState state, CourseListItem cli)
column10: Add callback interfaces to SiteSetup API and impl
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This will not be done for 2.0. Indiana's needs will be met with another technique.

We will revisit this post 2.0, as part of the site / superstructure redesign.
column45: Lance, is this still a desired feature request? Thanks.
column49: It is still desired, but I think Glenn may have it handled in a different way than described here. Let's check with him to see how this issue should be handled. Thanks, L
column71: Glenn, is this something you are working on or has it been handled differently already? Thanks.
column75:
I'm closing this for now. We have two ways to handle this:

  • with a listener for site or realm events, you can do whatever is needed
  • with the Entity model, an EntityProducer can be called when sites are created, change, or are deleted.

If any of this needs framework extensions, lets open up a new Jira for them in the future.

column1: [SAK-892] Date Picker Should Validate Dates
column6:
See SAK-868 Closed for original description.

The date picker widget should include validating the entry, e.g., no April 31st's, no leap-days in non-leap-years. If time is also incorporated into the same widget, then it should also be validated. Validation should also be sensitive to the format's supported by the widget, and only certain, specific formats may be active for a particular install of Sakai (once support for that is added.)

column1: [SAK-35059] Samigo.xml is misnamed
column6:
The database connection information for Samigo is kept in a file named 'samigo.xml'. The information format however is not xml but the properties file format. This causes problems for automatic processing on the Windows platform as pathnames in properties files must be treated differently than pathnames in xml files.

We can work around this, but since the root of the problem is caused by a misnamed file that can easily be addressed by renaming the file.
column10: Samigo.xml is misnamed
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-877] Student Feedback Options: Error when select only display course grades
column6:
When the teacher is at the Student Feedback Options screen and selects ONLY "Display course grades to students now. All assignments are noted in the gradebook." (leaving "Display assignment grades to students" UNchecked"), the student is provided with no information when they go to view their grade. The student's cummulative score reports "0 out of 0 points scored (0%)." and nothing appears for the Course Grade (not even an explanation or error message).

I'm not sure if this was how it was intended to function, but it seems to me that if you leave the user with 2 checkboxes that can be selected independently of one another (i.e., Display assignment grades AND/OR Display course grades) that an instructor should be able to display just the course grade if desired. If it is necessary to display assignment grades in order for the course grade to appear, then perpahs the Display course grades option should be greyed out until the Display assignment grades option is checked.

column1: [SAK-876] Users with "access" role get "Select All/Unselect All" button but it has no purpose
column6:
Users with the access role, when going to Resources, can see a button for Select All (or Unselect All, if they have clicked Select All). However, based on their level of permissions, this button serves no purpose (they cannot copy or paste or delete with their default level of permissions).

At the University of Michigan, the support team has helped a number of users who were confused by the presence of this button and believed that they should be able to use it to download all of the resources in a given folder simultaneously (which would be a cool thing to let people do!).

column1: [SAK-875] Apache error when attempting to access deleted Schedule item
column6:
I found this bug in the following way: I had two users logged in an on the same site simultaneously. I created a schedule item that took place in the past, and had both users look at the schedule tool. One user deleted the schedule item but before the other user could refresh, I had the second user click on the schedule item to view it. Sakai threw the following error:

org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getCalendar' in class org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.calendar.DbCalendarService threw exception class org.sakaiproject.exception.IdUnusedException : null
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getCalendar' in class org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.calendar.DbCalendarService threw exception class org.sakaiproject.exception.IdUnusedException : null

This error only occured when I attempted to view the schedule item immediately. If I waited longer, Sakai showed an appropriate error message and eventually the schedule item disappeared from the schedule as one would expect it to.
column10: Apache error when attempting to access deleted Schedule item
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-874] Cannot search by site title in Realms
column6: One cannot search by site title in the Realms tool. The support staff at the University of Michigan must frequently use this tool to add course rosters to sites. column1: [SAK-873] From and Date fields do not change when editing announcements
column6:
When editing announcements, the From and Date fields do not get edited. This can potentially become a problem when an instructor reuses materials from a previous semesters. Announcements from previous semesters get brought over has drafts. However, even if the instructor edits and posts the announcement, it will still have the same timestamp (which could be for last semester, a year ago, or longer).

If two instructors are coteaching a course (or if someone is assisting the instructor), if one person creates an announcement and then another one edits it, the announcement will still appear as though it was posted by the first person, even though the second person has made changes to it.
column10: From and Date fields do not change when editing announcements
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-872] Instructor comments lost when returning and re-submitting an assignment multiple times
column6: When an instructor returns an assignment, the instructor's comments (whether inline or additional comments) overwrite the previous comments that the instructor has made on the assignment. So, when an assignment is returned a second time, the instructor's comments from the first time he or she returned it disappear. Same thing for the third time it's returned, and so on. Neither the student nor the instructor has access to the comments.
column10: Instructor comments lost when returning and re-submitting an assignment multiple times
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-871] New Category feature requires both "new topic" permission and "revise.any" permission
column6:
If a role has the New Topic permission but does not have the Revise.any permission, then a user with that role will have a "New Category" button in the Discussion tool. If the user tries to use this button, the form to create a new category appears, Sakai, accepts the name of the new category, but then it goes back to the view of the discussion without actually creating a new category or showing an error message.

However, if the user presses the "New Topic" button, he can create a new category successfully using this form.

This is a problem at the University of Michigan, where we have set up a role called "Assistant," which is supposed to be able to create new topics and categories, but that we have denied permission to edit anyone's posts in the discussion except his or her own.

column1: [SAK-864] Maintain number of students viewed per page for entire session
column6:
Changes to the students per page option in the roster, assignment detail and course grade tables should be maintained for the Instructor's entire session. The stickiness for each of these views should be maintained separately within a session. Here is a brief use case:

In the roster view, the Instructor changes students to view per page from the default to 50. She navigates to the overview page using the intra-tool nav bar link and clicks on an assignment. The assignment details page shows the default number of students per page. Then via the nav bar link, she returns to the roster, which still displays 50 students per page.

column1: [SAK-863] assignment scores behave differently in different browsers
column6:
Using grade book #2

In Safari, I entered scores for an assignment worth zero points. The scores I entered were varied – some a single digit (8), some scores with two decimal points (4.56), some with three (9.997). When I clicked Save, I noticed that the application removed all the decimal points and truncated the entries to a single digit. For example, 9.997 became 9.

I decided to test this in another browser and observed a different behavior. For an assignment worth zero points, I entered multiple scores again. They were formatted as indicated in the above description. When I clicked Save, I got an error message pointin gout one score that was invalid – a score with 3 decimal places. The funny thing is that I had multiple scores with 3 decimal places (see attached screen shot). I resolved the offending score (only the one highlighted by the system) and clicked Save. My new scores were saved.

I can't explain why only one score with 3 decimal places was caught. It was the score for the student with the longest name.

column1: [SAK-856] percentages in Course Grade Summary table show comma instead of decimal pt.
column6:
In Grade book #2, on the Course Grade Summary page, the average score for the class and the calculated grade show percentages with commas instead of decimal points. For example, F (46,8%). See the attached screenshot.

I tested this in IE and Firefox on the Mac and they display the calculated grade as expected (46.8%). Seems like this is a Safari-specific issue.
column10: percentages in Course Grade Summary table show comma instead of decimal pt.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Might be related to other unicode related character-set problems.
column45: Karen, what is your "locale" or language preference in safari (if there is such a thing)? Is it set to something other than English-US (en-us)?
column49:
The Mac I was using yesterday seemed to be displaying in French. I checked the language preference in Safari and it was set to "default." When I changed it to "Western," the display didn't update. I didn't see an option for English-US.

I did do a test to check out the grade book on another Mac, using Safari, to see if the French issue was Safari related or specific to the laptop I was using. It seemed to be specific to that laptop. I'll check the alternate computer today to see if the comma/decimal point issue is also local to the Mac/Safari combo I used to test.
column71: Just as a clarifying note for us provincials, in French the percentage point should be a comma instead of a period.
column75:
I did a bit more testing. I used a different Mac from my lab and opened the GB in Safari. My buttons and dates were still displayed in French and the percentage points were commas.

I tested using yet another Mac, this one a Powerbook G4 laptop, and opened the GB in Safari. None of the display was in French (buttons or dates). The decimal points were displayed as commas.

I tried to change the settings on my French Safari laptops, but couldn't find any option that defined my language as French – it is defined as Western-ISO. No other sites I navigated to displayed in French, only the GB.
column79:
On the Mac, IE and Firefox are using browser preferences to determine the languages that will be accepted, but Safari is picking language preferences up from the system. By default, the "International" preferences panel enables a long ordered list of languages with "English" at the top as the preferred choice. If you remove all the non-English languages from that list, then Safari no longer shows French and commas as percentage points.

I was able to reproduce the problem on Firefox by going to "Options" / "Languages" and adding "French" to the language list. Even though I put it at the bottom of the list, after "English/United States" and "English", the QA Gradebook will start trying to show French.

Using Live HTTP Headers, I see that the browser is sending the line:

Accept-Language: en-us,en;q=0.7,fr;q=0.3

That "fr" seems to be the trigger.

The next question is who's responsible for ignoring the preferences order. It must be Tomcat or MyFaces, because it's certainly not us!
column83: In our faces-config / locale-config, we specified "default-locale" as "en", but didn't included "en" in the "supported-locale" list. If there are any matches between the brower's preferences and the "supported-locale" list, then the "default-locale" is ignored. The bug was fixed by putting "en" into the "supported-locale" list as well.
column92:
Entered a MyFaces bug:

http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MYFACES-236
column96: verified fixed.
column127: Change fix version.

We're seeing at Michigan an issue that may be related to this one.

We had a pilot instructor manually add one of us as a student to his class so we could demo the student side of Gradebook for him. He gave us a grade, saw the student end of Gradebook, and then deleted us from the class. However, the grade he gave us on the assignment, even though we're no longer in the class, is still being averaged in to calculate the "Average for Scores Entered".

I think this is a real scenario - student starts course, bombs first assignment, decides to drop course before the drop/add deadline. They drop off the roster, and should drop off the gradebook, along with that data.

Is the issue here that we were manually added as students to the course, and aren't on the official course roster?
column75: Michelle, can you add this as a new bug? It looks like a different issue to me.

column1: [SAK-854] WYSIWYG: Unable to paste text into textbox, no paragraph breaks
column6:
Instructors expect to be able to copy text from another source, MS Word most often, and paste it into an announcement, schedule item, assignment, or discussion topic. Basically, anywhere there's the WYSIWYG.

Students want to do this too. Especially since they like to compose offline (where they get spellcheck) and then paste into an assignment or discussion response.

But you can't paste into a WYSIWYG text field. It just won't work. You can toggle the [<>] button to view code and then paste, but that breaks any and all formatting, including simple paragraph breaks. You then need to toggle back to WYSIWYG and re-format. This is too much to effort for what should be a simple operation:

1-- highlight text elsewhere
2-- copy it
3-- paste it onto the Sakai page

Even if all other formatting fails, the simple paragraph breaks should be maintained by simply pasting.

For users who don't have the WYSIWYG, the simple paste appears to work, but saving drops all formatting including paragraph breaks. There is NO WAY without knowing html to get a simple paragraph break into a simple text entry field if you're using Safari or any other non-WYSIWYG compatible browser.

In my experience, even if you add the <br> code, the paragraphs will break in email notification.

BY THE WAY! Imagine this message without paragraph breaks. Here's an example of a text entry field that simply works when you type into it. It's WYSIWYG I can't even create this description using Safari in Sakai. And I can't create it offline anywhere and paste it in-- Sakai WYSIWYG or not.
column10: WYSIWYG: Unable to paste text into textbox, no paragraph breaks
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Don't think there is any way to have a general solution, when Word maintians it's own format.
If we developed a tool to upload a Word document into a WYSIWYG, then we could at least preprocess it.

What do you think, Jon?
column45:
If the default was no WYSIYWYG, but a simple box that would accept pasted text (maintaining merely paragraph breaks and no other formatting), and if there was a button to click to evoke the wysiwyg, that would be ideal, I think.

People are very used to copying and pasting into email without formatting and equally used to typing into text boxes on the web without text editors (like in this JIRA comment box).

Give them something standard, simple, that works, and that they are used to-- then give them a way to take it to the next level. Until the WYSIWYG accepts pasted text, I don't see how we can deny this basic activity.

Another homegrown application on campus does it this way very successfully. Beside the textbox is a button to evoke the WYSIYWYG. In this particular app, there's also a checkbox to "display carriage returns as line breaks." This is checked by default but you can uncheck it to paste html code wholesale.

We used to recommend users compose offline and then paste onto the website. Students really like to do this in the Assignment area. It's a safe, quick way to compose in their favorite application (with spellcheck!). We got numerous support calls last term from students who couldn't figure out how to paste.
column49:
Diana,

This is very much the kind of changes I would like to make to the WYSIWYG. I'll hash out a simple proposal and send it out. I did the initial WYSIWYG integration so I can do the additional features right (-;
column71: Jon, can you update on status of this for 2.0? Thanks.
column75:
This is a tricky issue. It has to do with how paragraph breaks are handled, and plaintext versus HTML. Zhen, if you think you've got a good solution, lets discuss it. I don't think that there is an easy solution here. The user doesn't think about whether they are typing plaintext or HTML, they don't think about whether a carriage-return is a displayed line break or not, but they want our code to allow them to do both and to do what they want it to do.

So the WYSIWYG would need additional options / logic to know when carriage returns are line-breaks and when they are not. And to allow composing of "plaintext" instead of HTML.
column79: Has any progress been made on this issue for 2.1.0?
column83: As Jon and Zhen discussed, there is no simple solution to this. We are looking at other editors that may do this better. But such changes cannot be made for 2.1.
column92: The FCK editor has much better support for pasting from Word.
column96: Believed to no longer be an issue since the switch to FCK editor as of Sakai 2.2.0. Please re-open, if necessary.
column127: Unassigning closed tickets

column1: [SAK-853] Course Grade: Case sensitive problem
column6: In the Course Grade section if you are trying to override the grade given to a student if you use a lowercase letter it gives you an error. Either an instruction must be on the page stating it can only be entered in caps or the error message should be amended to indicate only caps allowed. Perhaps with an example "A". The error message currently is the same if you enter a lower case grade or a numeral.
column7: Windows XP with service pack 2. Browser: Mozilla Firefox v 1.0
column10: Course Grade: Case sensitive problem
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
From Ben:

I saw this as a real bug when i was demoing the other day. I don't think the grades should be case sensitive. it would be nice if the java code capitalized them for you after they are submitted, though.
column45: I will update spec, unless the developers push back on this late change.
column49:
The gradebook is designed for maximum flexibility in deployment. The grade mappings that are included in the default gradebook distribution include typical A-F grade mappings, along with Pass / Not Pass, but you could easily envision others as well. Because the grade mapping functionality is extensible, we have no way of knowing whether an "a" is really the same mapping as an "A". Similarly, if the grade mappings use something other than ASCII characters, there is no way to reliably "uppercase" or "lowercase" a string.

In order to maintain the grade mapping extensibility and internationalization, we can not make assumptions about calitalization. If the case sensitivity requirement trumpts extensibility and internationalization, then we can ignore case. Otherwise, the current behavior is unavoidable.
column71: Given the initial expected audience for the GB, I think that allowing valid lower case entries that are automatically converted to upper case makes sense at this point.
column75:
We will now automatically convert grade input to match whatever case is stored in the database. For example, if the grade mapping for the course is "Hep", "CommeCiCommeCa", and "Nowhere", the instructor can type a course grade of "commecicommeca" and we will convert to the standard form.

As another example, if the grade mapping is "A", "B", ..., the instructor can enter "a", "b", ....
column79: Verified fixed
column83: Change affects and fix versions.
column92: Changed affects and fix versions.
column96: Changed affects and fix versions.

column49:
All of the current HiFi sample pages have their preferred "default" submit as the first button in the form. That's not the case for us.

  • When the user is in the search filter input, the friendliest default is the "Find" button, no matter what the surrounding form is.
  • When the user is entering scores in Assignment Detail or Course Grade, we'd like "Save" as the default even though other buttons come before it.
  • When the user is entering fields in Add Assignment or Edit Assignment, we'd like "Save" as the default even though the calendar button comes before it.
  • When the user is entering grade values in Feedback Options, we'd like "Save" as the default even though the "Change Grade Type" button comes before it.

I've modified IDs and added a Javascript function to override the default behavior on those pages.

This is as requested, so should be documented (and perhaps entered as a feature request). From Basecamp:

7 February 15:56 | Ray Davis said
4) Assignment Grading - "Is the instructor allowed to enter more points than the assignment point value?"

7 February 16:16 | Oliver Heyer said
4. Yes, with no validation. If they enter 122 points for a 10 pnt assignment, tough

7 February 16:24 | Ben Brophy said
I agree w/ Oliver on all but #2.
column45: I will update the specification to make it explicit that we allow instructors to enter values above the total point limit. This enables them to grant extra credit in the absence of another way to do this through the UI.
column49:
The ability to enter scores greater than the assignment's total value enables instructors to grant extra credit in the absence of any other explicit means to do so in the UI.

When scores larger than the allocated assignment value are entered, the success message should read:

"New scores saved. One or more of previously or recently saved scores exceeds the total point value of the assignment."

This message appears only upon a save action. The message is triggered as long as the condition holds.

A more targeted identification of specific excess scores is out of scope for 2.0 at this date.
column71:
I just checked in an approach to this feature. I adjusted the message (and implied functionality) somewhat – I hope that's OK. If the instructor has entered any new scores that are greater than the assignment value, then the success mesage will be "New scores saved. One or more saved scores exceeded the total point value of the assignment." It was easier to code that way, and it fits the "Stop bugging me" principle.

As an implementation note, I'm reporting the list of excessively energetic students back to the UI, should we ever want to highlight them somehow.

column1: [SAK-842] Unicode names not displayed correctly in all deployments
column6: To test Unicode display and handling, we have a student assignment named "Thor Mj\u00F8lner". When doing local testing the special character shows up fine. On our QA site, though, it shows up as junk ("Mj￸lner"). Figure out the problem. (Possibly the DB setup.)
column10: Unicode names not displayed correctly in all deployments
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The problem was in the database being used by the Internal QA deployment. It was a MySQL 4.1 DB which had been created with a default character set of "latin1".

mysql> show create database gbmit;
... ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 ...

As a result, when the gradebook application asked for fields from the database, it was being handed bad characters. (We hadn't noticed any problems during development because when we installed our own local copies of MySQL, we said to use UTF-8 as the default for the server.)

I modified the Internal QA database:

mysql> alter database gbmit character set utf8;

Then I wiped out the Gradebook tables and reloaded the test data. The special characters seem to be showing fine now.

column1: [SAK-841] Email Archive Tool's content should be imported when using Site Archive Tool.
column6:
According to the Kuali folks, the contents of the Email Archive Tool are in the exported archive file(s) but is not actually imported. This seems to be a major limitation as many folks will need the ability to migrate the content of Email Archive to a new Site.

Thanks, L
column10: Email Archive Tool's content should be imported when using Site Archive Tool.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The plan is to make the Admin Archive tool do a complete export and import of all content, and leave the Worksite Setup duplicate/import to handle the privacy related issue cases where 'student' content isn't to be brought over from one term class site to the next. Originally, Admin Archive was all we had and so some of those special cases were handled there as well.

So content from other tools should also be checked to be sure everything is going out and coming in, for the Admin Archive tool.
column45: Post-1.5.1 work.
column49:
Fixing the import email function is critical to our migrating the Kuali Project tabs to a new instance of Sakai, collab.kuali.org. Brad Wheeler has asked that this migration be done as soon as possible, but without a working Email Archive import/export, preserving existing emails is not possible.

I understand that the Sakai 2 release is imminent. Is this bug fixed in Sakai 2?

Please contact me for any further clarifications.

Thanks.

Phil McKown
Kuali Relationship Manager
column71: Zhen, did this fix make 2.0-rc2, or do we need to wait for 2.0-rc3 to QA? Thanks.
column75: I gave this a once-over in rc2, and it didn't seem to be working. If this fix was supposed to be in rc2, we can keep trying and seeing if we were doing something wrong, otherwise this is going to have to wait until we get our hands on a stable rc3 to close.
column79:
Tried this in rc3 on Oracle. I created a site, added a maintain and an access user. I had the maintain create a couple of messages in Email Archive, then I changed the permissions on the tool and had the access create a message in Email Archive.

I then created a new site with an Email Archive tool.

Then, I logged in as admin, archived the first site, then imported it into the second site. The alert message in the Archive tool told me that it had merged the email channel, but had imported 0 messages. When I went to the second site, there were no messages in Email Archive.

I also tried setting the permissions back to the default, archiving, then importing the site, but it still didn't work.
column83: Mike, on the second site, can you confirm that you added the same maintain and access user accounts to it first? Thanks.
column92:
I had the same maintain user create both sites, but I'll have to double-check on the access user.

Generally, though, don't we want the admin Site Archive tool to be able to scoop up all content on any site and move it into any other site, no matter who made it?
column96: Worked on Oracle (8120) on rc2 as of August 8. Messages from the owner of the site and from other maintain users were imported with the Site Archive tool.

column1: [SAK-838] Add Instructor information to calendar event
column6:
Currently there isn't a way to associate an instructor (or group of instructors) with a given lecture or lab. I would like to see a series of checkboxes for all users in the 'instructor' role (or a 'Person of Authority' such as a TA or Video capture person) of the participant list appear when a new schedule item is created. Additional users could be added with an input box based on username or first/last.

We plan to use this data to automate the 'effort' piece of the 'merit & promotions' puzzle. Additionally, we could use this data to dynamically present schedule information to instructors, TAs, and techs so that they only see the relevant calendar events when they view 'My Calendar' from 'My Workspace'.

The TOC is still a little funky, as the question link does not freeze the timer. The initial TOC to question resets the timer, but that is fair, as the student shouldn't be penalized by the intial page load speed until they can see the question. Sometimes it is off by a few seconds too.

But it doesn't reset the time back to the start once you start answering the questions, so I think it is a great improvement.

The code is pretty ugly, with lots of nasty side effects I found, we should bear that in mind in investigating some code cleanup.

column1: [SAK-36329] checkbox for security setting gets unchecked when published
column6:
versions: standalone and integrated aam-dev, mysql version at mit

There's an assessment setting under "High Security" that allows you to specify which IP addresses are allowed to take the assessment. Whenever you publish an assessment, this setting is unchecked (even if it was checked in the core assessment).

This is a minor problem because the setting itself still works - it's just confusing that the box isn't checked in the published settings list.

Steps to verify:

1. Go to standalone build (http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:8080/samigo/jsf/index/index.faces)

2. Choose instructor entry point

3. View settings for core assessment "5.4 security test". Under "High Security", an IP address is specified and the checkbox is checked.

4. Then view the settings for the published version of "5.4 security test". The IP address is still in the field, but the checkbox is unchecked.

column1: [SAK-835] Can't replace an html file that was uploaded
column6:
If I upload an html document, I am suqsequently unable to replace it. I should be able to replace a document that I uploaded. This means that I should be able to replace an html document that was either uploaded or created wtih the wysiwyg.

Similarly for text files - I can upload a text file or create it in Resources. Either should be able to be replaced.

Note that the type changes if a different type file is used, so that if I replace a txt file with a gif for example, when I go to revise the gif file, it won't bring up the text editor page - just the metadata info can be revised.

column1: [SAK-834] can't edit site description in My Workspace
column6:
On my Sakai home page, the "My Workspace Information" box by default displays a "This is your workspace blah blah" message.

When I click on Options to change it, I have the choice of "display worksite description (from setup)" or "display URL".

If I choose "Display worksite description", all it says is "My Workspace Site". I can't find any way to edit that text in Worksite Setup.

Users should be able to edit the site description text for their home workspace, just as they can for any other site they set up.
column10: can't edit site description in My Workspace
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The options for changing the message from setup or supplying a URL are no longer present in 2.3 (perhaps earlier?). Instead, the message is treated as a system-wide one and is controlled by the sakai.properties configuration value "myworkspace.info.url".

Is this still a desired feature, a user being able to edit their My Workspace site's information? If so, could you provide some example use cases illustrating what one might do with this functionality?
column45: [Bulk Comment] This issue was reported as affecting versions of Sakai that are no longer supported (1.0, 1.5.x or 2.0.x). Thank you.

column1: [SAK-833] released to auth + delivered by PAU = trouble
column6:
Versions: mysql, oracle, hsqldb

Whenever you publish an assessment, a PAU (url) is generated for it, even if you only released the assessment to authenticated users.

Action: Take an assessment released only to authenticated users by pasting the PAU into your browser.

Expected behavior: You should get a Sakai login box. Once you log in, you should be able to go to Tests and Quizzes for the site and take the assessment by the normal delivery method.

Actual behavior: You get the login box, but when you go to Tests and Quizzes, the list of assessments is blank.

Example assessment: 5.3 Auth Test
PAU: http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/xtunnel/samigo/servlet/Login?id=marith1115163942954
Released to: authenticated users only

Steps to verify:

1. When not logged in to Sakai, paste the URL above into your browser.

2. You get a Sakai login dialog box.

3. Log in as an authenticated user (student/student will do).

4. You're taken to the user's Sakai home page.

5. Go to the Site "Craft 102 1".

6. Go to "Tests and Quizzes" in the sidebar.

7. Here you should see a list of all available assessments, including the one you want to take. Instead, the list is blank.

To get the list of available assessments back, log out of Sakai and back in again. Now you can see and take assessments the regular way. But you can never get to the assessment via the PAU.
column10: released to auth + delivered by PAU = trouble
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: foxed. plaese check
column45:
Verified on all 3 005 builds:
Create a new assessment released only to authenticated users..
Pasted the PAU into browser and logged on as student.
Get the SAkai login dialog box.
Login and are immediately are taken to "begin assessment" page.

column1: [SAK-831] Develop alternate event messaging system which does not depend on a database
column6: The current event messaging system uses the database to deliver messages to app servers in the Sakai cluster. The DBAs identified this as a scalability issue and requested we migrate to an alternate, non-database, implementation. I have done some initial R&D and it looks like jgroups is a good candidate for the new implementation.
column10: Develop alternate event messaging system which does not depend on a database
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I have begun work on a JGroups based implementation of event messaging which can be found at:
/legacy/component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/legacy/event/JGroupsClusterEventTracking.java.

Things left to do:
1. Research class loader/security issues with having jgroups.jar in components/.../WEB-INF/lib.
2. Package EventImpl class into shared/lib (maybe common/lib).
3. Test.
4. Document jgroups configuration to support multiple clusters (i.e. dev and test instances cannot participate in production messaging channels).
column45:
I have solicited some help on this implementation from the Sakai community via the "Project Matching Tool".

http://sakai.berkeley.edu/pm/myprojects.php?view=proj711

column83:
Adding recent discussion from sakai-dev for when someone gets to work on this:

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: Re: Unique requirement regarding SAKAI_EVENTS
Date: Wed, 13 Sep 2006 13:56:41 -0700
From: Josh Holtzman <jholtzman@berkeley.edu>
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
References: <DE7D1084DBEA224D97A6A03F688624C7915631@fangorn.cc.vt.edu> <95DDFB61-892A-4802-ADF7-5243D79CED87@indiana.edu> <45086CA6.1030003@ched.uct.ac.za>

Stephen Marquard wrote:

> Lance Speelmon wrote:

>> FYI - We developed a fully functional implementation of
>> EventTrackingService using JGroups. We did not end up using it once
>> we discovered we wanted to do data mining on the events, but the code
>> was fully tested. It would be great if someone wanted to pick it
>> back up.

svn log https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/sakai/branches/sakai_2-1-x/legacy/component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/legacy/event/JGroupsClusterEventTracking.java

> So a good solution might be using JGroups by default plus a process
> that caches & writes out the events to a table for data mining
> purposes much more slowly so that it's not a performance hit (e.g.
> every 5 min or something).
>
> Sounds promising!

I agree, this is good news. I'd like to see separate EventReader and
EventWriter implementations. This would allow implementors to choose
between jgroups (less stress on the db, but more difficult to configure
in some cases) and db polling for cluster coordination and also choose
between db-based event storage and file-based storage using
commons-logging. Of course, db-polling + commons-logging wouldn't be a
valid combination because the db would always be empty.

Josh

–
Josh Holtzman
Educational Technology Services, UC Berkeley
jholtzman@berkeley.edu
510.643.7380

column1: [SAK-828] allow skins for other types of sites
column6:
Currently, skin selection is allowed for course sites only. It would be nice to have that ability for project sites, or any type of site.

The sakai.properties file contains something like:
#for skin-unit definition
unitskins.count=3
unitskins.1=ctng.css
unitskins.2=arc.css
unitskins.3=art.css

units.count=3
units.1=CTools default
units.2=College of Architecture and Urban Planning
units.3=School of Art and Design

which are available only for course.

We should add other settings to allow skins for any particular type - e.g. something like
sitetypeskin=<type>
and then the unitskins and units.n would change to
<type>unitskins and <type>units.n,
and then any site which had a sitetypeskin setting and skins defined would get the dropdown for skins in the site info page when creating or editing a site.

so you could have
sitetypeskins=course,project
#for skin-unit definition
courseunitskins.count=3
courseunitskins.1=ctng.css
courseunitskins.2=arc.css
courseunitskins.3=art.css

courseunits.count=3
courseunits.1=CTools default
courseunits.2=College of Architecture and Urban Planning
courseunits.3=School of Art and Design

#for skin-unit definition
projectunitskins.count=3
projectunitskins.1=sch.css
projectunitskins.2=res.css
projectunitskins.3=per.css

projectunits.count=3
projectunits.1=School Project
projectunits.2=Research
projectunits.3=Personal

column1: [SAK-826] Allow presence on/off control per site
column6: Currently, users present is on or off via a setting in the sakai.properties file that affects the entire installation. It would be nice to have an additional setting in sakai.properties that specifies whether sites have the ability to turn it on/off for their particular site. This would allow an institution to either force it on or off, and optionally give them the ability to allow individual sites to turn it on/off.
column10: Allow presence on/off control per site
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Institutions that need to force it off and keep it off for legal reasons need a way to make sure it cannot be overridden. So perhaps the installation-wide setting could be changed to on/optional-on/optional-off/off, in addition to adding a site-specific on/off setting.
column45: Updating components
column49:
See SAK-2607 Closed for notes on an implementation approach for this, viz. the creation of a new permission, presence.view.

An unresolved issue is where the UI for this would be exposed (if at all), e.g. in Site Info ?
column71: Also the current presence implementation only records your presence if you view presence. So if some roles (e.g. Students) did not have the presence.view permission, then they'd never show up in presence for users with other roles, wihch may not be the intention.
column75: See SAK-2607 Closed for sakai.properties / site property settings to enable this.

column1: [SAK-825] Site Info needs Permission button to control site.view.roster
column6:
The site.view.roster permission is only settable by admins via the Admin Realm editor. Since it is a permission site owners may want to control, there should be a Permissions... button in the Site Info toolbar to allow site owners to set whether a particular role can see the site info or not.

Because some institutions may not want to give that capability to the site owner, there should be a config setting in sakai.properties that specifies which types of sites show the site.view.roster permission in the Permissions form. This would allow an institution to allow/deny site.view.roster for the installation as a whole based on site type and role in the type (by controlling the permission setting in the !site.template.<type>), and then also decide whether to allow site owners to change that. So for example, at UM, we wouldn't allow course site owners to turn on site.view.roster for students (the Permissions button wouldn't show), but for Project sites we default site.view.roster on for certain roles but would allow Project site owners to turn that off if they wanted.
column10: Site Info needs Permission button to control site.view.roster

column1: [SAK-35853] anonymous delivery workflow persisting?
column6:
version: Sakai 1.5rc11 - Sakai 1.5rc11 (1.5 standalone)

This is very weird. I"m not sure how to summarize it. Follow the steps.

0. Choose the 1.5 standalone version from http://aam-dev/nightly/.
1. Choose instructor entry point
2. View settings for published assessment "4.29 PAU test"
3. Under "Assessment Released To" category, click on the PAU.
4. New window opens - you're now taking the test in the anonymous delivery format.
5. Quit assessment, and click Quit again on the confirmation page.
6. You are returned to the standalone version of the login page (student entry points only)
7. This time, choose a student entry point (any one).
8. You get the begin assessmetn page for "4.29 PAU test" instead of your list of assessments!
9. Click cancel (get the 404 page).
10. Return to http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:8080/samigo/jsf/index/index.faces.
11. Pick a student entry point.
12. Now you get the delivery list. Pick "4.29 PAU test" again.
13. Click Begin Assessment at the begin page.
14. Notice the Quit buttons instead of Save and Exit? You're still in the anonymous workflow mode even though you're taking it the regular way.

I'm not seeing this on the integrated aam-dev 1.5 version - maybe because you have to log out and back in to switch users, and that resets things?

Nothing errorlike in the logs.
column10: anonymous delivery workflow persisting?
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Margaret - Could you delineate the expected behaviour a little bit more? Thanks.
column45:
Sorry to be unclear. There were two different problems that cropped up here, but they're probably related.

First problem:

I took an assessment via the published assessment url, quit out of it (which returned me to the entry point page), and chose the student entry point again.

What I should see: List of available assessments to take.
What actually appeared: The begin-assessment page for the same assessment I quit out of.

Second problem:

When you take an assessment via the published assessment url, you should see the anonymous workflow (the quit buttons instead of Save and Exit, etc.)

If you then take the same assessment again using the normal delivery method (choose it from the list of available assessments), you should see the normal workflow (Save and Continue, Save and Exit buttons).

Instead, the second time I still saw the anonymous workflow
(see list of steps).

Is that any better? If not, can I demonstrate it to you and we can hash out a description?

column1: [SAK-819] Unable to advance through assessment
column6:
At IU we have implemented 1.5.1-m2 on our staging environment and our production environment. In the staging environment it is possible to take assessments within the sakai framework. However, on production this isn't possible. When the user selects their answer and clicks "save and continue" the answer is wiped out and the user is still on the same page. Clicking anything else after clicking "save and continue" brings about the same behavior. I have included a before and after screenshots. We're not able to find any differences between the two environments that account for this behavior and believe that the behavior just isnt manifesting itself until its in a production environment. Please let me know if you need any access or additional information.

Note: if a user accesses the assessment via the URL in a fresh browser window, they are able to advance through the assessment.

column1: [SAK-817] Ability to change a user's name in Sakai
column6:
User request to support:

Entered on 04/25/2005 at 15:52:23 by plynn@umich.edu (ticket 19753):

In CTools, my name shows up as "P Holevinski", probably because I'm
registered as "P Lynn Holevinski". However, most people know me as
"Lynn" rather than "P". Can the displayed user name for me be updated
to reflect this?

[comment: the ability to change a name in CTools [UMich version of Sakai] is fairly common -
estimated once every week or two. We direct customers to the registrar
for a formal name change or to create a Friend account and have the
instructor add it to the site]
column10: Ability to change a user's name in Sakai
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: In the example above, user information is coming from an external source. That source is considered authoritative in CTools, and CTools has no mechanism for overriding that information locally or updating that information in the authoritative source. While the example is U-M specific, it is likely that other schools will encounter similar situations with their own providers. So one way to address to the request is to allow Sakai to hold local name information for a user that overides the offical provider. Another way would be to allow Sakai to update the information in the provider. There are also some situations, however, where the current behavior of enforced offical names is desirable, so any changes should be managable via configuration options.
