column1: [SAK-813] Bug in HSQL driver causes corrupted timestamps
column6:
A bug in Hypersonic database drivers wrt. Sakai usage causes timestamps stored in the system to be corrupted. Bug is reported at Sourceforge ID 1191815

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1191815&group_id=23316&atid=378131

This only affects usage of ResultSet and PreparedStatement when a Calendar argument is supplied (as it is throughout the Sakai codebase) but affects all known versions of HSQL including current HEAD (as of 28 April 2005 revision of jdbcResultSet.java is 1.15 of 8 weeks vintage).

I enclose a patched hypersonic driver jar with minimal changes from the 1.7.2.2 version bundled with recent versions of Sakai. The patch text is available at sourceforge and should be applicable against subsequent versions. This jar is larger than the repository version since debugging symbols have been retained.

Suggestions/Comments:
i) HSQL needs non-negligable reworking to gain proper timezone support (see sourceforge comment), although the supplied patch solves the problem 99%. Perhaps another database such as CloudScape for the "QuickStart" environment might prove more durable and performant. HSQL startup time is already > 7 seconds with the default install on average hardware.

ii) Database timestamps are probably an environmental rather than a user (client)-level issue, so perhaps should not be being supplied via API calls. The only possible function is to allow portability of database files to installations in different timezones, but this could be (and probably is already being, in HSQL) achieved by simply storing all timestamps relative to UTC. However, the Sakai usage of JDBC is within the spec and should be being supported by the driver.

My "1 minute" time estimate for this problem is based on a solution involving simply replacing the HSQL jar Any of the other resolutions would naturally take somewhat longer...
column10: Bug in HSQL driver causes corrupted timestamps
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Zhen, Can you follow up on this?

column1: [SAK-807] Help Format Inconsistent
column6:
The format used for the various tool entries in help is inconsistent.

Most of the tools have and 'Overview' entry. The basic titles on the Overview page are:
1. What is does
2. Key concepts
3. Things to consider

ISSUES:
1. The "Syllabus Overview" page has a "Syllabus Tool Overview" title on the page. The appearance of this title is inconsistent with any of the other tools.

2. The "Worksite Information Overview," "Schedule Overview," "Chat Room Overview," and "Announcement Overview" have the following introductory line.
"The following is an overview of the XXXXX feature." This line should be removed.

3. The "Announcement Overview" has a "What they do" instead of a "What it does" title.

4. The "Drop Box Overview" does not conform to the basic layout of the other tools.

5. The News menu item does not follow the convention of the other tools. It does not have an overview section, etc.

6. The link for the Site Info Tool's overview is called "About Site Info Tool." This is inconsistent. It should be renamed to "Site Info Overview."

7. The "About Site Info Tool" has a "What it is" instead of a "What it does" title.

8. The "Web Content Overview" has a "What it is" instead of a "What it does" title.

9. The font used for the Syllabus tool is different from the font used for the other tools.
column10: Help Format Inconsistent
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: These issues have been resolved as of 2.0.1
column45:
Several issues still remain.

1. The Syllabus tool's overview page has a "Syllabus Tool Overview" title rather than the new "Sakai 2.0 <Tool> : Overview" title.

2. The Gradebook tool's overview page has a "Gradebook Overview" title rather than the new "Sakai 2.0 <Tool> : Overview" title.

3. Site Info has a "What it is" rather than the standard "What it does" title.

4. Web Content has a "What it is" rather than the standard "What it does" title.

5. Gradebook has a "What it is" rather than the standard "What it does" title.

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Began research. Not fully satisfied with what I have seen. Applications are mostly native applications, or are Java applications plus some native code.

This seems to be an unacceptable requirement.
column45: have you looked at DL-Recorder? take a look at the research page on confluence above.
column49:
Think that we can use the latest Java Sound API and, possibly some other Java sound utilities.
This should be fully open source and cross platform. See the research page.

The issue of setting up the machine to record audio requires some minimal hardware and software setup.

1. recording support on PC system, and microphone
2. Java VM plugin installed in browser (we will use Java 5.0)
3. modification of Java VM security properties

I think that the audio recorder could create a cookie, and tell the user to do this, subsequently the cookie will be present and you will know the user has gotten the message.

#2 will be handled automatically by the plugin.

#3 could be handled by an executable program that edits the Java security settings that could be downloaded and run. Most promising appears to be a JBuilder uility that builds native Java wrappers for all common operating systems.

column225:
Testing on XP computer, IE browser, oracle nightly instance:

Authoring:
I was able to create and save questions in authoring without a problem

Preview:
I was able to record and play back audio in preview, although the applet showed a java error (I can't cut and paste it, and it wasn't in the logs.)

Should we allow instructors to record and playback in preview? I don't think we should. We don't let them upload files for file upload questions.

Delivery:

Published assessment ok. Took assessment as student.

Question 1: hit record, let the timer run, hit stop. There's a java message in the applet (red text ongreen, hard to read!) that says everything worked.

However, the logs say:
WARN: problem saving media: object references an unsaved transient instance - save the transient instance before flushing: org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.data.dao.grading.ItemGradingData; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.TransientObjectException: object references an unsaved transient instance - save the transient instance before flushing: org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.data.dao.grading.ItemGradingData (2006-05-04 16:09:59,342 http-28080-Processor25_org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.facade.AssessmentGradingFacadeQueries)
WARN: PersistenceService.retryDeadlock.... (2006-05-04 16:09:59,342 http-28080-Processor25_org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.services.PersistenceService)
mediaId=541

I went on to question 2. This time I recorded sound by talking into the microphone, and played it back. That worked fine. (same message in logs though).

Then I hit Save and Continue to go to question 3, and it seemed to time out trying to load the next screen. The links and buttons suddenly appeared greyed out and did nothing.

I logged out, and then an exception appeared in the logs (see attached 5.4 audio.nextpage)

Logged back in as the same user and retook the test.

No sign of my recorded answer for question 1. Shouldn't it have saved it, since things didn't go wrong till question 2? (Does save and exit preserve student's audio answers)

Also, question 1 now says "attempts allowed 2" at the top, but "attempts remaining 5" at the bottom. (see screenshot).

I hit save and continue to go to question2, and got the same timeout and exception as before.

column1: [SAK-35066] Gradebook Integration
column6: Daisy Samigo 2.0 task #4: Integrate Samigo with 2.0 gradebook
column10: Gradebook Integration
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This effort is suspended after I spent 3 days on it.

I first tried to define GradebookServce as a local bean using the Bean Definition defined by Berkeley. Spring failed to registered it 'cos GradebookService depends on 4 other services: CourseManager, GradebookManager,.. The implementation of these services were excluded from the gradebook-service.jar.

According to Josh, in Standalone environment, these should be excluded. I argued that GradebookService should be at the same level as the other services and not depends on them.

Josh countered by giving this as an example. Supposed if an instructor add a new question to an assessment, the grade of all students would need to be re-calculated.

This actually does not apply to Samigo at all 'cos our assessment is a published assessment that is set in stone and we don't need to recalculate any grades.

So I set work to defining GradebookService as a local bean in Samigo and removed all the dependency that it has. This doesn't work neither. I kept getting this SQL error:

unexpected token: as [select count(asn) from Assignment as asn where asn.externalId=? and asn.gradebook.uid=?]; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.QueryException: unexpected token: as [select count(asn) from Assignment as asn where asn.externalId=? and asn.gradebook.uid=?]

I did some troubleshooting but to no avail. Then Glenn said that sakai 2 is ready to register a standalone alone tool. So after discussing with Josh. I decided to wokr on integrating Samigo 2 with Sakai 2 instead.

According to Glenn & Josh, they have discussed the integration between Samigo & Gradebook in the conf. in Palo Alto. They came to the conclusion that the integration of Samigo & Gradebook fits Test case 4 in the Compment Packaging document. In other words, GradebookService becomes a shared component and Samigo will use ComponentManager to discover GradebookService and call addExternalAssessment().

So now I am waiting for Josh to get Gradebook service into the Compoennt Manager so Samigo can use it.

Daisy 5/2/05

column1: [SAK-800] Upload, download and extract Zip archive files in Sakai Resources Tool
column6:
In situations where WavDAV cannot be used to manage resources, it would be useful if a number of files and folders could be uploaded and downloaded into/from the Resources tool using archive files (e.g., .zip, .gz, .sit). The zip archive would then be extracted automatically on the server, resulting in the addition of the files and folders that constituted the contents of the zip archive. If one wanted to download a collection of files and/or folders, then one could go through a picking process, select the desired items, choose the type of archive, and then download it.

Combined with SAK-8110 Closed
column7: Any environment, particularly where there is no support for WebDAV.
column10: Upload, download and extract Zip archive files in Sakai Resources Tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Nice if it supported several common compressions formats on the various platforms, e.g., .zip, .gz, .sit.
column45: assumes source platform and server platform have common file system conventions (e.g. meaningful case)
column49: Ian Boston has an implementation of the new ContentHandler interface that will make it possible to navigate into a zip archive without expanding it. Will that satisfy this requirement?
column71:
It may satisfy the requirement. I do however see situations where the user will actually want to explode the archive into its constituent parts rather than offer a browsable zip archive. It's not clear to me, for instance, whether you'll be able to edit, copy or move an item contained within the archive.

It would certainly be better than nothing though
column75:
Another option is that part of the import code base extracts .zip files into resources already. According to the java doc for the class we use to do the extraction the code used should also work on .gz,

column135:
A Question,

Looking at the code all the zipping is done into temp files on disk, are those files always deleted ?

As far as you know is there any memory impact when performing the zip operation ?
column139:
>>Looking at the code all the zipping is done into temp files on disk, are those files always deleted ?

There are 3 chances to have it deleted:
A) at the end of the method which creates it when it calls temp.delete();
B) since it is created as a temp file, it should be released when garbage collected.
C) the operating system "usually" has a cron job that cleans old files on /tmp

In most cases A should occur always, but if occurs an exception and the temp.delete() is not reached, B should be enough, then in the worst case, if the VM crashes, C would be the only option.

>>As far as you know is there any memory impact when performing the zip operation ?
I don't think the compress/uncompress process would be the chief concern, but the "byte[] ContentResource.getContent()" allocates an array for the whole content, which could potentially become too large, I would be happy to replace this code for a similar using streams instead, but I found out the CHS a complex beast that I'm trying to swallow in small bites...

column237:
Status/warning messages would be nice, especially for the following cases:

1) Trying to expand a ZIP file when a folder with the same name exists in the current directory.
2) Trying to compress a folder when a ZIP file with the same name exists in the current directory.

For now, both the actions do nothing and status messages would be nice to let the user know what the problem is.
column241:
Usability issue:

Renaming a folder and then zipping it up produces a zip file with the original folder name. The name of the zip file should match the folder name currently displayed to the user. Similarly, expanding a zip file after renaming it produces a folder with the original filename of the zip.

The folder (re)naming convention now present is consistent with that in WebDav but I still think that matching displayed folder names to the zip file would result in a lot less confusion for the end user.
column245:
The zip action is available to users for the root folder of the site, but using this does nothing. Is a zip file being created above this folder?
This option should be disabled unless there is a way to actually make the resulting zip available to the user.
column249:
>Status/warning messages would be nice, especially for the following cases:
>
>1) Trying to expand a ZIP file when a folder with the same name exists in the current directory.
>2) Trying to compress a folder when a ZIP file with the same name exists in the current directory.

Agreed.

>Renaming a folder and then zipping it up produces a zip file with the original folder name. The name of the zip file should match the folder name
>currently displayed to the user. Similarly, expanding a zip file after renaming it produces a folder with the original filename of the zip.
>
>The folder (re)naming convention now present is consistent with that in WebDav but I still think that matching displayed folder names to the zip file
>would result in a lot less confusion for the end user.

How Sakai deals with file/folder display names (which are not unique) separate from the entity-id (which are unique) is a separate issue. This new feature within the resources tool should not deal with it differently than webdav, the access servlet and the resources tool do. Trying to use names for files that might not be unique within a folder will lead to other problems. The underlying problem needs to be dealt with before a zip-archive tool should be expected to deal with it.

>The zip action is available to users for the root folder of the site, but using this does nothing. Is a zip file being created above this folder?
>This option should be disabled unless there is a way to actually make the resulting zip available to the user.

Agreed. The zip file is created in the containing folder (which is "/group/" for the root folder of a site) if the user has permission to create resources in the containing folder. But most site maintainers do not have permission to see that folder, much less create resources there. The "available()" method for the action should check whether the user has permission to create resources in the containing folder so the action is not shown if the user lacks permission. But if the action is shown to the user and then fails for whatever reason, an alert should be displayed to the user explaining that it failed and/or offering advice about how to accomplish the desired action.

This patch is very similar to the initial streambased, but corrects a bug in the line:
ContentHostingService.commitResource(resourceEdit);
which sends an email to every user who configured to recieve notifications of every update.
the line was replaced by:
ContentHostingService.commitResource(resourceEdit,NotificationService.NOTI_NONE);

If this patch is not applied, SAKAI will try to deliver U x N messages, where U is the number of users and N the number of files.

This patch applies to version 2.5.X, and contains all the functionality of the previous streambased patch.

column308:
the patch content-SAK-800-20080619-2.5.x.diff can be applied to the 2.5.x branch, I'll prepare a trunk patch if necessary.

Solved Issues:
1) Trying to compress a folder when a ZIP file with the same name exists in the current directory.
if you try to zip a folder named Foo and there is a file named Foo.zip, it tries to create a folder Foo1.zip, then will try Foo2.zip, and wil try until there is a name available.

2) Renaming a folder and then zipping it up produces a zip file with the original folder name.
Now it is getting the file name is based on the DISPLAY_NAME instead of resourceId.

3) expanding a zip file after renaming it produces a folder with the original filename of the zip.
The original behavior of the patch was to create a new folder with the name of the zip file. Now the files inside the zip are expanded on the same folder, which is the same behavior we have on operating systems, creating new folders only when they exist in the file.

Open Issues:
1) Display an error message when compressing an empty folder.
Present Behavior: the compressing aborts and presentation is refreshed no file created temp cleaned.
Problems: The user won't know why his zip file wasn't created.

2) Extracting files that already exists
Present Behavior: it extracts some files then an IdUsedException is thrown, the extraction aborts and the presentation is refreshed
Problems: The user won't know if all the files have been extracted
Possible solutions:
A) overwrite the current files
B) rename current files appending .bak
C) record in a list all the files that have been created, if this error occurs, delete the files in the list and show an error message for the user
D) open the zip file, get all the filenames inside and check if all the files can be created, if it identifies a name collision, shows a message to the user indicating it wouldn't extract because of the name collision.

column324:
Not sure if this should block the release of this feature, but there is a bug in java.util.zip when extracting a zip file that contains files whose names have certain types of characters (japanese, korean, german...). This feature would inherit that bug.

SAK-15549 Closed has more information. If it becomes a big issue, maybe re-implementing ZipContentUtil using Apache Ant's Zip library might be a good idea until the Java bug is fixed (reported fixed in 1.7).
column328: As far as I know, no-one is working on the outstanding issues of this feature and it's not in any build. I'll add that to my list of known problems though as this will be resolved someday when either I have time or someone else works on it.
column332: Not sure of the status of this Jira, emailing the dev list for more info
column336: Voting for this issue on behalf of rSmart clients. Nearly every school that moves from Blackboard to Sakai has requested this capability in Sakai.
column340:
The functionality still exists in the code, but it was doubly locked away (commented out and locked behind a property) by SAK-38463 Closed when 2.6 was released. This was because of the existing outstanding issues documented in SAK-39193 Closed that are still unfixed. These taken together made it unsafe to run it production. The issues could probably be resolved if someone spent a few hours of work on it.

However, there were dev list rumors [1] of some people using this in production anyway, even with the issues. (more on the zipping side than unzipping) Though I still think it had overwrite potential, showed the unzip option even when you didn't have permission and was silent about failures. I also remember it having a possible denial of service if you had a zip file with lots of empty/small files in it. (Apache's zip library was supposed to handle this better than java.util.zip)

It is good functionality though, as the only reasonable alternative (currently) for Sakai 2 for getting a lot of files in is webdav.

[1] http://n2.nabble.com/Building-Sakai-Export-sites-from-2-4-import-to-2-6-tp4587700p4591744.html
column344: If this functionality is to go into 2.7 it should be made available soon for testing.

/usr/local/cvs/bin/cvs -q -z9 -d :ext:sakaicvs:/cvs co -P -r samigo1_5_rc1 sam

matches the latest code (see attached, import_version_on_branch.txt).

I also verified that the identical XML file broke on aam-dev, but not on my instance.

Following up on a suggestion by Daisy,

aam-dev:/usr/local/user/esmiley: ps -ef | grep java
sakaiadm 3648 1 0 07:08:48 ? 2:52 /usr/java/bin/java -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/usr/local/user/sakaiadm/nightly/tomcat
sakaiadm 3742 1 0 08:06:42 ? 1:17 /usr/java/bin/java -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/usr/local/user/sakaiadm/nightly/samigo
esmiley 3866 3861 0 12:46:18 pts/2 0:00 grep java
sakaiadm 3562 1 0 06:08:54 ? 4:19 /usr/java/bin/java -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/usr/local/user/sakaiadm/nightly/sakais
aam-dev:/usr/local/user/esmiley: ls -l /tmp
total 352
rw------ 1 juser staff 248 Apr 25 12:20 aam-service.tkt...
drwxr-xr-x 3 rgollub staff 184 Jan 21 14:57 jsf...

In other words, when the builds were switched to replace the "rgollub" user with "sakaiadm" the ownership of /tmp/jsf was not changed (no write permission by "staff", of which "sakaiadm" is a member). At is at this point that instance-specific import broke.

Examining the logs gives

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.apache.commons.fileupload.DefaultFileItem.write(DefaultFileItem.java:442)<----!!!
at com.corejsf.UploadRenderer.decode(UploadRenderer.java:84)

So files cannot be physically uploaded.

We need to remove the jsf directory, or change permissions, and retest.

Note: this fix, if confirmed, would remove this problem. It would not addres other issues.

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: This appears to be still unresolved in Sakai 2.0, using Goliath or Mac's native Go > Connect to Server Webdav functionality.
column45:
Speaking of patches to WebDAV, I didn't like the .DS_Store and AppleDouble files (the ones that begin with ._ ) popping up in the Resources tool from anyone with a mac, so I added two lines to DavServlet.java in the doDispatch method.

protected void doDispatch(SakaidavServletInfo info, HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse resp)
throws ServletException, IOException {

String method = req.getMethod();

// Suppress annoying MacOS files here
String sakaiPath = getRelativePathSAKAI(req);
if ((sakaiPath.lastIndexOf("/.DS_Store") > 0) || (sakaiPath.lastIndexOf("/._") > 0)) return;

This code ran all Fall with about a thousand users, so I don't think it's harmful. I don't know if everyone would want this, but I thought it might be interesting to many of you.

regards,
Zach A. Thomas
Software Engineer
Texas State University
http://www.txstate.edu
column49:
This was fixed in commit r5275

Add new properties to allow files matching certain string patterns to be ignored when
there is an attempt to create the file (PUT request). Set up the properties in Sakai
OOTB so that the .DS_Store and resource forks are not accepted.

New Properties for Sakai OOTB:

webdav.ignore.count=2
webdav.ignore.1=/.DS_Store
webdav.ignore.2=/._

Also change several very common log calls to be debug level rather than info level.

This should go into 2.1.1
column71:
Cool.

I did pretty exhaustive research on the AppleDouble files, and it seems that only a handful of applications, all of them old and crusty, use these files to store critical information that the master file cannot live without. As long as no one is using Sakai content storage as their primary and only storage location for files, it should never cause problems.

-Mike

On Jan 12, 2006, at 12:07 PM, Charles Severance wrote:

Thanks for the heads up - makes me feel even more confident.

And this is not exactly a foregone conclusion just because I checked it in We could decide to change the default to allowing the Apple files to be stored and make folks un-comment the properties.

But your and Zach's experience suggests that there is really little harm in not storing the files - hence the default I checked in was to ignore the extra Apple files.

/Chuck

On Jan 12, 2006, at 2:08 PM, Mike Osterman wrote:

It looks like it's already a forgone conclusion, but I wanted to throw in our "thumbs up" on this patch as well. We applied a variant of this patch for our Fall pilot that has been running for a few months with no ill effects.

Michael Osterman
Developer, Emerging Technology
Whitman College
ostermmg@whitman.edu
509-527-5419
column75:
Apple has posted some information to stop .DS_Store from being created.

To configure a Mac OS X user account so that .DS_Store files are not created when interacting with a remote file server using the Finder, follow the steps below.

Note: This will affect the user's interactions with SMB/CIFS, AFP, NFS, and WebDAV servers only.

See: http://docs.info.apple.com/article.html?artnum=301711

It would seem to be save not to write the .DS_Store file, the side effect of not store .DS_Store file will be similar to a read-only volume, client metadata for folders on mounted WebDAV volumes, such as icon positions and view options, will not be persistent from one login to the next.
column79: Gloria, any chance you could test this out?

Tested WebDAV from Mac OS 10.4.6 on Nightly (Sakai TRUNK-20060411) .

No more DS_store files - great news.

I no longer have Goliath on my machine, so did not test that.

Thanks

column1: [SAK-795] img tag accepted in Discussion reply even though a warning is issued
column6:
The img tag isn't currently allowed in htmlarea editor. If I click the <> and put in an img tag, I get a warning and can't post in Announcements. Same in Discussions, but if in Discussions I click the cancel button after the warning, the reply containing the img tag is actually posted, and the img is displayed.

I believe we prohibit img tags because we can't be sure the img URL will be accessible to all participants in the site since it is not guaranteed to be in the site's resources. But anyway we should treat them the same in all tools, and so should not allow for now in Discussions.

I'll start a thread with the TT and architects as to what we can do to allow img tags in htmlarea created content.

column1: [SAK-1949] "Assessment released to" settings linked?
column6:
version: 1.5 standalone (http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:8080) and MIT 1.5.1m2

The two settings in the category "Assessment Released to", "Anonymous" and "authenticated", seem to be linked. If you set one but not the other to be editable in a template, both can be edited in assessments made from that template.

steps to verify:

1. Create and edit a template.

2. Change the section "Assessment released to" so that either "anonymous" or "authenticated" is checked, but not both.

3. Create an assessment based on that template, then view its settings.

4. You can choose to release the assessment to both groups, even though only one group was checked in the template.

If in the template you don't check either group, the whole category is not visible in the core assessment settings. So the problem only shows up when you choose one or the other.

<samigo:wysiwyg rows="140" value="#

{assessmentSettings.description}

column45:
When you have a read only version, you don't really want a rich text editor with its toolbar anyway.
What you want is a disabled textArea control. When it is not readonly, you want a wysiwyg. So you can do back to back with a mutually exclusive rendered runtime value.

If you have to have it in 1.5x you can put it in a non-rendered panelGrid. The disabled property will be supported in the 2.0 inputRichText (in development), but you could also use this kludge to get a fix in prior. I could also try to get a disabled rich text to do a plain textarea which would provide an elegant solution.

PSEUDOCODE:

<h:inputTextarea
disabled="true"
rendered="#

{bean.readonly}

" ...
<%-- workaround --%>
<h:panelGrid rendered="#

{!bean.readonly}" ...
<samigo:wysiwyg...

<%-- in version 2.0 tags --%>
<sakaix:inputRichText
rendered="#{!bean.readonly}

" ...

column1: [SAK-793] Grading: Max Score Possible and Total Score Possible
column6:
The max score possible on the total scores view and the total score possible on the statistics view doesn't stay consistent. For example, if I take an assessment and I receive 10 points, then the max score and the total score is 10. However, if I take the exact same assessment and I receive 14 points, then the max score is 10 and the total score is 14. It's really hard to tell what's going on, but it isn't right.

What is the max score anyway? I was assuming that it was the max score for an assessment, but now I'm not so sure. Is it the maximum total points awarded for the assessment or is it the maximum number of points received by a user? If it is the max for the assessment, does it take extra credit into account? I wouldn't assume so, but you never know. Also, what is the total score? I was assuming it was the same as the max score, but again, now I'm not so sure. If there is a place where this info is written down and I can review it, just point me in the right direction. I checked the screens, but they don't have this type of information.

Sorry to be so out of the loop!

column1: [SAK-792] Grading: MCMC Question Type: Incorrect # of Points Awarded
column6: In grading, a user who takes an assessment with an MCMC question type is awarded points per answer, not per question. For example, if the question has two correct answers and is worth 5 points and the user chooses both correct answers, then the user receives 10 points for the question. column45:
This was happening on the previous version of the release. It was kinda surprising. I had been publishing and taking assessments one day. I noted that once the due date/retract date was reached, the assessment would disappear. It wouldn't go to the "Inactive" section. I made a jira entry for that. The next day when I tried publishing assessments, all the assessments would automatically go to the "Inactive" section. They would not get published. I thought maybe someone had tried fix the previous problem. Thing was, I was using the previously created assessment and changing the release/due/retract dates, then publishing. I thought that might be the problem so I created a new assessment and tried to publish that, but then I got the same result. It was put directly in the "Inactive" section.

I haven't tried this new version on 8030 so I don't know if it's still happening. I would think not. Maybe it'll happen after some time. I'm watching the behaviour.
column49: Thing to note right now is that today I was working on the default port 80 and I still see that once the due date has been reached, the assessment disappears. I'm going to see if tomorrow I am able to publish okay.
column71:
I tried this again on both the mysql and hsqldb instances today. Still couldn't reproduce the publishing-directly-to-inactive problem, but I have now once seen the disappearing-assessment problem on the mysql instance.

Steps:
Created assessment "4.25 dates test"
Set available date to later today, retract date to tomorrow
published assessment

Result: The assessment is in the published category and I can take it as a student, even though it's a couple of hours before the release time. (hmmm...time zone? investigate further.)

Next: change settings on published "4.25 dates test", moving retract date to today. save settings.

Result: assessment disappears! I don't see it anywhere, as maintainer or student. Logging out and back in doesn't help.

Maybe the starting point on investigating this is to locate the assessment "4.25 dates test" and figure out why we can't see it.

Oracle - OK - assessments can be moved back and forth between the published and inactive lists by adjusting the retract date.

Hsqldb - Assessments vanish when retracted if the retract date is set to today. If the retract date is set in the past, they move to the inactive category like they're supposed to. I also once got a null pointer exception and an interesting date format exception (see attached).

column135:
we addressed this problem by converting all the "date" column in hsqldb & mysql to "datetime". In earlier version, the time was left out so it was set to 12am by default. Changing to datetime ensure taht the time is also recoded. You can get the alter sql stmt "sam/src/mysql/samigo-2.0.0.patch1.sql" at SAK-1356 Closed

Daisy

column1: [SAK-35975] logout during delivery should = save and exit
column6:
Version: http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:16080 (1.5 int)

If you lose your session in the middle of taking an assessment (either by logging out of Sakai or closing your browser), your answers will be saved just as though you had clicked "save and exit" - except for the last question in the assessment. If you answered that question, the answer will be lost.

To verify:

1. Log into sakai and take an assessment (not via PAU, the regular way)

2. Answer every question, then either log out of Sakai or quit your browser.

3. Retake the assessment. All questions but the last one will still have the answers you put in.
column10: logout during delivery should = save and exit
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Rachel - What auto save rules were you going by for delivery?
column45: Hey, this was still assigned to Rachel
column49: Qingru - Can you take a look at this?
column71:
I just double check this and think the current behavior is expected.

There is no auto save implemented at this point. Every answer must be saved only after you click on the "Save and Continue" or "Save and Exit" button, including the last answer.

The reason you saw the last answer was not saved is that you must log out without clicking on "Save and Continue" or "Save and Exit" button for the last question. So the answer won't be saved.

Margaret, Please verify. Thanks.

column1: [SAK-774] allow multiple email address per user account - primary and multiple secondaries
column6:
Requirement:
Allow users to email into a Sakai site from multiple email accounts.

From John =======
Users frequently try to email a site from one of many accounts. If email is sent from an account that wasn't specified when the user's account was setup, it is rejected. We should allow multiple email address - a primary (where notifications and email is received), and secondary accounts (which can be used in addition to the primary to send to a site in which the user is a participant).
column10: allow multiple email address per user account - primary and multiple secondaries
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I would like to add a use case to this:

We have ldap-provisioned users, and PubCookie authentication using university-wide id's (which are of course unchangeable). However many users use other email addresses (either email aliases or alternate email accounts) when using email.

If the site is set to receive mail only from participants, they are rejected when using these alternate email addresses.

The user should be able to "register" alternate email addresses (either through ldap or through the mail archive tool itself).

Currently it seems the only recourse is to open the site to receive mail from anyone or have the users reconfigure their mail clients.

column1: [SAK-2135] Survey questions always scored as 0 points
column6:
versions: 1.5 and 2.0
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:12080

Steps to verify:

1. Log into 1.5 or 2.0 instance as a student.
2. Go to site "PHYS 101) if in integrated version.
3. Take the test "4.18 Survey Questions" or "4.18 Survey questions 2".
4. Answer questions, submit for grading, view scores as instructor.
5. All survey questions are auto-scored at 0 points, although they are worth more and they have no wrong answer.

So how should survey questions be auto-scored? I claim that if a survey question is worth more than 0 points, you should get the points for answering the question no matter what you choose. (If you leave the question unanswered, you don't get the points.)

This link does serve a useful function - it returns you to the main questions page of the current assessment. So I would vote for keeping it but changing the name to something more accurate, like "Back to Assessment".

Also, now that I think about it, would the "Remove" link be less confusing if it said "Remove Question"?

column1: [SAK-1900] show all settings in core assessments
column6:
This is a feature request from Jackie. She finds it confusing that only editable/viewable settings are visible in core assessments, but published assessments show you all the settings. She would like the same settings to appear before and after publication. (Settings marked non-editable by the template would be greyed out.)

Seems like an interesting question for user testing. Would most users prefer the simpler authoring process, with fewer settings to go through before publishing? Or would they prefer to see exactly what settings they're about to publish, even if it takes longer? I can see the appeal of both sides.

column1: [SAK-766] Leading and trailing spaces added (by browser) cause problems when cutting/pasting Resource URLs
column6:
When cutting and pasting the URL for a Resource item (by clicking the 'i' next to a file in a Resource folder), a leading or trailing space is added to the URL and that causes strange behavior when you go to use this for Webdav or adding this URL as a Redirect under Syllabus or adding it as Web Content.

Is there a way to trim any leading/trailing spaces when 'Saving' the URL for a Redirect or Web Content?

I know this is the fault of the browser and how it is rendering the URL for a Resource.

Any thoughts?
column7: Windows XP, IE6 or Mozilla.  Netscape 7.1 seems ok
column10: Leading and trailing spaces added (by browser) cause problems when cutting/pasting Resource URLs
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Remove leading/trailing spaces from URLs entered in tools. (The odds of a URL really having such white-space are far lower than the confusion caused by pasting adding a character to ones that do not.)
column45: Zhen - I think the idea was that if you paste in a URL that you copied from the browser (maybe not from using the i icon to find the URL) but from anywhere in the browser, sometimes an extra white space is added to the front or back. Though the i icon isn't there (and maybe it will come back), one can still get the info from the edit button. So this is about filtering the URL field to remove leading/trailing white space rather than specifically about pasting from the i icon.
column49:
Cheryl,
when we checked, it seems that there is a check now to remove leading and trailing spaces in the URL field when creating a URL resource. We couldn't get it to fail by pasting in something with leading/trailing spaces or typing in a URL with leading/trailing spaces. So I guess if you can recreate, give the exact steps and URL you are pasting so we can see what odd URL poses the problem.
column71: If this cannot be verified, can we mark it as resolved?

column1: [SAK-765] Use of private (MyWorkspace) resources
column6:
Everyone has a MyWorkspace->Resource area in which they can create private files, folders, and links. What is the purpose of this, however, if it cannot be reused. Users could just as well create the files and folders on their computer system [if they have one].

Proposal is to have a feature that allows a student to retrieve files from their private MyWorkspace->Resources area into a course/project Resources area, or even to be able to submit (retrieve) it into the dropbox for the course/project.
column10: Use of private (MyWorkspace) resources
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: This has been done in the resources refactoring. Users can now copy from any collection they have read access (including MyWorkspace) to any collection in which they have write access (including MyWorkspace).

column1: [SAK-764] tweaks to make the side by side list widget in 'Customize tabs' style guide compliant
column6:
The text in the Customize Tabs page reads -
You can move sites from one list to another by highlighting the site name and clicking one of the center arrows. You can re-order sites in the Sites Visible in Tabs box by highlighting a site in the list and clicking the up and down arrows.
but the buttons don't really contain any arrows, just text.

They should though, in order to be style guide compliant. So if you look at page 38 in the Style Guide, you can get an idea of what the layout should look like. Just some button appearance changes and centering labels w/o the : I think.

Style guide is here:
http://collab.sakaiproject.org/access/content/group/1075771392979-922/Style%20Guides/Style%20Guide%20Versions/SakaiSG14.pdf

Also please refer new mockup for implementation in sakai2.0, as there are few minor changes in description.

column1: [SAK-763] Help tool autodetects new content and installs index link
column6: At the moment, when new functionality is provided in Sakai and help content is written for it, the help tool's index file must be manually updated. In the future, this will be tiresome as new tools and functions arrive. This feature would perhaps provide a metatag in a content XML file that would give the default index entry, so that the help tool would detect a new link and place it automatically in the index, eliminating the need to manually update it unless the end user so desires.
column10: Help tool autodetects new content and installs index link
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: As of 2.0, the Help tool includes this capability. New tools can add their own help which will be included in the help index without requiring any changes to the Help tool's config.

column1: [SAK-35179] Matching questions need a default "select" choice in delivery
column6:
versions: all

When you look at a matching question in delivery, each pair has "A" as a default answer choice at first.

According to the spec, there should be an additional "select" answer choice for every pair. When you first view the question in delivery, all the pairs should have "select" as the default answer choice.

column1: [SAK-36012] checkmarks feedback for FIB questions not always appearing
column6:
versions: tested on 1.5 SA, 2.0 SA, and MIT's 1.5.1m2 instance.

When you're taking an assessment in delivery and you click "Show Feedback" for a FIB question, you should see green checkmarks next to each of the answers that are correct.

I created a FIB question with 3 blanks, and another one with 8 blanks. The shorter one was fine, but on the longer one the 7th checkmark won't display. I created the same question on both the MIT and aam-dev databases to check, and got the same result.

Steps to verify:

1. Go to one of the aam-dev nightly build instances and choose a student role.

2. Choose "FIB Test" to take in delivery.

3. View question 1 and click "Show Feedback" to see the answers.

4. Fill in all the answers correctly and click "Show Feedback" again.

5. The next-to-last blank ("world's") does not have a checkmark even if its answer matches the one in the answer key.

column1: [SAK-35906] new "remove part" exception
column6:
versions: 1.5 SA and 2.0 SA

The new "remove part" confirmation screen allows you to remove an assessment part while moving all its questions to another part. If you choose to move the questions to the same part you're deleting, you get an exception. (exception attached).

Steps to reproduce:

1. View a core assessment with at least 2 parts, and at least one question in each part. (example: "Final Page URL" assessment)

2. Click on the Remove link next to a part name

3. Choose the option to "remove part only and move questions to"

4. From the menu, select the same part name you're about to delete and click to continue.

5. boom!

Solution - take the part name you're about to delete out of the menu choices?

column1: [SAK-752] Unchecking checkbox item not being saved
column6:
I created and published an assessment. In the 'Settings' for the published assessment, I had checked all three of the date options (available date, due date, retraction date) and specified dates.

Now that the assessment has been published, I decided to remove the retraction date option. In the 'Published Assessment' section of the page, I choose the 'Settings' for the appropriate assessment. The date field are editable. I remove the retraction date information and uncheck the checkbox. I then click the 'Save Settings' button.

ISSUE:
When I go back to look at the current settings, the retraction date checkbox is still checked, even though the date information is no there any more.

Need to be able to uncheck the checkbox and have that setting saved..
column10: Unchecking checkbox item not being saved
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This seems like a minor issue, because the checkboxes don't actually affect the date settings.

I was able to remove the retract date in a published assessment and save the settings, and the assessment became un-retracted just like it should. Whether the checkbox was checked or not didn't matter.

(Whether it should matter is, well, another matter.) I'm going to leave this one for Marc to mull over.
column45:
With the Sakai 2.0 version, checkboxes are no longer associated with the date information. This issue no longer exists.

Unassigning & closing item.

column1: [SAK-751] Automatic refresh not working for Samigo; Inactive assessments disappear
column6:
This behaviour is inconsistent with the behaviour experienced with the other Sakai tools.

I log in on 2 machines as different types of users.

Whenever I make modifications (like publish an assessment or retract an assessment), the student's view is not updated, even if I wait for more than 30 minutes. I have to actually, as the student, exit the 'Tests & Quizzes' tool and come back to it for the changes to be visible.

On the admin side, when I publish an assessment, it is immediately visible in the publish section of the page, but if I retract the assessment (at some specified time), the retraction is not apparant until I exit the tool and return.

ON A SIDE NOTE:
When I retract an assessment, I'm expecting that the assessment will become listed in the 'inactive' section of the 'Published Assessment' area of the page. This did not occur. Is this section only for items that have passed their due dates, and not for retracted assessments?
column10: Automatic refresh not working for Samigo; Inactive assessments disappear
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The server-push refresh of legacy Sakai tools was not to be implemented in Samigo and is supposed to be removed in the legacy tool refactoring.

However, a retracted assessment should show up in the inactive list per this definition:

-past the due date OR past the retract date
-if it has a finite number of submissions and all students have used those submissions for grading (2.0)
column45:
As far as I can tell Marc's comment means "won't fix"; does it?

The second issue (inactive assessments disappearing) is covered in SAK-35167 Closed )

column1: [SAK-35757] "Timed Assessment" setting linked to "High Security" ?
column6:
version: 1.5 integrated (aam-dev:16080)

The "Timed Assessment" wasn't showing up in assessment settings in some cases when it should. I experimented and found that if the "High Security" settings are turned on in the template, the Timed Assessment ones will be as well.

Steps to verify:

1. Create template with default settings + Timed Assessment enabled

2. Create assessment from that template

3. View assessment settings - The Timed Assessment section is not there.

4. Create a new template with default settings + Timed Assessment + High Security enabled.

5. Create a assessment from that template. The Timed Assessment section (as well as High Security) will be in the settings.

I thought this must be a new bug at first, but now I'm not sure.

column1: [SAK-741] Manage user type for External UserProvider Users
column6:
It is a simple matter to give permissions (via !user.template.<type> realms) to users that are created inside the Sakai database. It is not so simple when authenticating to Sakai via a UserDirectoryProvider class and a LDAP directory (or other provider).

A previous solution (see: Dave Ross's LDAP UserDirectoryProvider provider class) offers a decent way (with some tinkering) to pull additional LDAP properties (i.e., group membership) from a LDAP directory and assign that membership to the "type" of an authenticated user. This is an elegant way to handle things, because role and identity management is a strength of LDAP.

However, there may be cases when a LDAP directory cannot provide such user type information. Currently, there is no way to give such externally authenticated users (with no stored "type"/group membership info) non-default rights/permissions. In other words, there is no way to "type" externally authenticated users when the external User Directory does not provide such "type" information.

Sakai already automatically creates a new Site for any user upon first authentication, no matter where the authentication was provided. I would love to see a way that Sakai also creates an entry in its Users table for successfully authenticated users (from the external User Directory). It would not be a full entry (i.e., with a password that overrides the external authentication) but more of a "ghost" user entry. Its main purpose would be to allow an admin to assign a "type" value to an externally authenticated user.

Example:

The only user in my local Sakai Users table is "admin." I have built Sakai with an LDAP UserDirectoryProvider class. I successfully login with "djspillers", a user in my LDAP Directory.

The next time I view the Users tool as admin, I see a new entry called "djspillers". It might even be labeled "external" somehow so I can tell it apart from a "real local user". If I click on this user, I cannot set a new password. But I can set an email address or the type for the user.

In this way, even externally authenticated users with no additional information can be "manually" controlled via my !user.template.<type> realms.

Future:

This would be a great mechanism to have in place as new User properties are created. This would give admins the ability to add user properties for externally authenticated users, or override properties retrieved from the external provider. For example, if there was an "Inactive User" property in the Sakai Users tool, a user could be manually prevented from authenticating to Sakai even though it could still authenticate to other services the external provider gives authorization for.
column10: Manage user type for External UserProvider Users

column1: [SAK-740] Foreign language support:  Icons to replace buttons with text
column6:
In order to make this system truly support foreign languages, either

1. icons should be used, where possible, in places where currently the system displays a button that has English language text, or

2. text on the buttons should be put there dynamically, based on some configuration file which specifies the language in use.

For example, icons with appropriate representation of "New..." "Next Page" "Previous Page" "Revise" "Replace" etc. should replace the current buttons, or a language configuration file containing translations of the words should be read and the text on the buttons be set.

column1: [SAK-736] Syllabus: Additional Notification Options Needed
column6:
I don't believe this has been reported yet. The original spec indicated that Notifications should be available for the Syllabus tool, but did not specify what the Notification options should be - this is my fault. The Notification options should be the same as other Legacy tools with a Notification option, which are:

None - No notification (default)
High - All participants
Low - Only participants who have opted in

Please keep in mind that the 'Low' setting correlates to the user's individual preferences in 'My Workspace'. The user has the option of opting out of Low priority notifications. Syllabus should be added to this Preferences -> Low Priority Notifications screen as well and should have the same options as other Legacy tools, which are as follows:

receive individually when posted
daily digest (summary)
block

Can you run this by John Leasia to make sure I haven't forgotten anything. Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks!

column1: [SAK-735] Blank screen on startup
column6:
Some linux servers require additional steps in order for sakai to startup properly. This is because the sakai-z-last webapp is loaded differently by tomcat on these systems. If on startup you see a number of bean creation errors (evident in the catalina.out log), and you see a blank screen when viewing sakai, you should try this workaround:

Add a context file for each war file in the jakarta-tomcat-[version]/webapps directory. This is done by going into the jakarta-tomcat-[version]/conf/Catalina/[host] directory and copying the
sakai-portal.xml to sakai-[module].xml for each war and replacing the contents of the file with the appropriate module name. Do this for each one except the sakai-z-last webapp. This forces the sakai-z-last module to load after the others, and sakai will startup as expected.

column45:
As for how to set the upload size limit for files, for 1.5 you need to edit the value in org.sakaiproject.util.ParameterParser.java:

...
/** The request size limit in bytes - 20 megs. */
protected static final int REQUEST_SIZE_LIMIT = 20 * 1024 * 1024;
...

For 1.5.1 (which should be publicly released in the next couple weeks), there is now a setting in the sakai.properties file:

...

  1. Maximum allowed size of file uploads (in megabytes)
    content.upload.max=1
    ...

column1: [SAK-729] Image resource repository for simpler referencing from WYSIWYG editor
column6: A faculty member adding visual material to a Sakai site through use of the WYSIWYG editor would wish to have an easy place within a course repository to drop image file components which could then be referenced RELATIVELY when making <img src="image.jpg"> statements in the editor. Currently such a reference would of necessity be absolute, requiring a long and ugly url. Having a folder within the repository already set up for that function would also make it easier for a faculty member to understand how to easily add images to his/her html. The folder for images within the repository could be shielded from viewing by students, though the image files themselves would of course be readable (viewable) within the WYSIWYG-created html.

column1: [SAK-727] Two different tools named "Sites" - rename one
column6:
version: mysql

There's two different tools named "Sites" within Sakai, neither of which are documented in the help system.

The "Sites" that appears in the sidebar when you're not logged in to Sakai is a search tool; it allows you to view sites and resources that have been made publicly available.

The "Sites" tool that only appears when you're logged in as admin allows you to edit the pages and tools of any site, create a new site from scratch, etc.

Is there any reason they have to be named the same thing? It's kind of confusing.

column1: [SAK-724] Unnecessary exception in logs during Sakai startup
column6: The HandleFileUploadFilter is causing unnecessary exceptions in the logs (upon server startup).
column10: Unnecessary exception in logs during Sakai startup
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The exceptions looks like:

[code]
DavRealm.start()
Apr 7, 2005 3:27:02 PM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer install
INFO: Processing Context configuration file URL file:/Volumes/UserData/Users/dlhaines/tmp/qs-samigo/try_integrated_12/sakai/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.28/conf/Catalina/localhost/sakai-dispatch.xml
DavRealm.start()
org.sakaiproject.component.framework.component.SpringCompMgr@9f01e6.get(org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.ServerConfigurationService): org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No bean named 'org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.ServerConfigurationService' is defined: org.sakaiproject.component.framework.component.SakaiBeanFactory defining beans []; Root of BeanFactory hierarchy
org.sakaiproject.component.framework.component.SpringCompMgr@9f01e6.get(org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.ServerConfigurationService): org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No bean named 'org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.ServerConfigurationService' is defined: org.sakaiproject.component.framework.component.SakaiBeanFactory defining beans []; Root of BeanFactory hierarchy
Apr 7, 2005 3:27:02 PM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer install
INFO: Installing web application at context path /jsp-examples from URL file:/Volumes/UserData/Users/dlhaines/tmp/qs-samigo/try_integrated_12/sakai/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.28/webapps/jsp-examples
Apr 7, 2005 3:27:03 PM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer install
[code]
column45:
Analysis:
These exceptions are unnecessary. They are caused by the HandleFileUploadFilter attempting to access a Sakai Service (the ServerConfigurationService) in its init() method. The Sakai services are not yet setup when the filter init() methods are called.

Solution:
Don't call the Sakai service in init(), call it later on when its really needed and when its available.

column1: [SAK-722] Web content not confined to appropriate window
column6:
I added the Web Content tool to the "NB - test" worksite. I used "Yale Univ." as menu name and www.yale.edu as URL.

1. Logged in as flmover1
2. In the "NB - test" worksite, selected the "Yale Univ." tool

The Yale page took over the entire browser window. It was not confined to the "Yale Univ." window. The first time this happened, the user was logged out of the session. The logging out process seems to occur intermittently. If more than a few seconds are spent viewing the Yale page before using the browser's "Back" feature, the user is logged out.

ISSUE:
Need to confine the web page to the relevant window within the tool.
column10: Web content not confined to appropriate window
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: See to be something particular to the Yale site. This behavious does not occur with other web sites that are accessed.
column45:
This is not really a Sakai issue, it is an issue of external site's policies.

Many websites have made a policy decision that their site should only be viewable in its own window, not aggreggated in the user interface with some other website (such as Sakai). Websites enforce this policy by putting JavaScript into their pages which detects if their site is in a frame, and if so "breaks out" of the frame. Sakai should not try to circumvent this since it is a deliberate policy decision that the external site has put in place and enforces.

Feature request:
However, perhaps Sakai could provide an option in the Web Content tool that helps to deal with these cases. The Web Content tool could have an option "Display in a new window". When that option is enabled, clicking on the Web Content tool would open a new/external window with the content in it. Sakai would not be visible in the new window.
column49: 2.1 includes a "open in a new window" functionality for Web Content. tool.

column92:
This fix is for 2.0. The workaround for 1.5.1 would be:

1. Log in as admin
2. In the admin->Sites tool, look for the 'Title' of the site and match with corresponding 'Site Id'
3. In the admin->Realm tool, find the 'Realm Id' which matches the 'Site Id'
4. Select the 'Realm Id' and you will be able to view, in the "Users" section, all the members of the site and their corresponding roles.
5. To modify the role for a particular user, select the user and, in the returned page, select the appropriate role.

column41:
Scott could you expand further on what you mean by "label" worksites?

Users are already able to set the "Site Title" when they create a project worksite. They can also edit it later on via Site Info or Worksite Setup.

Course worksites, on the other hand enforce a standardized naming convention which makes it easy for users to keep track of what is what. The out-of-the-box configuration uses Subject-Course-Section to construct names like GEOSCI 351 001.
column45: We are referring to labeling the 'buttons' in the software. For example, 'worksite setup' in Sakai could be changed to 'Common Interest Group setup' or 'CIG Setup.' In particular, this would allow for common terms to be used within OSPI (ePorfolio). The standard terms for OSPI refer to Sakai work sites as CIGs. It is now confusing to the users because the software refers to the same thing using multiple names. For example, work sites, sites, Common Interest Groups, etc.

column41:
Comment by Ed Smiley [15-Mar-2005 18:04] Delete [ Permlink ]
In process.

The pager tag will look something like:

<sakaix:pager formId="editTotalResults" dataTableId="myData"
firstItem="1" lastItem="10" totalItems="50"
prevText="Previous" nextText="Next" numItems="10" />

So far we are looking at lightweight subcomponents with an optional glue data model.
Jon is investigating the dynamic table component.
column45:
Comment by Ray Davis [15-Mar-2005 20:48] Delete [ Permlink ]
[Added here instead of Confluence because of ongoing Confluence problems. Obviously this isn't the best place for it, since all the background info is over there....]

Thanks for getting this started, Ed. I realize we're early in the process of specification, so take my responses for whatever they might be worth (or worthless).

<sakaix:pager firstItem="0" numItems="10" /> seems straightforward. "firstItem" would be optional, starting at 0 by default. "numItems" would be the page size to start with, and would probably be required.

Past that, I get confused.

1) "lastItem" and "totalItems" seem too redundant or dynamic to be tag attributes. The MyFaces "x:dataScroller" uses attributes like "displayedRowsCountVar" and "lastRowIndexVar" to let embedded components refer to those dynamic values. Is the intent to support something like that?

2) Does the "dataTableId" imply that we'll use the MyFaces "x:dataScroller" approach of pointing into a pageable table component?

3) The latest Style Guide shows icons being used to display the controls. Are "prevText" and "nextText" supposed to be ALT or TITLE attributes? By the way, MyFaces uses facets (named "first", "last", "previous", "next", "fastforward", "fastrewind"). That seems like an approach that would let us specify pretty much anything.

4) What's the "formId" for?

5) The easiest way to let application code take over paging duties (by issuing a new SQL query, for example) might be to add an attribute like ADF's "rangeChangeListener".
column49:
Comment by Ed Smiley [16-Mar-2005 11:31] Delete [ Permlink ]
Great questions Ray,

Obviously the first step is to do a passthrough of the corresponding existing component. It is understood that Jon is going to be examining each part of a "super duper data table" with an eye to interoperability; that hasn't been refined yet.

Past that, I get confused.

That is great input. Contrary to appearances, we'd like to reduce, rather than increase confusion.

We will be looking at tags from the standpoint of what is easiest to understand....

1)... Is the intent to support something like that? Yes, essentially. I am not married to the specific implementation, though.

2) Does the "dataTableId" imply ...pointing into a pageable table component? Yup. The particular approach we developed in Samigo was small simple components that you'd tie together, rather than a monolithic component. For 2.0, if we use this approach we'd be pointing to what Jon and I have been calling a dynaDataTable.

3) The latest Style Guide shows icons being used to display the controls. Are "prevText" and "nextText" supposed to be ALT or TITLE attributes? By the way, MyFaces uses facets (named "first", "last", "previous", "next", "fastforward", "fastrewind"). That seems like an approach that would let us specify pretty much anything.

Well, actually, in many cases the way that a Samigo control turned out was an artifact of the state of the spec at the point that control started getting coded. So you are right, it doesn't do anything of the kind yet. By the way textual resources like ALT tags will be in a localizable bundle in the reworked UI.

I think your proposal of subtags for this control is an interesting one. We are looking at a subtag for a multiple column for your dynamic tables.

4) What's the "formId" for?
To allow you to have a pager control outside the form it is posting. Admittedly not a really useful feature, so it might make sense to hide it. The approach was that I feared that the design team would reposition the controls in some way that would affect multiple pagers and dynamic tables (which needed support in Samigo); not a surprising event given that changes between text and icons, date format specifications, etc. that kept arriving at various inconvenient times.

5) The easiest way to let application code take over paging duties (by issuing a new SQL query, for example) might be to add an attribute like ADF's "rangeChangeListener". Noted.

Jon and I were thinking that we would probably have some data model that represents paging behavior, an event listener could trigger that model...
column71:
Comment by Ray Davis [16-Mar-2005 12:06] Delete [ Permlink ]
>>4) What's the "formId" for?
>To allow you to have a pager control outside the form it is posting.
>Admittedly not a really useful feature, so it might make sense to hide it.

It rang danger bells for me, since multiple forms sit uneasily with the JSF model. A web form submission conventionally contains all the data the application needs within that form (along with data kept server-side or in cookies). Trying to maintain bean states across two forms has bitten us in the past.

I'll try to have early proposals for paging and sorting tag specifications soon. One thing I already know I'd like you and Jon to keep in mind, though, is that it looks like the MyFaces implementations support everything Sakai needs, except that their extended dataTable (what you called "dynaDataTable") lacks a way for application code to take over sorting or paging the underlying data. After some of the dust settles on their new Apache home, I intend to suggest that they add "SortingModelListener" and "PagingModelListener" attributes to the component.

(Oh, Confluence, please start working!)

column41:
Past Comments from SAK-423:

Comment by Ed Smiley [10-Mar-2005 20:13] Delete [ Permlink ]
I suggest we might do the following:

essentially use an already developed tag: dataLine (Samigo)
what it does:supports iteration through a list, but without a table
notes on attributes: same as dataTable, but with a separator attribute, you can put a dynaCommandLink in it...it supports all the menu capability... and more

add a tag: dynaCommandLink...to add the on/off switchable command link
what it does: an alternate renderer for commandLink, renders just the name of the link if currentLink, otehrwise it works just like a commandLink.
notes on attributes: add a currentLink attribute

so you would have a dynamic list of link names, actions, and current boolean
something like:

<sakaix:dataLine value="#

{mylist.links}" var="link" separator=" | "
first="0" rows="10">
<h:column>
<sakaix:commandLink
action="#{link.getAction}" currentLink="="#{link.current}" >
<h:outputText value="#{link.text}" />
</sakaix:commandLink>
</h:column>
</sakaix:dataLine>




Comment by Ray Davis [14-Mar-2005 19:16] Delete [ Permlink ]
Just a reminder that this has the lowest priority of the gradebook component tasks, since it's not needed for final delivery. You might want to move the due date out for that reason.

Comment by Ed Smiley [14-Mar-2005 20:09] Delete [ Permlink ]
I have a solution that will eliminate the need to develop another tag entirely.

Since we will have the dataLine component you can write:
<sakaix:dataLine value="#{mylist.links}

" var="link" separator=" | " >
<h:column>
<h:commandLink rendered="#

{!link.current}

"
action="#

{link.getAction}" currentLink="="#{link.current}" >
<h:outputText value="#{link.text}" />
</h:commandLink>
<h:outputText value="#{link.text}" rendered="#{link.current}"/>
</h:column>
</sakaix:dataLine>

You would just set up a tool bean with a list of link beans each of which has properties for current and text and a getAction method.




My suggested approach (without typo) would be:

<sakaix:dataLine value="#{mylist.links}" var="link" separator=" | "
first="0" rows="10">
<h:column>
<sakaix:dynaCommandLink
action="#{link.getAction}

" currentLink="="#

{link.current}

" >
<h:outputText value="#

{link.text}

" />
</sakaix:commandLink>
</h:column>
</sakaix:dataLine>

I don't think that it would be very much work to implement if we take this subclassing approach.

if (currentLink)
{
// delegate to the HTML link renderer (super)
}
else
// render the children only
}

Comment by Ed Smiley [14-Mar-2005 20:10] Delete [ Permlink ]
Note: the suggested approach at the end there was if we went ahead and made another tag.

column1: [SAK-699] creating custom fields: irrelevant warning
column6:
version: mysql

Summary: The custom fields section of Schedule has a remove-field confirmation warning when you hit the "Save" button that says:

"Are you sure you want to remove field(s)? If yes, click 'Save' to continue."

This message appears if you removed a field, even if you then added it back and the "Save" button isn't going to remove anything.

Examples:

1. In the Schedule tool, click on Fields.
2. Type fieldname "Weasels", click Add button.
3. Click checkbox next to Weasels field, click Remove.
4. Type fieldname "Weasels", click Add button.
5. Click "Save" button, see warning.

A user creating custom fields might make several add/delete changes before coming up with an arrangement they're happy with. When they hit the Save button they should only see messages about the changes that will actually be made.

column1: [SAK-693] Uploading a folder to Resources hangs the browser session
column6:
versions: mysql

Answer: The session appears to go into an infinite loop, loading and reloading the page. Nothing appears in the logs.
To break the loop, I had to go to another workspace and return.
column10: Uploading a folder to Resources hangs the browser session

column41:
The problem is fixed on Windows platform.

For Mac, user cannot type in file name in IE and Safari. Mac Firefox and Netscape will generate FileUploadException, which cannot be handled decently and still hangs the browser session.

  • Zhen
column45:
On Mac Firefox and Netscape, this is a browser bug. The browser hangs when the user attempts to manually upload an entire folder (by typing in the folder name), and the server cannot do anything about it.

This problem also occurs on gmail.com and hotmail.com. Its a known issue with these browsers on Mac.

column1: [SAK-692] Windows WebDAV client does not auto-update when items are deleted through web interface
column6: When working with WebDAV to manage files, if the user is logged into Sakai, and has a Network Place window open that is mapped to their resources space, when they delete something from thier resources using the Browser interface, the Network Place window does not update to reflect the change. The file and/or folder name still shows up in the Network Place window, however if they try to copy the file and/or traverse into the directory, it will give an error (as the folder/file has already been deleted). Hitting F5 to manually refresh the window clears up the behavior, however not all users are familiar with this fix, and it could cause some confusion when managing files.

column1: [SAK-688]  Better UI for site access options in worksite setup
column6:
Version: mysql

When I create a new site or edit an existing one with Site Info >> Site Access, I see some "Global Access" options:

"Your site can be accessed by those you add as participants. Would you like others to have access to your site?
(radio buttons)

  • Private
  • Display my site in the directory, and share files I select

Can be joined by anyone with authorization to log in "(checkbox)

If I click the checkbox for "can be joined by anyone", the site appears in the Membership list as joinable. That's pretty clear and it's documented in the help topic for "global access".

But what does the first option mean? What does "share files I select" pertain to? The help topic doesn't mention this section.

Thanks!
column10: Better UI for site access options in worksite setup
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Will this be resolved for 2.1.0?
column45: Stephen - Lorie is no longer with the Oncourse team at IU. I'm assigning these to you for your review
column49: Stephen, is this still an issue as of Sakai 2.2? Will be resolved for 2.3? Thanks.
column71:
Using 2.1.x we get considerable user confusion about the options on this page. The page is inconsistent in it's UI - it uses both checkboxes and radio buttons to toggle things, and there is no clear indication of what is being changed. Further, when the checkbox is used, there is no clear indication of what the alternative option is.

The form inputs on this page should all be radio buttons. That makes the alternative explicit. The options also need to be rephrased so they are true opposites of each other ("private" vs "display" is not clear).

I'm attaching a screenshot of what I think would be a more understandable view of this page. In my example:

  • "Publish" becomes a radio button, the alternative is "draft"
  • "private" vs "display" becomes "display in a public listing" vs "do not display"
  • "can be joined" becomes a radio button, rephrased as "allow anyone to join" vs "limit to..."
  • changed "global access" to "general access" - while "global" may accurately refer the scope with the sakai framework, it has no contextual meaning for the end user, it might as well mean "worldwide"
  • removed the question that has no direct answer in the available options
column75:
One more issue about this page - the options presented for "project" sites are different from those presented for "course" sites but there is not enough flexibility in the text to provide instructions for both, considering the differences. You either need to make reference to an option that is not present, or ignore an option that is.

There needs to be an additional variable for explicit instructions for course sites, and another for instructions for project sites.

column1: [SAK-687] Add help topic for resource permissions
column6:
Versions: mysql, hsqldb

The "public view" option for resources is confusing and somewhat counterintuitive; it'd be a good idea to have a section in the help, under Resources, for Resource Permissions. (covering more than the PV - it could address how to share resources among sites, etc.)

Some things I established by experimentation that it'd be nice to have in the help:

o The "Public View" option for an individual resource controls whether or not anyone can view it by using the direct URL. Site members will be able to view the resource within Sakai even if the option is set to No.

o To find the direct URL link to any resource document, click on the "i" icon next to it in the list of resources.

o The "Public View" option of a resource folder controls whether or not all its contents can be viewed using their direct URLs. If you set the "Public View" option of a folder to Yes, the PV option for all documents and subfolders inside are set to Yes and can't be changed.

o Resource folders have a direct URL just like documents, but it's inoperative. You can only use direct URLs to reach individual resource items.

o How to make some of your site's resources available via direct URLs, while keeping others private: Set the "Public View" option of your top-level resource folder to No. Set the PV option for the individual documents you want to share to Yes, or put them into a subfolder with the PV option set to Yes.
column10: Add help topic for resource permissions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: And I only learned the other day that the "Public View" also controls whether you can see the site anonymously via the "Sites" tool when not logged into Sakai. That'd be good to have in the help too.
