column1: [SAK-686] Error handling for News Tool duirng setup
column6:
Versions: mysql, oracle, and hsqldb.

Steps to verify:

1. Create a site or modify an existing site in Site Info.
2. In the "Edit Tools" section select News.
3. Put a typo in the news feed address.
4. Click continue.
(see attachment for a typical result)

An typo in the address of the news feed can result in a javascript error, which you probably don't want on an end-user page. Some of these appear in duplicate as well. Errors I've produced:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://www.sakaiproject.org/cms/index3.php?option=com_rss&feed=RSS2.0&no_html=1 java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://www.sakaiproject.org/cms/index3.php?option=com_rss&feed=RSS2.0&no_html=1

java.net.UnknownHostException: www.sakaiproject2.org java.net.UnknownHostException: www.sakaiproject2.org

and this one, which I still haven't found the cause for or been able to reliably reproducen (seen it twice now):

Cannot connect or obtain a file specified by the News source URL http://www.sakaiproject.org/cms/index2.php?option=com_rss&feed=RSS2.0&no_html=1.
column10: Error handling for News Tool duirng setup
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: duplicate email error messages separated to its own inssue, sak-697.
column45:
SAK-691 Closed addresses what to do when a non-functional URL is used. It should not prevent the user from continuing the worksite set-up process, as it may simply be that the RSS feed is temporarily unavailable or has not yet been setup itself.

There is still the issue of how to handle URLs that do exist, but are not returning usable results.
column49:
Errors generated by testing the validity of the User supplied URL as a newsfeed should generate a warning to the user. They can decide to either continue with the problematic URL or they can return to the previous screen and edit the URL.

The fix for SAK-691 Closed allows errors to go by un-noticed. That should not be the case, as a user may have genuinely made a typo, rather than the RSS feed being temporarily unavailable or the like.

column1: [SAK-685] "item not available"  pages need return button
column6:
Versions: Sakai 1.5.1-m1-hsqldb and Sakai 1.5.1-m1-mysql

I noticed this in Resources, but it may be a global issue.

If you cut and paste in a URL to go directly to a page or document (for example, a document in resources) and can't get there, the error page doesn't provide any navigation links or buttons to return to your session. If you do click the back button, you get a Sakai login dialog box.

Steps to verify:

1. Log into sakai as any user.
2. Paste in URL: http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/access/content/user/marith/ ]
3. On error page, click back browser button.
You've just lost your previous Sakai session.

Since the use of browser nav buttons is not supported in Sakai, shouldn't we provide a "return" button or some other means of leaving every Sakai-generated page?
column10: "item not available"  pages need return button
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I believe this has been fixed. When user clicks on a URL item in resources, the tool attempts to open the URL in a new window. If the page won't load, the user can just close the window. BTW, the resources tool also has a "reset" button in the tool's title bar. In most cases, this will get user out of deadends, but it also loses the state the user was in just before clicking on the link.
column45: Jim, I think Margaret was referring to the case where you do not click on the link directly, but rather cut-and-paste it into your browser's address bar, thereby attempting to replace the current Sakai page with the Resource itself. This appears to work better now though too, as regardless of whether the Resource exists or not, you can use your browser's back button to get back to the previous Sakai page without losing your session.

column1: [SAK-684] Direct URL access to resources doesn't work for folders
column6:
version: Sakai 1.5.1-m1-hsqldb and Sakai 1.5.1-m1-mysql

All resource items including the top-level folder have a direct url link listed in their information (under the "i" icon), as "Stored As".

The links to resource documents/links can be used to directly access them if the resources have "public view" set to yes.

The links to resource folders, including the top-level folder, don't work.

Steps to verify:

1. log in as marith, go to "resources" in home workspace
2. Click "i" icon next to top-level resources folder
3. Set "Public View" to yes
4. Note "Stored as" url:
http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/access/content/user/marith/

5. Return to Home
6. Cut and paste in url
7. Get error message:

The requested resource: /content/user/marith/
is not currently available.

Is this intentional? Either the listed URLs should be usable, or they shouldn't be listed.

Verified with main folders and sub-folders on course worksites, accessing as both owner and as member of the site. Verified on both mysql and nsqldb instances.

column1: [SAK-675] Files uploaded to Resources aren't viewable/downloadable
column6:
Version: Sakai 1.5.1-m1-mysql

Documents uploaded to Resources display as blank html pages, just like text and html resources created in Sakai. They download as a sakai-chef-tool 'index page' instead of the actual document.

Steps:

1. As user with maintain access, go to resources > New.
2. Choose "Local file on your computer" as type.
3. Browse and select a text or html file.
4. Fill in title, description, copyright, etc and click Post.

column75:
This will be fixed in the next release (1.5.1).

Workaround:
In sakai.properties, enable sql.validateConnection. It was commented out in the original.
The line should look like this:
sql.validateConnection=true

This fixes the bug by causing Sakai to check that a MySQL JDBC Connection is open and ready to use (when a Connection is retrieved from the Connection pool).

This will be the new default in the next release.

column41: keywords: security issue
column45: is this a right usage scenario? text to inform student?
column49: Daphne, we're looking for guidance on what to do here. (1) We could leave it as-is and add text that notifies the student that an instructor can read their drafts, or (2) We could disable the ability for others to read drafts besides the draft's creator. The later solution means that collaborating instructors will not be able to read each others' drafts prior to posting; there is no way to distinguish in the current framework between the instructor-instructor and instructor-student situation. This use-case was remembered by several folks, but we don't have an idea as to how important it is to support. Thanks.
column71: I don't remember it coming up in the couple years of deployment, so I'd suggest just removing the permission, and leaving it as it is w/o that permission (that anyone can read their own drafts but no one else can). It doesn't make much sense to allow instructors to read student drafts, else what is the draft for then.
column75: I agree with John. The intention is that only author's can read their drafts. It would be good to add a feature request for more discrete permissions that look at allowing instructors to share drafts with other instructors for example. This will need some thought to ensure it doens't become overwhelming (10 user types, could mean 10 new options for each type). Since user types are set at each institution this becomes a bit tricky.
column79: Okay, then please suggest what text to show access users (i.e., students). Thanks.
column83: There's not text needed if no one but the author can read their drafts, right? Or am I missing something?
column92: Daphne, the issue reported here is that users of certain types can indeed read other user's drafts.
column96: My understanding here is that John and I agree that drafts should only be able to be read by the creator. Otherwise, it is very misleading and confusing. This means that instructors can't collaborate on drafts in discussion but the tool isn't built for that. Maybe we need a feature request if it's needed.
column127: Now that we have an expected behavior we need to implement it.
column131: Zhen - this is to remove the read.drafts permission in discussion, since it allows reading anyone's drafts, even drafts students have made.

________________________________________
From: Carol Dippel dippel@ix.netcom.com
Sent: Thursday, August 11, 2005 12:45 PM
To: 'John Leasia'
Cc: 'Nadine Blackwood'; 'David Haines'
Subject: RE: REQUEST: SAK-669 Closed

Thanks, John! Yes, I was referring to remaining item #2. I will close this item referencing this email for context. It doesn't seem worth consideration as a Feature Request for the reasons mentioned. Let me know if you disagree. -C.

________________________________________
From: John Leasia jleasia@umich.edu
Sent: Thursday, August 11, 2005 12:36 PM
To: Carol Dippel
Cc: Nadine Blackwood; David Haines
Subject: Re: REQUEST: SAK-669 Closed

669 is about 1) delete icons weren't showing in chat (fixed) and 2) if you delete a chat message, everyone else looking at chat sees the message until 'something happens' to cause a refresh (they move to another tool and back, a new chat message comes in, they login etc.).

I think 2) will be hard to fix - should be a feature request I guess, and has to do with how we update, which was changed I think for accessibility reasons. It's not all that bad, since if someone is in chat, and someone posts a message, they've seen it anyway. If someone else deletes it, it will go away when the next chat message comes in. If they weren't in chat, they wouldn't see it as it would be gone when they come into chat.

So, though the deleted chat message lingers a bit, it gets removed pretty quickly and though it may not be optimal, it's not critical. SAK-669 Closed relates to SAK-1462 Closed - both are marked as fixed in earlier 2.0.1 builds.

John

REQUEST:

Will you pls. review Feature Request SAK-669 Closed and pls. advise? Pls. review above list to see if there are any other items you can close.

Thanks! --C.

column1: [SAK-36339] importing questions - leaving screen should cancel operation
column6:
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:16080 (1.5) and
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:12080 (2.0)

Summary: When you start to import a question from question pools into an assessment, you can choose to go somewhere else (like My Templates, or another section of Sakai altogether).
If you do that, then question pools will be stuck - whenever you return to question pools, you'll see the import screen instead of the main qp screen.

If you leave the import process by clicking on a link or button to go somewhere else, that should cancel the import just as if you clicked the cancel button.

Steps to reproduce
-In authoring mode, choose an assessment (call it A).
-Go to the questions page and choose "import question from question pool" from the pulldown menu.
-You'll see the "choose a pool" screen. Instead of choosing a pool, click on the "My Assessments" link. This should cancel the importing question process,but it doesn't.
-Click on "Question Pools". Instead of the main question pools page, you'll see the "choose a pool to import" page again.
-Click on "My Assessments" again and choose another assessment (call this one B).
-From the questions page of assessment B, choose "Question Pools" again - you still get the import page.
-This time, choose a pool and then a question to import. Click the import button to return to assessment B.
-The question wasn't imported into assessment B. It was imported into assessment A, its original destination. Confusing!

column1: [SAK-35856] "unanswered question" markers faulty for FIB, matching questions
column6:
http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:8080 and http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:16080

When you're viewing an assessment TOC in delivery, questions that you haven't answered yet are marked with an arrow symbol. Just viewing a question shouldn't remove the 'unanswered' marker.

Steps:
Take an assessment with a TOC (ex: 3.28 Faces Context)
View all the questions using the navigation buttons, but don't answer any.
When you get to the end, return to the TOC.

The FIB and Matching questions will be marked as answered, even though you haven't done anything but view them. The other questions will still have the 'unanswered' arrow.

Verified on standalone and integrated instances.
column10: "unanswered question" markers faulty for FIB, matching questions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This bug took me a lot of time and I finally located where the problem is. isUnanswered() is based on itemGrdingData's PublishedAnswer() and AnswerText(). such as
if (data.getPublishedAnswer() != null || data.getAnswerText () != null)
return false;

But PublishedAnswer is not null for the questions typed in FIB or matching ( I didn't find where this value be set for these two types) even there are no answer. So I can just change FIB type to test if answertext is null or not.
But for Matching type, because there are always no AnswerText, so its unanswered() or not can't be tested by AnswerText or PublishedAnswer. I don't know which other properties can be used to define it is answered or not?

Rachel, please help me with this issue. Thanks a bunch!

Qingru
column45: In ui/bean/delivery, you'll see FibBean and MatchingBean, which each have a setResponse() method that marks them as answered. My guess would be that somewhere in ui/listener/delivery/Delivery...Action there's a call to setResponse() when the item is created or viewed, that's setting that response. Can you look?
column49:

Thanks.

column49:
until this is fixed, simply manually delete the user's site when you manually delete the user.

Right now, we don't delete any artifacts in this sort of situation. When we delete a site, we don't automatically delete the site's content.

I want to revisit this after 2.0 is released.

  • Glenn
column71: Will this be fixed for the 2.1.0 release?
column75:
At this point, this should not be characterized as a "bug" because this is how the system is designed to work. Because users may come and go, we do not expunge all evidence of the user's existence when the user goes away.

Given that Sakai completely externalizes its user directory through a provider, there is no sure way to even "know" when a user has disappeared. It is a bug if some tool fails to handle the non-existance of a user gracefully.

At some point in the future, our "user IDs" will become real GUIDs rather than "Enterprise IDs" like "csev". At that point, we will have many deep design discussions as to who to handle users as they come and go. This will be a very complex discussion and require complete new features to be built to properly handle this.

Until we make that design change and the supporting changes needed, these type of "bugs" should be tracked and given a relatively low priority as they are not really bugs.

column49:
Without deatils for reproducing the issue, then its not easy to troubleshoot. The most common cause for rejection, when you know someone is a member of the worksite, is that their from address does not quite match the email address with which they've registered. For instance, they might have registered using smith@umich.edu, however, their email client or SMTP server might be seting the from address to smith@somehost.umich.edu.

If it isn't something simple like that, then I would suggest that you pose this issue to the larger audience of sepp-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org. Someone out there in the larger group may have run into similar problems and be able to offer additional suggestions.

column1: [SAK-647] Accessibility--Enhance "Refresh" function (Stage-1)
column6:
Refresh Change Request
Goal:
Allow screen reader users to successfully use Sakai (refresh bumps screen reader to the beginning of the page every 10 seconds)
Get rid of annoying click and page redraw every 10 seconds
Keep current dynamic update functionality

Stage 1
Implement refresh in a way that the browser doesn't click or repaint the screen with each refresh. The screen will only be repainted when there has been a change in the active tool. This likely utilizes JavaScript and XmlHttpsRequest technology.

Refresh control will still need to be user controlled for this stage since, however infrequent, refresh will disrupt the AT user. If stage 2 does not make the 2.0 release plan, we should look at improving the flow for this control. A potential solution is to (display a hidden for sighted users) message or link on the first page users hit upon log-in to take them to the page where the control exists.

Stage 2
Implement "you've got mail" type functionality that will display a message to users that let's them know something has changed in their active tool (or maybe in the site in general) and allows them to choose to see those updates. Screen reader users will likely have some sort of sound alert. We'll potentially give the users a digest of what's new. TTools team will design in the legacy tools refactor project.

Exception: By default, chat tool will refresh and will implement an "accessibility mode" for screen readers that allows them to manually update the page.
column10: Accessibility--Enhance "Refresh" function (Stage-1)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: We have accomplished Stage 1, by making "Do not refresh" the default, and changing code so that background refreshes remain hidden to browsers. Screen readers, for example, are not triggered by Sakai refreshes when "Do not refresh" is turned on in Preferences.
column45: Stage-1 resolved in 2.1.0.001 release.
column49: See SAK-2506 Closed for further discussion of Stage-2.

column79:
Okay, I have a reproducible example! Try these steps:

1. log into hsqldb instance as marith/marith
2. Go to site CRAFT 102 1
3. In site, go to Tests and Quizzes
4. View settings for "4.27 Anon test 1"
5. In settings, click on the PAU:
(http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/xtunnel/samigo/servlet/Login?id=marith1114631291698)
6. Test opens in new window
7. Click begin assessmetn, take test, click Submit for grading
8. On submission confirmation page, click OK
9. that window goes to My Workspace - good.
10. Close that window and return to the original one (you should still be in assessment settings)
11. Click on Assignments. (or another sakai component)
12. Return to Tests and Quizzes
13. Aha! Blank My Assessments page.

At this point you're stuck with that blank My Assessments page - even if you quit and restart the browser, you'll return to it. Logging out of Sakai altogether will fix it, though.

Does that help?

column41: There are 2 places where exports/imports happen and so where Syllabus exports need to be implemented - the Admin Archive tool, and in Worksite Setup/Site Info.

column49: The feature request for Syllabus to import, export, and be duplicated has been reported before in other issue reports.
column71: The feature request for Syllabus to import, export, and be duplicated has been reported before in other issue reports.
column75:
Archiving feature for syllabus works as follows:
Since Syllabus tool is page scoped and not site scoped as rest of the Sakai tools, it exports the entire site including individual pages in the sites containing syllabus data as described in attached dtd file. Upon importing form Admin Archive tool it reads the archived xml file and imports each page as a new page in to given site with the same page title as exported sites page title.
When importing from Worksite Setup->Revise->Import, set of data the syllabus data residing in each page of the From site is copied to each existing page in To site.
column79:
The archive feature in syllabus works as described above keeping in mind the "page scope" of the tool. If any deviation in archive functionality is required, feel free to document and reopen this issue.
Thanks
Rashmi
column83:
Site Archive tool successfully exports/imports Syllabus.

Non-admin users still cannot import Syllabus through Worksite Setup, but that is captured by two feature request tickets.

column1: [SAK-636] Intermittent exception on server startup - ConcurrentModificationException
column6:
Sometimes when the server is started (when Tomcat is started), the following exception occurs. When the exception occurs, it causes the startup to fail. The server (Tomcat) must be then shutdown and restarted in order for Sakai to work again. This happens sometimes when the server is started up from a fresh deploy. This is not a severe bug since it only happens on startup, occasionally.

Workaround: Just restart the server.

The exception looks like it may be a Tomcat failure of some kind.
column10: Intermittent exception on server startup - ConcurrentModificationException
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Zhen Qian (zqian aT uMich.edu) found the following archived email that may pertain to this exception:

https://www.gridlab.org/pipermail/gridsphere-users/2004-December/001659.html

"
Since upgrading from 4.1.x to 5.0.28, I noticed that frequently Tomcat
would not start up properly upon restart. This happened about half the
time I tried to stop and start. The symptom of a failed restart would
be a blank page in the browser and a message like this in catalina.out:

...

  • Starting Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8443
  • Starting Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8444
  • Error registering contexts
    java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
    at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:782)
    at java.util.HashMap$EntryIterator.next(HashMap.java:824)
    at java.util.HashMap.putAllForCreate(HashMap.java:424)
    at java.util.HashMap.clone(HashMap.java:656)
    at
    mx4j.server.DefaultMBeanRepository.clone(DefaultMBeanRepository.java:
    56)
    at
    mx4j.server.MBeanServerImpl.findMBeansByPattern(MBeanServerImpl.java:
    1603)
    at
    mx4j.server.MBeanServerImpl.queryObjectNames(MBeanServerImpl.java:1568)
    ...

Looks like the $CATALINA_HOME/bin/jmx.jar file that ships with 5.0.28
is buggy. I downloaded a newer copy (version 1.2.1 binary) from
http://java.sun.com/products/JavaManagement/download.html and copied
the new jmxi.jar file to $CATALINA_HOME/bin/jmx.jar (renaming it from
jmxi.jar to jmx.jar to match the original filename and avoid classpath
modifications), and now Tomcat starts up perfectly every time.
Hopefully this saves someone else the frustration I endured for weeks
column45:
From the Sakai mailing list:

For what it's worth:
I see this stack trace frequently restarting Tomcat working on projects unrelated to Sakai. A Tomcat issue rather than a Sakai issue.
column49: Dave, not sure if this should be you or not - if not, please reassign.

column1: [SAK-633] Enable choice of skin for unpublished sites
column6:
It appears that before a site is published, regardless of the "skin" setting, it uses "pro.css".

Feature Request: Have the skin setting actually work work for un-published sites.
column10: Enable choice of skin for unpublished sites
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Using the pro.css skin for an unpublished skin is by design - that skin should have an 'unpublished' icon at the top of the left hand menu column to give the owner a reminder that the site is not published. We frequently have support issues about why participants can't get to the site, and that is an attempt at making it clearer to the owner that the site isn't published yet.
column45: I thought that might be the case, however the design seems to have a flaw. I'm still able to go in & change the setting, it just has no effect. I should also be able to set what a non-published site looks like. I suppose I could just modify the "pro" skin, but still I shouldn't be able to modify a setting that has no effect because a different behavior is hard-coded.

column1: [SAK-632] drop boxes intermittently accessable by those with access priv
column6:
Drop boxes are intermittently accessable by those with access priv in a site. A user (w/ access priv) will look at the dropbopxes and be able to see all students folders and update/delete items in them. We have had a couple users report this behavior, but it isn't consistant or persistant. Today (3/23) I was able to replicate this behavior on stable (1.5.0) between 5:20-5:30pm. I took three screenshots, which appear in chronologicalorder; which I'll attach. Please let me know if you need further info

IM205046
column10: drop boxes intermittently accessable by those with access priv
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The problem may be that dropboxes are tied to Resources permissions. So if in the site the user has write permission to Resources, then they will be able to see all dropboxes. Dropboxes was originally cloned from the Resources tool, and wasn't thought to be used in project sites (where participants often have write priveleges), but were intended for course sites, where there is a more definite spearation between instructor and student.

There is another Jira out there about separating the dropbox permissions from resources.
column45: SAK-175 Closed identifies a number of permission changes that need to be made for the default install, including identifying this problem; however, this one requires more than just a default setting change. This issue needs work on Drop-box/Resources to separate their permissions, as John mentions above.
column49: keywords: security issue
column71:
This could be due to the problem that dropboxes, spawned from Resources, are using the same permissions as Resources. So if someone sets 'new' permission on in Resources for a particular role, then that role sees all dropboxes.

There is another Jira to decouple dropbox permissions from resource permissions - assigned to David I believe, along with several other permission related problems. I think those all have been marked post 2.0.
column75: See SAK-436 Closed - this was fixed by disallowing any DAV access except to /user/* and /group/*.
column79: The new permission in Resources and Dropbox still behaves strangely (if you check it in Resources, it becomes checked in Dropbox), but I was unable to see other students' dropboxes, no matter whether New was checked or not.

column1: [SAK-1912] need page for "exceeded # of allowed submissions"
column6:
If an assessment has a limit of 2 submissions per user, then after user "blob" has taken and submitted the assessment twice it will no longer show up in his list of available assessments.

"blob" can still try to take the assessment using the PAU, though. He will see the "assessment not available" page right now.

It would make sense (I think, anyway) to have a specific page for this that says "You have already taken this test the allowed number of times." instead of just sending them back to the instructor.

column1: [SAK-629] Syllabus title bar not implementing helpEnabled=true by default
column6:
In the default sakai.properties file, the helpEnabled variable is commented out by default:

#should the title help button be visible? By default it is.
#helpEnabled=false

Even though this variable is disabled (commented out), help should be enabled by default. So really, the only setting that would affect the behavior of help would be:

#should the title help button be visible? By default it is.
helpEnabled=false

Please modify the code that paints the context sensitive help icon in the JSF title bar. Thanks, L

column1: [SAK-627] creating course site doesn't handle future terms
column6:
When a user wants to create a course site for a future term, and the registrar data for that future term is not yet available, the worksite setup flow needs to be aware of that, and provide appropriate info to the user as to how, eventually, the class roster can be hooked up to the site.

It is often the case that instructors want to setup their class site for a future term before registrar info is available for that term. We haven't been adding the future term choice to the dropdown because of the support issues involved in straightening out the site when the registrar info does become available. But then instructors go ahead and setup the site anyway, which causes other support issues in changing the site term later, wrong class roster connected. etc.

Some way of better handling future term selection is needed. Mockups have been created which add a path through wsetup when creating a course for a future term where registrar data is not available.

This path should be taken when a term is selected when the current date is before n days from start of term. n should be a setting in sakai.properties.

The path when such a term is selected doesn't attempt to add a provider id, but allows the user to setup the site for the proper term, with the proper name, and gives info on how to attach the roster at the appropriate time.

The mockups include changing to the use of roster when referring to the student rosters associated with a class. The change to flow to accommodate future terms is shown on page 11 of the mockups - screen WS14B. Where '4 weeks' is refered to in the mockups, n should be used.

column41:

Second: Does this address the problem of setting up a site for a future term? I still can only select through Fall 2005. Is this change only supposed to support users who want to create a site for the next semester, even before the registrar's information is available, but isn't supposed to support a user who wants to set up a site for next Winter?

column1: [SAK-626] project site title field not editable in worksite setup
column6:
The site title field is not editable by users, but should be, in project sites. It should not be editable for users in course sites. To make it more generic, perhaps a sakai.properties value for those site types which can have their title edited should be added (or a value for those sites whose title can't be edited?).

The ability for an administrator to edit the field in Wsetup, when users cannot, has caused confusion amongst support (telling users to go edit the field because they see they can edit it). So, since admins can edit the field using the Admin site tool, and since the Site Management tool provides that capability, the 'feature' of allowing the admin to edit the title field for any site can be dropped from wsetup, and whether the field can be edited can be controlled solely by the sakai.properties setting.

column1: [SAK-623] Final Page URL for assessments appends PID
column6:
A "final page URL" can be set when publishing an assessment. When a student takes the assessment and submits their answers for grading, they will see a link on the confirmation page to the final page URL.

This URL displays correctly in both assessment settings and on the confirmation page in delivery - but when you click on it, the Sakai PID is appended to the URL.

Example: Set "http://www.google.com" as the final page url.
When the student clicks on it, they'll go to:

http://www.google.com/?pid=1110490473654-722

and get a 404 error.

This does not happen in the standalone 1.5 version of Samigo. It does happen on both the integrated 1.5 version on aam-dev, and the sakai-stable.mit.edu 1.5.0 version. (The 1.5.1m build isn't yet available.)
column10: Final Page URL for assessments appends PID
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Core bug:
What this means is that the external URL is being passed through one of the HttpServletResponse.encodeURL() methods, which append Sakai-specific framework information (the pid).

Alternative solutions:

  • Don't pass external URLs (URLs that point to outside of Sakai) through the HttpServletResponse methods. These methods are for preserving the framework information in the URL, and URLs to external systems outside of Sakai don't need that information. This is probably the easiest, quickest, least likely to break something solution.
  • Change the filter that wraps the HttpServletResponse methods, so that if an external URL is passed in, the framework information (pid) won't be appended to the URL. This is tricky because it may not be easy for the filter to determine if the URL is to another system or not. This is probably a better long-term solution, however, so that the same issue won't come up again somewhere else.
column45:
Hi Margaret,

Can you check for me? I just fixed it on Monday morning. So you may need to wait for the next build. Thanks.

Daisy
Note: got a work around.
onclick="javascript:window.open('#

{delivery.url}

','_top');"

Daisy

column1: [SAK-618] Email Archive not properly configured when creating a new worksite.
column6:
When a user creates a new worksite – in this case I'm creating a new project site on the MIT-Stable server – the Email Archive tool is not being correctly setup. First I goto Worksite setup as a regular user with proper access, and create a site with all the tools turned on, including Email Archive. I also Publish the site, make it non-Private and assign the access role to joiners.

When I go to the worksite after creating it, and go to the Email Archive, I see a message indicating "You are not authorized to send mail to this worksite." Going to Permissions I see that maintain does not have the "new" permission checked, and my account is a maintain account since I created the site, so I check it. I still see the not authorized message. Logging out and back in does not help.

If I logout and log back in as admin and go to the worksite from Worksite Setup, then it still says not authorized. If I return to Worksite Setup, select the site and revise it – and at least go through a couple steps though not neccesarily changing anything – then the next time I look at the Email Archive it is working properly.

I suspect the channel is not getting created. (I believe others have encountered this error as well and inquired via one of the Sakai email lists.)
column10: Email Archive not properly configured when creating a new worksite.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The mail.new permission is not checked on by default in Sakai OOTB for the maintain role in the !site.template realm.

The maintain role should by default be able to email the site, so the mail.new permission should be checked on.
column45: Verity that still issue for 2.0.
column49: We can verify this bug does indeed exist on the oracle stable instance per Craig C.
column71:
I'm still seeing this bug on the oracle stable instance. (2.0 a4).

The workaround remains the same - log in as admin, revise the site in worksite setup, and tweak a few things. So at present anyone who creates a site must ask their local admin to 'kickstart' the email archive before it can be used. Doesn't look real good.

Also, when I added the Email Archive tool to my site, I chose a site address name of "marith-oracle". But that's not the address that got created - when I go to the tool itself, I see this address instead:

org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.alias.BaseAliasService$BaseAliasEdit@6ae35c8c@sakai-stable.mit.edu.

=
column75: This is still an issue. Catch!
column79: This issue remains a blocker, as the Email Archive tool appears not to work unless an administrator manually touches a site.
column83:
Permissions! mail.new is needed by maintainer types.

Verified in hsqldb, needs to be verified (against a brand new database from auto-ddl) on mySql and Oracle
column92:

column1: [SAK-544] Schedule printing to PDF mangles international characters
column6:
Jie Wang jiewang1999 (aT) yahoo.com reports:

Another problem we found is the language support of
Adobe used in SAKAI, at least in 1.0. When we print a
schedule to a PDF file, it cannot be properly
displayed. Maybe this can be resolved by using the
proper language support in Adobe.

Suggestion: Investigate Adobe PDF support for Unicode/UTF-8 characters. Maybe we can generate better PDFs that will handle international characters.
column10: Schedule printing to PDF mangles international characters
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Confirmed that the bug occurs on CTools. Confirmed that the bug occurs on sakai-stable (version 1.5.0).
column45: Daphne, Here's one for your legacy refactoring project. International support is broken in Schedule. Its doesn't produce proper PDFs.
column49: Did this work before the legacy refactor? If not, then it should be handled outside this project to alleviate scope creep. If it is a new issue, my guess is that it is related to the intertionalization that went on outside the legacy refactor project...but that's just a guess.
column71: Can we have an update?
column75:
I've confirmed that this is still a bug.

This has been a bug for a long time. It is NOT related to the legacy tool refactoring - the bug has been there from the beginning. My guess is that it has to do with the PDF-generation code.

No one has investigated fixing this bug recently, to my knowledge.
column79: Will this be resolved for 2.1.0?
column83: Will this be resolved for 2.3.0?
column92:
I was able to fix this using Feliz suggestion by using an unicode font with FOP. The font is DejaVu Sans and, at a first glance, there are no license imcompatibilities (see attachment DeJaVu_Sans_LICENSE.txt) with ECL.

The patch allows the PDF generation using a FOP options file pointing to the new font metrics generated against the normal and bold variants of DejaVu Sans. The files in the zip must be uncompressed in calendar-impl/impl/src/config (will add a new fonts/ folder).

Ideally, this fonts/ folder should be in a easily and accessible way from other tools who intent to use FOP (the provided files are for FOP 0.20.5, should be easy to provide for the latest version), probably under the library/ module .

DejaVu Sans Font:
http://dejavu.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Main_Page

Language coverage (2.25):
http://dejavu.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/dejavu/tags/version_2_25/dejavu-fonts/langcover.txt?revision=2194&view=markup&pathrev=2230

Unicode coverage (2.25):
http://dejavu.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/dejavu/tags/version_2_25/dejavu-fonts/unicover.txt?revision=2194&view=markup&pathrev=2230

Nuno
column96: Great patch – thank Nuno! I'll post a question to sakai-dev regarding 2.5.x
column127: While this fix works for Russian, the fonts do not support Japanese or Chinese.
column131:
Just want to clarify that this patch allows for any kind of fonts to be used – which was not previously the case. Now, if someone wants to use Chinese fonts can do it. But Sakai cannot distribute all fonts for all languages, I do not consider this a limitation of Sakai. If someone wants, can buy a font, install it, and Schedule will print a pdf of it.
It just happens that this font has a good Unicode coverage, and can be distributed free with Sakai.
column135: I tend to agree and am once again marking this issue as resolved. SAK-13686 Closed covers the issue of missing (Japanese/Chinese) fonts.

column1: [SAK-35446] Assessment scores not showing up on delivery page
column6:
Build: 2.0 standalone nightly
(http://aam-dev.stanford.edu:12080/samigo/jsf/index/index.faces)

Example assessments: Timed Test 1, Timed Test 2, TT No Feedback

Steps to reproduce:

1. As a student, take an assessment and submit your answers for grading.

2. As a student, return to the list of submitted assessments and note the Scores column. The assessment you just took will have "n/a" in the scores column, even if part of it was auto-scored.

3. As instructor, grade the assessment you just submitted and make an adjustment to the final score on the Total Scores page. Click Update.

4. As a student, return to the list of submitted assessments and look at the now-graded submission in the list. Either the score will still say n/a (Timed Test 2, TT No Feedback) or it will reflect the auto-scoring but not the adjustment you made in grading. (Timed Test 1).

The time column is also replaced by n/a (see SAK-366 Closed ).

I'm not sure why one of these assessments shows the auto-scoring and the other two just show n/a. All three are timed assessments, and both Timed Test 1 and 2 have immediate feedback set.
column10: Assessment scores not showing up on delivery page
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I'm not entirely sure they're connected, but both bugs are triggered by grading assessments and both show up on the main delivery page.
column45: fixed. The score now points to the final score, and won't change to n/a even after a grading.
column49: Looks good now in the 2.0 nightly SA build!

column1: [SAK-540] Support non-UTF-8 international character sets
column6:
Sakai currently supports only the UTF-8 character encoding. This allows for many international uses of Sakai. However, some partners want to use some other encoding, especially for Asian languages.

For example, jiewang1999 <at> yahoo.com reported the following:

>Hope someone could give us a pointer.
>
>We are trying to run Sakai in an all Chinese environment and found the >following problem:
>
>1. Because the environment requires encoding be GB2312, we change the setting in browser to GB2312;
>2. However, the Chinese characters we input into the database, such as tag names, can only be properly displayed with the browser setting set to UTF.
>3. We tried to set the coding for the database and IE to GB2315, but it does not seem to make any difference.
>
>Any idea how to deal with this problem?
column10: Support non-UTF-8 international character sets
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This is part of internationalization.

Sakai should continue to uniformly store strings as UTF-8.

However, localization for language and encoding is needed on input and output.

References:
W3C Internationalization
http://www.w3.org/International/

Java Internationalization
http://java.sun.com/j2se/corejava/intl/index.jsp

J2EE Internationalization
http://java.sun.com/blueprints/guidelines/designing_enterprise_applications_2e/i18n/i18n.html

Java Internationalization Tutorial
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/i18n/index.html
column45:
Another internationalization resource:

http://www.i18ngurus.com/
column49:
See the Collab site, "I18N and L10N", for further details on this work.

http://collab.sakaiproject.org/portal/site/1117804916661-111798

column1: [SAK-536] Sakai Quickstart should support MySql out of the box.
column6:
Many people are using MySql for Sakai. Several problems have shown up in testing. If MySql was supported for Quickstart then it would support the db of choice and the MySql implementation would be more fully tested.

This is not fully possible since we won't be running a private instance of MySql under Sakai's control as we do with Hsqldb. There will need to be an additional step where the MySql database is initialized. Startup.sh will need to be checked to ensure that the database method option is effective.
column7: Sakai Quickstart should support MySql out of the box.
column10: Sakai Quickstart should support MySql out of the box.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Proposal: Running MySQL with Sakai could be simplified by a command-line setup program (wizard).

The setup program would query the user for the DB connection parameters the first time it was run. The wizard could ask for the parameters like machine, port, admin account name, admin account password, desired sakai database, desired sakai DB username, desired sakai user password, etc, and then automatically create the starter DB in MySQL and populate sakai.properties.

This shouldn't be too difficult to write as an Ant script. The only part that might be OS-specific might be the actual DB populating; although if we did this through JDBC, that part would be in Java and would be cross-platform as well.
column45: The new 1.5.1 Quickstart puts the database information in database specific configuration files. There will still be a need for a MySQL or oracle server setup but as long as the database connection file is kept up to date.
column49: Quickstart will only support hsqldb.

column1: [SAK-532] Unable to add user to a site
column6:
I am unable to join the published/joinable site QA 381 on sakai-stable.mit.edu

I logged into the site as admin and then tried to add my ID to the site and the program returned an error that my ID (cheryl.wogahn@yale.edu) was not a valid user ID.

I was able to successfully join all other sites that were published publicly.

Thanks!

Cheryl
column10: Unable to add user to a site
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Were you trying to add the user in worksite setup, logged in as an admin, using the Add Participants page, or in the Admin's Realm editor, or logged in as the user and using the Membership tool? (I don't think it was the last one, but since you mention the site was joinable maybe).

If you were using Wsetup Add Participants, where did you type the email address in - in the Username field or Guest account field? You would get that error if you tried to enter an email address in the userid field, or a userid in the guest field of the Wsetup Add Participants page.

Whether a site is joinable doesn't impact adding a user via Worksite setup or the admin's realm tool. Joinable allows a user to self-join a site via the membership tool. But if an admin, or site owner, tries to add a user, whether the site is joinable or not doesn't matter.
column45:
Logged in as admin, it looks like the "QA-381" is missing its "Site Info" tool. So I guess you couldn't have been trying to add a user from there. That is strange, and perhaps part of the problem.

John, her user ID is an email address. So it should've worked just fine from admin's worksite setup via Add Participants and the username field; unless that is the bug, and we are incorrectly rejecting user IDs that just happen to be email addresses.
column49: If the account is an email address, then it has to be entered in the 'guest' field. If it is a username only (without the @domain), then it goes in the username field. I'm guessing Cheryl put her email address account name in the username, and got that error. That's how it currently works - so that at an institution there is some control over accounts, and where checks are made for existing accounts. If this is to be changed then it's an enhancement request not a bug, as it will take some considerable discussion to decide what works for all.
column71: There was a bug with using email addresses (usernames containing "@"), SAK-111 Closed , which is fixed in 2.1.1.

column1: [SAK-531] Quickstart startup scripts corrupt configuration files after first user.
column6:
From: Patricia Goldweic (Mar 14, 2005 1:09 pm)

Based on the comment from the Sakai Dev site on collab this should be investigated.

Hi Victor,

Well, it turns out that help is actually on the way. First of all, let me say that we need to be using the email list (and not this discussion forum) when we really need to get answers to our questions, because, as you said, this forum is not really being followed by core developers. I emailed the list directly and I did get a couple of responses in a couple of days. Please take a look at the response from Steven Githens in the email archives. His theory seems to be explaining why our MySQL setup is producing the error messages (mainly, the properties file is not being loaded correctly). He also suggests that we can 'manually fix it' if we are in a hurry, doing what he suggests to the source. Otherwise, I think that a real solution will require a fix on the part of the sakai group (I know that there are developers looking into this, in particular, Anthony Whyte and others). The address for the email list is: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org.

BTW, through my own experimentation I found out that if you are using Quickstart, you SHOULD NOT use the startup script from sakai after the first start (that is, start.sh), because this messes up the sakai.properties file everytime you use it (it adds a bogus string to some of the pathnames there). Instead, use the Tomcat startup and sthutdown scripts.

-Patricia

pgoldweic@northwestern.edu

column1: [SAK-530] email archive address @localhost only
column6:
http://sakai-stable.mit.edu/portal/site/1110490472222-708/page/1110490473659-723

"Email Archive" is one of the optional worksite tools; I can enable/disable it using Site Info. Problems I'm seeing:

1) The archive address site is fixed as "localhost"; all I can choose is the username.

(see attached image 3.15email)

Presumably the archive is stored on the Sakai server, but "localhost" could point many places depending on how Sakai is implemented at a particular site - why keep that as a mandatory default?

2) When I select "Email Archive" from the left navbar, I see the warning "You are not authorized to send mail to this worksite". Since I'm logged in as the site creator in the maintain role, why wouldn't I have permission by default?

Checking the "New" checkbox for the maintain role under "Permissions" doesn't remove the warning message, either.

3) When I choose "Options" from the above screen and try to adjust any options, I see a warning box that says: "Alert: Cannot find the Email Archive Channel! The Email Archive Channel may not be modified at this time."

(see attached image 3.15alert)
column10: email archive address @localhost only
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Regarding 1), the server name probably isn't set in the sakai.properties file, and email may not be setup to work on stable. There's a setting in the sakai.properties file,

  1. the DNS name of the server
    serverName=localhost

and that needs to be set to whatever the server name is (e.g., here at UM it's ctools.umich.edu) Then the email archive options page shows the email address as being <something>@ctools.umich.edu

Regarding 2), this seems like a bug we had on collab at one point, where the email channel wasn't getting created properly via worksite setup when the tool was added. Editing the site with the admin sites editor - going in as though you were going to change the tools, and just saving at that point, seemed to initialize the email channel, and then the errors about permissions were eliminated. So there may still be a bug in wsetup having to do w/ email. But it might also be something to do with email not being setup properly on stable.

column1: [SAK-528] Bug in latest MySQL drivers causes bug in Sakai
column6:
A bug in the latest MySQL JDBC drivers (Connector/J) is causing a bug in Sakai.

Problem:
The latest MySQL JDBC drivers (improperly) fail when the character set is specified as "UTF-8".

Symptom:
Sakai fails to start properly, and the folllowing exception is in the logs:
java.sql.SQLException: unable to borrow: java.sql.SQLException: Unknown column 'UTF' in 'field list'

Workaround:
In sakai.properties change the MySQL JDBC URL to specify "UTF8" instead of "UTF-8" (remove the dash).
OR
Install an older MySQL driver (up to 3.0.16) instead of the latest driver.

Recommended Solution:
Fix for 1.5.1. Change "UTF-8" to "UTF8" in all JDBC URLs. This would change sakai.properties, and several pieces of example code on the release website. Send a note out to all the Sakai mailing lists explaining that because of this MySQL JDBC bug, everyone should change to "UTF8" in their JDBC URL or use the older driver. Link to the older driver from the Sakai web site (at least until MySQL fixes this bug).

This bug has been reported to MySQL and can be tracked in their bug database at:
http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=9206
column10: Bug in latest MySQL drivers causes bug in Sakai
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
A MySQL developer acknowledged that this is a MySQL bug. He suggested an alternate workaround - that removing "characterSetResults=UTF-8" will fix our problem. I tested his suggestion and indeed it seems to work well. He says that because the MySQL server understands UTF-8, and Java understands UTF-8, "characterSetResults=UTF-8" isn't necessary. Well, he should know.

So I recommend we follow his solution and just remove "characterSetResults=UTF-8" from the JDBC URL, thereby avoiding this bug.

(Below is the email response from the MySQL developer Mark Matthews, mark AT mysql.com)

Jon,

This is a bug in that characterSetResults does not allow UTF-8, because
it's passed directly to the server (but characterEncoding does, because
there's quite a bit of code surrounding to convert canonical forms to
names that the MySQL server understands).

However, there really is no reason to force characterSetResults unless
you're using a character encoding that's not known by the JDBC driver.
Since UTF-8 is known by JDBC, the driver will use the character sets
that the server tells it to via the field-level metadata for a result
set.
column45: If the current suggested solution is to change the URL does this mean that we can make all the changes necessary and the users won't need to change things, or even know that there is a problem?
column49:
Sakai administrators who are trying to run Sakai 1.5.0 with MySQL will need to make a change. The change is:
In sakai.properties:
remove "&characterSetResults=UTF-8" from the sql.connect property.

Thats it. Its a simple fix.

For 1.5.1 we'll take care of it (it won't be a problem).
column71:
The suggested workaround has been implemented (and tested locally by me).

I removed "&characterSetResults=UTF-8" and MySQL is happy again.

This is checked into both HEAD and the branch for the 1.5.1 release.

The format of the provider ID in the out-of-the-box worksite set-up currently matches the U-M format, as it was originally the only one available. It would be desirable to have a more readable provider ID format in the default setup. In light of that, let's turn your observation into a Feature Request.

column1: [SAK-517] mySql not working for content hosting access
column6: Sakai storing content hosting resource body binary in the database using mySql is failing to read the body properly. Early diagnosis points to problems between mySql and Sakai's "slow pool" StreamWithConnection. Once the connection is used in this way it cannot be reused. Result is intermittent or no access to content hosting resources from Sakai.
column10: mySql not working for content hosting access
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
To reproduce the bug:
1. Startup Sakai with MySQL
2. Add a resource
3. Click on it to view it (from the main Resource tool page)
Repeat steps 2 and 3 several times until you see the symptom.

Symptom: The browser window that should show the content comes up blank (intermittently). You may not see the problem on your first file upload. But upload 5 text files, one after another, and you'll probably see the bug at least once. (Don't try to reproduce the bug by uploading images - the browser seems to cache the correct image and doesn't show the 0-byte error that is actually happening)
column45:
It seems that the mysql connector's default transaction mode is TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ. This means that any connections in transactions will not get updates of stuff in other transactions. Since your code calls "conn.setAutoCommit(false)" all the time, this puts all connections into a transaction. Since they are in a transaction, any other commits will not be seen. The slow connection pool (which I think the binary resources read use) I think only does reads. This means that, until a restart, none of those connections will be outside of the transactions that don't include the new binary data.

I found there is a setting in BasicSqlService called "commitAfterRead". This makes it so that each connection is not in an extended transaction if set to true. I think for a mysql db, you need this set to true. On my local machine, I set this to true (in the components.xml file) and things started working fine, though I'm not sure if other things break as a result.
column49:
When returning a connection, it would seem that something could be done to clean up the connection & get it ready for re-use. I have found that we can do this in passivateObject, which currently has no code, but is called from the pooling framework when the connection is returned. I've tested the following code (also, this does not require the commitAfterRead flag to be true), and it seems to resolve the issue with Resources.

add to BasicSqlService.passivateObject to set the connection to a known state:
Connection conn = (Connection) obj;

try {
if(!conn.getAutoCommit())

{ conn.commit(); }

} catch (SQLException e)

{ m_logger.error("passivateObject: connection commit failed: " + e); throw(e); }
column71:
The real problem here is that mySql's default transaction isolation mode, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, is likely not desirable for Sakai. The prefered mode, and the default for Oracle, is TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED.

There are some options to achieve this. With Sakai 1.5.0, you must change your mySql either by configuration or by issuing a SQL command to change the default:

SET GLOBAL TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ COMMITTED

We are considering changing the code so that we set each connection's transaction level to our desired READ_COMMITTED as we borow each connection. That way we will avoid the situation where an unmodified mySql is used, or we run into an Oracle with a strange default. That will be for 1.5.1.
column75:
This bug has been fixed both in HEAD and in the branch sakai_1-5-0.

The fix was to set the transaction isolation level to TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED when the JDBC Connection is created. This happens at creation time (and not at activation or passivation time) because the JDBC JavaDoc says that the behavior of the operation Connection.setTransactionIsolation() is undefined if a transaction is already in progress. So it makes the best sense to set it at creation time.

The code is simply:
(within makeObject(), where the Connection object is created):\
conn.setTransactionIsolation(Connection.TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED);
column79:
Verified for Sakai 1.5.1m1 on sakai-stable.mit.edu.

Unassigning & closing item.

column1: [SAK-514] Disabling auto-refresh has surprising consequences
column6:
Not having been a big fan of the auto-refresh, I decided to try the new option to disable it. This however had some unintended consequences - basically, it seems that many actions now require forcing the browser to reload in order to complete.

For example, expanding discussion threads. Clicking the "Expand All" button does not accomplish that task ... until you decide to do a hard reload through the browser.

Chatting is another example. Of course I expect that the chat messages won't be updated automatically without the refresh, but I do expect that clicking on the "Send" button will make my messages appear in the main pane. It doesn't. I have to send and then reload the page manually.

Many of the toggle buttons that appear along the top of any tool don't achieve their function until a manual reload, as well, and for similar reasons, I'd guess.

Since choosing this preference appears to break a fair fraction of site functionality, I think that an auto reload either needs to automatically accompany any action, or the optional preference should be removed.

  • NOTE: I'm seeing this only on the Collab site at present, and haven't tried it on other installations yet.
column10: Disabling auto-refresh has surprising consequences

column45:
I think that would work for the most part, however I also believe that Sakai should support "guest" accounts out of the box, rather than only leaving that feature to be implemented at schools that have single-signon in place.

Perhaps this should be a separate JIRA issue, but... in worksite setup, when you add a "guest", sakai creates a user with the id of the email address and gives them a random password. Is there any reason to not give the option of sending that password along in the invitation email?

We've written a simple "guest account" tool which is publically accessible and allows invitees the ability to set their new password. Basically if you type in an email address that is the id of a "guest" account, it will allow you to reset the password and then logs you in (it also changes the user's type at that point from "guest" to "registered-guest", to prevent malicious use of the tool).

We then put the link to that tool in sakai.properties so it is sent in the invitiation. I still would rather send the original password in the email.

column1: [SAK-512] Unauthorized users can take tests via published assessment urls
column6:
Every published assessment has a PAU (published assessment url) created for it. If an unauthorized user tries to take an assessment by using the url, they should get a 'permission denied' message and be returned to the Sakai portal page. Right now, anyone can see and take the assessment using the PAU, although their answers are not saved.

Example assessment: 3.11 Marith Open (released to 1 site only, not to anonymous or authenticated users)

PAU: http://sakai-stable.mit.edu/xtunnel/samigo/servlet/Login?id=marith1110585021718

Log into any Sakai account with a student role (student1/student1 will work) and then paste that URL into your browser. You should be able to take the assessment even though you're not a member of the site it is released to.

However, if you click "Submit for Grading" you get a blank page; if you click "Save and Exit" you get a sort of blank assessment page (see attached image 3.14saveandexit).

column1: [SAK-504] Sakai Integration -- Samigo
column6:
Review gradebook interfaces to generate questions/issues to discuss during 3/17 teleconference.

Discussion Area
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/SG2X/SAMigo+Integration
column10: Sakai Integration -- Samigo
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I took a quick look od the javadoc. Just a couple of comments
1. GradebookService should externalName be externalId instead?

updateExternalAssessmentScore(java.lang.String gradebookUid, java.lang.String externalName, java.lang.String studentId, double points)

2. Authz.isAuthorized() - the order of parameter is different from the osid 2.0 that we have been following (agent, function, qualifier) where agent can be a group. I think sakai is also following this order.

3. Enrollment - I don't understand this one. Is this a one on one relationshp, one gradebook per user? If "An enrollment defines the student relation between users and the gradebook." then shouldn't there also be a method call getGradebook() or getGradeBookList(user). This is just a "has" relationship, right? A user has a list of gradebook.

You ask "what role does this user has in this gradebook?" in Authz but I don't see where you keep this info if it is not in the enrollment. Maybe you are doing that in Authz ("daisyf", "is", "instructor") and you also has ("instructor", "can edit", "gradbookX")

Daisy
column45:
>1. GradebookService should externalName be externalId instead?
>
>updateExternalAssessmentScore(java.lang.String gradebookUid, java.lang.String externalName, java.lang.String studentId, double points)

Good catch, thanks. I'll fix that.

>2. Authz.isAuthorized() - the order of parameter is different from the osid 2.0 that we have been following (agent, function, qualifier) where agent can be a group. I think sakai is also following this order.

You're looking at out-of-date javadoc, I'm afraid.

>3. Enrollment - I don't understand this one. Is this a one on one relationshp, one gradebook per user? If "An enrollment defines the student relation between users and the gradebook." then shouldn't there also be a method call getGradebook() or getGradeBookList(user). This is just a "has" relationship, right? A user has a list of gradebook.
>
>You ask "what role does this user has in this gradebook?" in Authz but I don't see where you keep this info if it is not in the enrollment. Maybe you are doing that in Authz ("daisyf", "is", "instructor") and you also has ("instructor", "can edit", "gradbookX")

We want to let the framework decide both 1) What the current user can do in the gradebook? and 2) Who should be shown on the student roster in the gradeback? Because we're not responsible for authz, we can't assume that every user who shows up on the roster is allowed to be in the gradebook. This may sound odd, but it's entirely possible that an institution or an instructor may decide that they don't want a "student view" to be visible and have 5000 Chem 1 students refreshing the page every 2 seconds.

When embedded in a framework like Sakai, that framework will determine the user's current context and tell the application what gradebook to use. We won't pop up a list of gradebooks from every single site across the entire Sakai installation. Only the standalone gradebook needs a method like "getAccessibleGradebooks(user)", and so it's not specified in the facade interfaces, just in our standalone facade implementations.

column1: [SAK-503] Viewing Drop Box Item loads index page in parent frame
column6:
Steps to replicate using Internet Explorer:

1) Login as non-privileged user
2) go to course that has drop box tool enabled
3) New -> Local file on your computer
4) upload gif file, don't edit any settings (keep copyright enabled) -> Post
5) click on gif file -> a new window will launch

The parent iframe now displays the index.html file at /tunnel/sakai-chef-tool/

Screenshot attached

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Marith has noted there is, at least in Firefox, an intermittent problem if you toggle the "<>" button that affects display/editability.

The toggle had more significance when it was needed as a workaround.
column45:
I'm still seeing problems with the wysiwyg editor and Firefox in 1.5.1m1. Are the following known issues, and should they have their own bugs for clarity?

o I can't paste text into the wysiwyg editor in HTML mode using Firefox. When I try I get a popup error that says "Please use the Edit menu of the browser for copy, cut and paste operations."

However, cut and copy operations do work in html mode, and all three work in plain text mode. If this is a known issue and not being fixed till later, a more accurate popup error that reflects this might be good.

o After typing some text in the wysiwyg editor in the Resources tool, I left my Firefox browser alone for about ten minutes. When I returned, I could type in text mode, but not in html mode. As before, the format buttons were all pressed, and trying to use them produced a popup javascript error (see screenshots).

I tried to reproduce this several times but haven't been able to yet. Next I'll try in other browser types, on both Mac and PC, and report back.
column49: wysiwyg errors in Firefox on XP
column71:
I was just able to reproduce the wedged-wysiwyg problem in all 3 database versions, using FF. Same paste popup error, too. This time around it was very easy to create the error on all 3 instances - just clicking the toggle button a couple of times did it.

(And yes, I started up a fresh browser window each time.)
column75:
I noted already that the toggle button did seem to cause problems in Firefox, this is not going to be fixed in 1.5x. In general, I am able to use Firefox, I was using it almost exclusively to test several of the unrelated fixes I recently checked in.

We could note these things as known bugs/things to look out for in our release notes for 1.51.

In point of fact we will be concentrating on the 2.0 version of the WYSIWYG, not the 1.5 version of the WYSIWYG.
column79:
Wrote new version of wysiwyg (inputRichText) and of hideDivision and rewrote hideDivision.js.
Now works in Firefox on a test page.

Need to deploy new Sakai JSF in Samigo and do further testing.
column83: Is this still an issue in 2.0?
column92:
I had previous found that the workaround of not hiding the divisions worked with the Netscape browers.

From Margaret's comment dated 4-19-05 in SAK-371 Closed , this issue has been resolved for Foxfire browsers using the workaround.

QUESTION:
Is there going to be a fix (other than the workaround) for this issue? If the workaround is it, then this issue can be closed.
column96:
I can still reproduce both problems in 2.0.0.a3, using Firefox.

1) As long as I use the rich text mode of the wysiwyg editor, all is well. If I switch to plain text using the toggle button and then switch back, all the style buttons are depressed and I can't use the editor in rich test mode anymore.

2) Pasting into the wysiwyg editor still doesn't work, and the popup error is still inaccurate (this is probably too minor to fix for 2.0, though)

Will contact Ed about these and get an update.
column127: The problem's back, alas..
column131:
Trying to get a fix in for 2.0 or 2.01 for the wysiwyg hide division problems.

I was running into problems getting the fix in with the slightly different design in the 2.0 JSF tags that doesn't have a body onload, so I am going to try to get a Samigo-specific quickie fix.

I think it is the only tool that uses both together (3 pages of settings)

Made some fairly extensive (but innocuous--if I did it right) changes to the wysiwyg in Samigo.
(version 1.5)

I addressed some of the complaints about problem buttons by removing them ( full screen, copy, cut, paste, insert table, toggle source).

It is also generating a global array of wysiwygi. I want to have the show hide do a programmatic state change on the wysiwyg to kick it into the right mode on Mozilla browsers by using the global list (the next step). So still working on it.
column135:
I am making some progress. I am very close.

I am actually running through the global list of wysiwygi and removing them (leaving the textareas) whenever a division is opened in Gecko. I am then recreating them. All the wysiwygs seem to be editable, and if there is one on the page it persists.

I ran into an issue with multiple wysiwygs (such as an assessment with an intro and submission message) where the first is editibale but does not persist. I am investigsating this.

If it looks like I can't get that fixed for 2.0 I will hide the code so it behaves like 1.5 with the hide divisions shut off, and fix for 2.01.

column1: [SAK-459] MySQL exceptions in QuickStart
column6:
Anthony Whyte is reporting MySQL failing in the QuickStart, with exceptions. Here is his report:
>>> On Collab a number of developers have reported startup problems when
>>> using Sakai 1.5 with MySQL (Linux and Windows). I decided to see if I
>>> could reproduce the problem on ye olde Mac with a fresh checkout from
>>> CVS. Unfortunately I've reproduced their reported errors (see
>>> attached
>>> catalina.out). I use MySQL as my local db for testing my queries so
>>> this problem is new and not one I've encountered before locally.
>>>
>>> From the log the input stream is getting whacked and the exceptions
>>> appear to originate in the BasicSQLService connection pool.
>>>
>>> My sakai properties hints are set as follows:
>>>
>>> # MySQL 4.1+ database settings (MySQL 4.0- not supported at this time)
>>> sql.vendor=mysql
>>> sql.driver=com.mysql.jdbc.Driver
>>> sql.connect=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/sakai?
>>> useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8
>>> sql.user=sakaiuser
>>> sql.pw=sakaipassword
>>>
>>> Nothing looks out of line above. After the CVS checkout I maven
>>> everything as follows:
>>>
>>> maven clean
>>> maven clean_env
>>> maven
>>> maven reg
>>> # maven conf_xml – switch to xml service as pseudo db
>>> maven populate_xml
>>> maven conf_db
>>> maven tomcat_context
>>>
>>> One change I did make was to upgrade my MySQL connector jar in
>>> tomcat/common/lib from version 3.1.6 to 3.1.7. However, after
>>> encountering the exceptions I killed MySQL and then Tomcat, replaced
>>> the
>>> new jar with the old and on restarting MySQL and Tomcat (in that
>>> order)
>>> encountered the same errors.
>>>
>>> Can you guys check this out and see if you can reproduce the error or
>>> remind me that I've missed something in my configuration setup.
>>>
>>> AW
column10: MySQL exceptions in QuickStart
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Attached Tomcat exception log.
column45: No longer relavent.

column1: [SAK-458] MySQL breaks Resources
column6:

  • MySQL distribution 4.1.5-gamma (version 14.6)

Reporters:
"Anthony A. Potts" <anthony.potts@rsmart.com>
John Ellis <john.ellis@rsmart.com>
column71: The scope of this bug is not just QuickStart - it affects all current versions of Sakai.
column75:
I've found a fix for this. However, the fix may not be complete (it works for me though), and it may not be good for other DBs besides MySQL.

The fix is to use autoCommit=true on all SQL statements against the DB. This seems to take care of it.

I'm not checking the fix in yet because I don't know how it will affect other DBs besides MySQL. Maybe autoCommit will only be used on MySQL. Setting autoCommit=true for just the binary data uploads into the DB doesn't work, it has to be set on all SQL statements. I don't know why. Maybe a driver or DB bug. But setting autoCommit=true for everything does seem to fix the bug.

Attached is a patched BasicSqlService.java that sets autoCommit=true and seems to work around the bug for MySQL. Replace the existing file in sakai/framework-component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/org/component/framework/sql/BasicSqlService.java with the attached file, recompile Sakai, and MySQL Resources should work again.

This bug could use futher investigation and fixing.
column79: Replace this file to get MySQL resources working.
column83:
Oops.. Correction to the above post:
sakai/framework-component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/framework/sql/BasicSqlService.java
column92: I agree that this needs further investigation. What are the other effects of not having autocommit set on? Is there other data that is not getting into the DB that should be? If autocommit is only affecting resources have an effect on the other parts of Sakai should we find a way to do a specific commit for resources?

column1: [SAK-453] better "list" identification of email sent via Sakai for filtering, auto-reply, etc. purposes
column6:
Users want to be able to automatically process Sakai list emails, for example, filtering email from a list into a specific folder, handling out-of-the-office auto-replies, etc. There are two main suggestions for enabling this:

(1) Place the list name or aliases in the subject line, e.g., "[sakai-dev] Improved Email Subject Lines". This is probably the preferred solution, as folks can easily configure filters in their email clients to work with this form of the information.

(2) Add support for a header field. See RFC-2919 for some suggestions (http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2919.html). For example, mailman adds informational "List-*:" headers, ezmlm adds a "Mailing-List:" header, and Yahoo groups adds a "X-Yahoo-Group-Post:" header.

It has also been suggested, if the email is tool-generated (e.g., notifications from Announcements or Resources), that the tool name and what triggered the automated message be included in the identifier.

[Original Description moved to 27-Dec-2007 comment below.]
