Original Description:
----------------------------

from an email:

Apologies for replying to my own email, and even more so if you're
the wrong contact, but I have an additional reason for adding a list
ID email header after sending a message to the list...

Such a header might help (well-written and configured) autoreply
programs avoid replies to the list. I received 3 out-of-office
autoreplies within 3 minutes of submitting a post...and that's with
a 5 minute greylist delay on my mailserver!

It'll be interesting to see how many OoO autoreplies trickle in over
the course of the afternoon. Makes me wish I was on vacation.

Thanks, Glenn.

--Brad

On Fri, 11 Mar 2005 12:59:26 EST Brad Fritz wrote:

Glenn,

Apologies for contacting you directly, and please redirect me if there
is a better contact...

I am subscribed to the sakai-user and sakai-dev mailing lists and just
started getting mail from the lists. Unlike most mailing lists I
subscribe to, there are no list headers in the that indicate the
messages are from a mailing list. As examples, mailman adds
informational "List-*:" headers, ezmlm adds a "Mailing-List:" header,
and Yahoo groups adds a "X-Yahoo-Group-Post:" header.

Usually these headers include a name for the list and information for
an administrative contact. Would it be possible to add something like
that to the sakai-* lists? Looks like RFC 2919 has some suggestions
for such headers:

http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2919.html

I ask because such headers make it much easier to sort and route
incoming email.

Thank you, Glenn.

Sincerely,
Brad Fritz
Software Developer and Sakai list subscriber
bfritz@cs.iupui.edu

Another form of requested identification (See Stephan's comment below and the duplicate issue SAK-6925 Closed ) would be configurable Subject: line prefixes, e.g., Subject: [sepp-pedagogy] Enhanced discussion tool. This is a very common practice for email lists these days, and would aide those filtering email.

Furthermore, this sort of identifier can be extended to reflect email from specific actions/tools in the site as well, such as Announcment and Resource Notifications.
column96: Idea for trivial patch that adds a header to the mailing list emails so that people can filter on this header.
column127: Users who want digest subscriptions make this a little more complicated as it seems that digests collect emails from all sites so any header or subject prefix identifying the site wouldn't be applicable in the containing email.
column131:
The "correct" way of doing this is to add a list-id header to the mail headers. See RFC2919 (http://www.apps.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2919.html):

Abstract
-----------

Software that handles electronic mailing list messages (servers and user agents) needs a way to reliably identify messages that belong to a particular mailing list. With the advent of list management headers, it has become even more important to provide a unique identifier for a mailing list regardless of the particular host that serves as the list processor at any given time.

The List-Id header provides a standard location for such an identifier. In addition, a namespace for list identifiers based on fully qualified domain names is described. This namespace is intended to guarantee uniqueness for list owners who require it, while allowing for a less rigorous namespace for experimental and personal use.

By including the List-Id field, list servers can make it easier for mail clients to provide automated tools for users to perform list functions. The list identifier can serve as a key to make many automated processing tasks easier, and hence more widely available.

It should also be noted that many spam filter systems use the list-id header to identify bulk mail and, where the list is publicly verifiable, reduces spam ratings for content submitted to the list (under the assumption that it is a moderated or managed subscription list)

column1: [SAK-448] Chat: Add ability to clear or hide archived messages
column6:
we received a request from a customer with regard to the behavior of the chat tool. i've provided the entire conversation below to give you an idea of the context of the conversation. please let me know if you need any additional information. thanks!

"2. How would I, the instructor, "clear the screen" for example so that Tuesday's chat doesn't get confused with Wednesday morning's chat?

Kris - We are working on refactoring this tool. The new settings (options) for this tool allow one to choose the number of days from
which they would like to see past messages. I would assume that one could choose 'Show messages from the past 1 days' to keep the chat
clean. Does this sound like a solution or am I missing the point?

Cindy - It's A solution, but not an ideal one. For example, in many of our courses we schedule a mid-day chat and an evening chat on the same day in order to reach nurses who may be working different shifts, so just displaying from the past 1 day wouldn't resolve anything.

One problem with this tool is that by its very definition "chat" is synchronous, meaning that participants only communicate with those who are logged on at the same place and time. In this system, it's possible to chat with people who haven't been logged on for 2 days – as long as they return later and type a response. So in that case, all we're doing is creating a single thread discussion forum and calling it a chat.

The other problem is that by including the archive in the chat itself, we are mixing two very different functionalities into the same
interface, which is difficult to manage and use. And that's not even throwing in the complication of multiple chat rooms and how their
archive is stored."

column1: [SAK-442] wysiwyg editor /  Firefox problem in assessment settings
column6:
When I edit the settings of a core assessment using the Firefox browser, I can't type in any of the WYSIWYG fields. Clicking on any of the style buttons causes a Javascript application error (see attached screenshot).

This is only true in assessment settings - I can create questions in authoring using Firefox and the WYSIWYG editors without a problem.

(Is this a duplicate of SAK-104 Closed ? Should that bug be reopened?)
column10: wysiwyg editor /  Firefox problem in assessment settings
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This is actually a duplicate of "Being logged out of the web site" 371. It has the same root cause.

The problem is misbehavior of the wysiwyg in Gecko-engine browsers such as FireFox – when the wysiwyg is inside a hidable division. This doesn't affect IE.

This combination occurs in three screens, authoring settings, pulished settings and template editor and affects browsers such as Netscape and Mozilla as well.

I put code in to disable the hide feature if and only if it is a Gecko based browser, and the wysiwyg should work for you. As long as this fix is acceptable in the 1.5x time frame, all such bugs should be resolved.

The 2.0 presentation layer must address this problem.

There should be one and only one bug, targeting 2.0.
It should be "Wysiwyg does not work in hideDivision in Gecko-engine browsers such as FireFox, Netscape and Mozilla "
column45: Ed notes that this bug duplicates SAK-371 Closed .

column1: [SAK-440] File upload for JSF
column6:
File upload in JSF has been an oft-requested feature. Melete, Syllabus, Samigo, and Gradebook all need this in order to be fully functional.

Our mechanism for file upload in the legacy tools was sufficient for the legacy tools, but not for new JSF tools.

In order for file upload in JSF to work, the underlying handling of JSF needs to be standardized to use Apache commons-fileupload. This way any Sakai tool can easily manipulate uploaded files, with the framework taking care of the difficult parts (including legacy tools and new JSF tools).

This should have been done a long time ago, and it needs to be released in 1.5.1 so that teams that are ready to integrate it right now (Melete, Syllabus, Profile) aren't blocked by this anymore.
column10: File upload for JSF
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: File upload is part of the scaffolding for JSF.
column45:
We have a file upload, though kind of funky, in 1.5 Samigo. You might want to look at it and see what you can reuse.
(See my other e-mail).

Note: The file upload in Samigo uses a ValueChangedListener to trigger the upload processing, which is probably not how developers would want to see the tag behave. It is based on the core jsf book, and is in com.corejsf.

e.g.
<%--
target represents location where import will be temporarily stored
check valueChangeListener for final destination
--%>
<corejsf:upload target="/jsf/upload_tmp/qti_imports"
valueChangeListener="#

{myBean.doit}

" />

public void doit(ValueChangeEvent e)
{
String uploadFile = (String) e.getNewValue();

// process file, which is now on the server in /jsf/upload_tmp/qti_imports...
column49: Changes copied into sakai_1-5-0 branch.

column75: Confirmed fix. The Sakai file upload handling doesn't get in the way anymore for tools to do file uploading. Melete is already using this feature with 1.5.1 pre-release.

column6:

Not only is this awkward, but it produces dramatic blur lines on the page. The lines do go away when you click the page to refresh it. (see attached screenshot)

(Is it necessary to leave so much blank space at the bottom of the sakai frame? Shortening that, or giving that space to the Samigo frame, might help.)

column41: I'm not sure who to assign this to, so it's you by default. We need a better way to handle Samigo scrolling....
column45: Gonzalo - Do you know what to do to get rid of the scroll bars in SAMigo?
column49:
Samigo could use the same jscript that sakai uses in headscripts.js to resize the iframe depending on the actual size of the document displayed inside of it.

This script works fairly well overall - some browsers will not resize appropriately in multistep processes, adding to the overall length usually, but most will do well with the minimum required to display the contents.

This will work for height. For width...the philosophy has been to always try to keep the overall length of the contents to what we know can be displayed - namely 800px (minus the pixels required for the left hand tool navigation) or to keep the widths fluid. Finally - any element inside of the document set to 100% will tend to freak IE out - it will display a hscroll on the iframe.

I will try to install and run Samigo so that I can work on it.

column1: [SAK-438] Template "release to" settings don't include release to site
column6:
Introductory foo:

The "Assessment Released To" section of assessment settings has two checkboxes, "Anonymous" and "Authenticated Users". When you create a template, you can choose whether or not each of those settings is editable.

If you make them not editable in the template, then assessments created using that template are released to authenticated users (ie, everyone with a Sakai login.)

This works well in standalone Samigo - but in the integrated version, you can also release an assessment to specific sites.
Templates need to reflect this.

Actual bug:

After I publish an assessment, new checkboxes appear in the published assessment settings under "release to": one for each of my sites. If the template I used had those "anonymous" and "authenticated users" checkboxes turned on, I can now use these new checkboxes to further define which sites the assessment should be released to.

If the template I used had the anonymous and auth-users checkboxes turned off, then the site checkboxes are greyed out in the published assessment settings too.

Suggestion: add a "Selected sites" checkbox to template settings, so the site checkboxes can be enabled/disabled separately.

You can no longer published to other site like you can in 1.5.1.

column1: [SAK-437] Title field allows more than 20 char limit
column6:
There is no character limit when the site title (ie, what is displayed on the tab) is edited via the sites tool (Sites>> search and select site >> Title field will let you enter in more than 20 characters). However, when the site title is edited via the Site Info tool (Site Info >> Edit Site Information>> the Site Title field has a 20 character limit. Please let me know if you need more information

This occurs on nightly and stable.

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I'm not sure we want to change that. There isn't really any limit - we just put a 20 char limit to try to keep the tab sizes down. But in some cases, support needs to change the title to something longer for whatever reason, so they can do that with the admin sites tool where the limit isn't enforced.

In general, the tools that users have sometimes impose aritificial limits but those checks aren't there on the admin tools so that admins can react to special cases.

We have on occasion had to put in something more than our 'standard' due to request from someone like the provost or whatever, and so a backdoor is needed.

column1: [SAK-431] Context-sensitive help
column6:
The context-sensitive help needs to be more user-aware.

As a registered user with default permissions, when I click on the help button, I should see only those entries which are relevant to me. For example, right now when I select help on announcements, I am seeing entries for "Create Announcements," "Revise Announcements," and "Delete Announcements." Since I do not have permission to create/revise/delete announcements, these entries are meaningless to me.

On the other hand, a user with permission to perform these tasks would find these entries useful.

Context-sensitive help also needs to be worksite aware.
For example, a user in a "Project" worksite, will not need to see the Syllabus help tool.

column1: [SAK-425] Anonymous assessement title bar text confusing
column6:
When viewing a question an anonymously released assessemnt the title bar says "Item Display - Author mode." The Table of Contents says Table of Contents. Not sure why this is, but this is probably going to confusing some users. Occurs on our nightly build as well as on Stanford's stand alone instance.

==============================================================================================
I'm going by these specs:

Hello all,

Just want to let you know that the published url for anonymous user has been implemented based on the following spec that Lance sent us last week. The only thing that I didn't do is item 6. I am not sure if cookie is the way to do it as people do share computers in public clusters. I need more time to think about it and decide how we can add this to 2.0 so we can keep track of the attempts. OK?

Daisy

At 02:57 PM 2/9/2005, Speelmon, Lance D wrote:

Let me see if I can help clear things up regarding anonymous assessment delivery.

1. If assessments are published to the "Anonymous" target, the URL is the only form of navigation that anonymous users have to find the assessment.
2. The generated URL will be used by both anonymous and authenticated users.
3. If a user accesses the URL and the assessment has been published to "Anonymous" then the user would begin the assessment without any additional input.
4. If a user accesses the URL and the assessment has not been published to "Anonymous" then the user would be prompted for authentication, and then taken to the begin assessment screen.
5. We suggest that a new Agent (and AgentId) is generated for each anonymous test taking session. This will help identify unique response sessions; i.e. if the assessment is published to "Anonymous", and the user is beginning the assessment via the URL, then the number of attempts is effectively infinite. However, if the user is not using the URL, then number of attempts can be enforced as the user is identifiable.
6. Number of attempts and Anonymous delivery are somewhat incompatible. The only way I can think to possibly address this issue is to use a browser cookie in an attempt to track state.
7. Remember that we also have an "Authenticated Users" publishing target which can be useful if the behavior described above does not suit the needs.

Thanks, L

column1: [SAK-421] Chat: Changes to Main Chat Room are not reflected to user who is logged in
column6:
When an author changes the default chat room by either creating a new chat room or changing to an already existing chat room, users who are were logged in prior to the change are not automatically moved to the new chat room. Users must log out completely and then log back in to access the new chat room.

Additionally, when the author changes the default chat room, the 'users in chat' section indicates that the user who was logged in prior to the change is in the chat room, but this is not the case. The user who was logged in prior to the change is actually still in the first chat room that they were in when they logged in. This does not change until the user logs out completely and then logs back in.

Behavior that I would expect:

If an author changes the default chat room, the user would automatically be moved to the new chat room.

column41:
John, what kind of permission did you give the user jleasia?
Because this user was added manually, not by the external automatically. The case I can think of is jleasia has a maintainer level permissions, which is like the issue talked under the thread SAK-355 Closed .
Actually it is good to have this issue seperated out, because that one is mainly about being able to edit site after unjoining.
column45: Joanne's Issue #1, unable to unjoin a worksite, is now a separate issue, SAK-420 Closed .
column49:
Important info from Joanne in the other issue:

On whisk with newest release

  • unjoining "Joanne Test"(maintain role), or "suiyy@yahoo test"(owner role). The names of the sites stay in the list.
  • unjoining "Joanne Test 456"(member role). It works. Then add back to "Joanne Tes 456" site with the owner role. Then unjoining failed. Back to member, unjoining works.

Conclusions so far: unjoin is based on permissions. Not working at least for the level higher than "maintain".
Issues: do we allow a site owner/maintainer to unjoin a site? There might be only one maintainer or owner.
column71: I had given the user jleasia the maintain role.
column75:
The consensus is to only allow a user in the maintain role to be able to unjoin themselves from a site if there is already another user with the maintain role. If no other maintain user exists, then they should receive an alert notifying them that they cannot unjoin until another user is added with the maintain role. (See Daphne for exact wording.)

The issue of a user changing their role from maintain to access, and loosing control over the site, is a separate issue.
column79:
I see problems here.
Although for the OOTB version, there are only maintain and access roles at the beginning. But we might get more roles in the future. Like currently on whisk, "CTools User Info" site, we got roles of instructor, student, access, maintain. And I don't know how possible, but it is still possible that we would have organizer or controller whatever for one site. Their permissions may have overlapping part. How to tell which role is the highest? Unless we can define the high level set of permissions, the tool would have hard time on dealing with complicated conditions.
Opinions?
column83:
There is a role that the site creator gets and that is set by the institution. At UM we set that role to be Owner. Sakai OOTB has that role as maintain. It is that role - whatever is set in the site's realm as the 'owner/creator' role - that I mean should be the role that can't unjoin.

So Peter's summary would mean that that if someone tries to unjoin with that creator role (call is xxx), as long as there was someone else with the xxx role, they could unjoin. If there was no one else in the site with the xxx role, then they couldn't unjoin - they would get a message telling them that first they need to assign someone else the xxx role.

The same would be said, I guess, if they try to change their own role to something other than xxx. If someone else had the xxx role, then they could change their own role, but if not, they couldn't until first changing someone else's role to xxx.

So there will be 2 parts to the fix - preventing the unjoin (Joanne), and then preventing the change role (Zhen, in Wsetup/site info)

I don't know why the maintain role can't unjoin on nightly, but the access role can't - I don't think that was by design and it didn't used to work that way so I reported it as a bug, and that was before we'd had this discussion.
column92:
Things get cleared. So want to leave a note of what my task would be.
Because we are preventing the unjoin for maintain/owner user already. I am going to allow the unjoin when there is someone with the same role.
column96:
Not considering the automatically added site participants here. Currently RealmService has 2 conditions not allowing a user to unjoin.

  • this user is a maintainer, and the site is not joinable
  • this user is a maintainer, and the general site joiner's role is different
    The purpose is to make sure the same user can be back as a maintainer.

Because now we want to anyway unjoin this user, if this user is not the only maintainer in this realm. So I firstly check the size of the maintainer set, if it is more than one, unjoin the user. If it equals to (or is less than, although impossible) 1, check the conditions.

I think it should cover all the scenerios. But please let me know if something sounds missing to you. Thanks.

column1: [SAK-418] "Sakai install for non-techies" guide
column6: This is a request for a guide to help non-technical users understand configuration decisions around installing Sakai. The use case is, I lead the learning technologies group at my institution and it is my team's responsibility to define what our Sakai instance is (what it looks like, how it acts, what functionality is included, etc.). I'd like a guide that tells us what decisions we can/should make about our Sakai instance, along with information to help me make those decisions. An added bonus might be information to help me translate my team's decisions to the install technical team in a way that makes sense to them (ex. what files are involved, what are the attributes, are we deviating from default setting, etc.).

column1: [SAK-413] Grading an assignment
column6:
I'm trying to figure out how to grade an assignment.

The student was able to submit the assignment, but there doesn't seem to be a facility by which the teacher can grade it and post the grade.

I checked the "Permissions..." button, and the 'grade' permission was not set for either the maintain or the access role, so I modified the 'maintain' role to have grade permission. However, this does not seem to help.

How do I grade an assignment?
column10: Grading an assignment
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
To grade an assignment, be in the List of Assignments view.
Then click the checkbox next to the assignment, and click Grade from the toolbar.
This takes you to a list of submissions - click on a particular submission (student name) to grade.

As an alternate, you can also click on the number in the In/New column for an assignment to take you to the list of submissions. The In/New column shows how many submissions have been turned in (In), and how many need to be graded (New).
column45: IT WORKS!!!

column1: [SAK-411] Implement Course /Section site capabilities for site tools
column6: After the architecture is modified to support sections, each tool must be modified to allow information entered in the course site to be viewed in its section sites. In addition, grading must take place at both the course and section levels. Finally an interface for creating/deleting/editing sections and for signing up/unjoining sections must be created.
column10: Implement Course /Section site capabilities for site tools
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I think that there are multiple feature requests with potentially very different levels of associated effort and complexity embedded in this one entry. Some tools may need major UI redesigns, while others may not.

Grading at the section level is a requirement for the gradebook that needs to be elaborated on. Restricted views of the gradebook, i.e., TAs (or whatever they are called) see only the sections and students they are assigned to, is a current requirement of the post 2.0 gradebook. Section specific assignments that feed into a student's course grade is not.

I'd also say that the final item, specifying a user interface for managing users and sections, has a higher priority than "major," for a subsequent Sakai release, but I guess that is for the tools team to decide. The post-2.0 gradebook, for one, is dependent on the existence of such a tool.
column45: Announcements, Gradebook, and Tests & Quizzes (samigo) all support rudimentary sectioning capabilities as of 2.1.0. Other components to follow in furture releases.
column49: Future (post-2.1.0) Sakai releases will incorporate sectioning support in addtional tools. Check out the release notes as they are delivered for updates on which tools become section enabled; the plan is to section-enable all appropriate tools.

column1: [SAK-402] Reply/No Reply option
column6:
When creating a discussion, there are two 'Reply type' options:
1. Allow reply to any message
2. Allow reply to this topic only

There should be a third option: 3. Do not allow reply to this topic

The problem is that by default, the 'Allow reply to any message' is selected, and the user cannot unselect one without selecting the other, making the selection of option 2 irrelevant.
column10: Reply/No Reply option
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Nadine, could you clarify what you mean here? I presume "creating a discussion" refers to creating a new Topic in the Discussion tool? I think you are misunderstanding the purpose of the Reply Type setting, which you can think of as turning threading on or off.

From the context help:

"When posting a topic in the Discussion area, instructors have the ability to specify whether they wish to allow students to respond only to that topic or to any topic posted. If you allow postings only to the topics you specify, then you create a "flat" discussion. If, on the other hand, you allow replies to any posting, then you create a "threaded" discussion. Threaded discussions are by nature more interactive because users are able to reply to a reply. Flat discussions, in contrast, tend to be more structured and for this reason are more easily controlled."
column45:
Here's how I was looking at it.

The creator of a discussion can set up a new discussion "Category" as well as new "Topics" that fall under that category. A student viewing the discussion, by default, can only respond to existing discussion topics. That's a given.

I was thinking that the "Reply Type" was trying to restrict whether the student can reply to only this topic in the category, or any topic in the category. For example, if I have the following hierarchy:
Test 1 - category
First test - topic
Second test - topic
Third test - topic

and I specified, when creating the "First test" topic, that the reply option be
"Allow reply to this topic only" that the student should not then be able to reply to the "Second test" topic or the "Third test" topic.

If this were the case, then the issue was that every time that a new topic is created, the creator has to select one of the Reply Type options, so that one is never able to have a topic to which the students CANNOT reply. This, I think, negates the option to "Reply to this topic only."

If I'm understanding you correctly, the purpose is to restrict the hierarcy structure of the display. Anyone can still go in and respond to any message, but the response is either going to be indented once (to indicate that it is a response to the respective topic), or going to be indented x times (to indicate that it is a response to a response to a response .... to the topic). Is this correct?

I'm wondering if there's a way to change the wording of the Reply Type options.

Problem is, it's not that the student can reply to only the topic; the student is allowed to reply to any response under the topic. It's just that once the reply is posted, the display of the response varies based on the Reply Type choice.

I can't think of an appropriate wording. Can you?

column1: [SAK-399] Question Pools: exporting a question to xml
column6:
This is probably something to fix for 2.0.

An individual question can be exported to an xml file easily in the standalone version of Samigo, but not in the integrated version.

Actions:
1. Log in as admin and go to the authoring page.
2. Click on the Question Pools link to go to QP.
3. Find an individual question and click on its Export link.

Result: The XML loads as a frame inside the Sakai page, rather than as a popup. There isn't a way to save just the frame, and there isn't a cancel button to return you to authoring - you have to leave the Samigo component altogether and then return to escape the xml page.

(You can cut and paste the xml from the frame as a workaround, however.)

column49:
When creating or editing a course site there are only two options for the Appearance (skins) and neither of these options is "none." Therefore, when creating a new course, one of these skins must be choosen and this overrides the default skin.

To access this setting you can either create a course site via Worksite site up or go to Site Info and choose Edit Site info. The two skins listed are "College of Engineering" and "Department of Humanities."

At the very least, this option should have "None" so that the default skin is displayed for newly created sites. Something I was thinking about is that maybe this feature should be disabled by default until an institution adds skins other than their default.

This is the same on nightly and stable.

column1: [SAK-394] Rename SAMigo tool from "Quiz and Test" --> "Tests & Quizzes"
column6:
Jon, please update the registration files for SAMigo so that it is listed as "Tests & Quizzes" in WorkSite Setup. Thanks, L

----Original Message----
From: Marc Brierley
Sent: Thursday, March 03, 2005 3:16 PM
To: sakai-tools
Cc: Rachel Gollub; Speelmon, Lance D
Subject: RE: Samigo Name Change

Just to be crystal clear, the Tools team discussion/conclusions we had about having the Gradebook coexist with two assessment-type tools (legacy Assignments tool and SAMigo) was for 2.0 not 1.5. The SAMigo name change to 'Tests & Quizzes' was specifically to offset user recognition of these two tools based on primary function for that release only.

However, since SAMigo is still called 'Samigo' rather than the requested 'Assessments' in the 1.5 integrated release (left nav and tool title iframe), I believe we should pragmatically move to this new title 'Tests & Quizzes' (plural and without '(Samigo)' as that is really only a internal name that won't mean anything to instructors and students) now (or as soon as it can be put in a patch).

column1: [SAK-393] Ability to shift site contents date forward to reuse for future semester
column6:
This functionality should be implemented in the import and duplicate site workflow along with revising a site (in case a user is simply reusing a site). Below is an email thread from the advocacy group:

"At 11:40 AM 3/3/2005, Charles Hedrick wrote:
>* We're getting a lot of questions from faculty about reuse of course
>sites for future semesters. This is easy for resources, but for
>assignments and calendar events, it's probably going to require release
>dates for contents, with some easy way to update all release dates for the
>next semester.

We have a feature in our current CMS (ETUDES) called "set the base date."
It basically enables faculty to shift ALL the start/stop dates forward in a
site by x dates by simply setting a new "base date." It requires equal
length terms.

This was a requirement in Melete (ETUDES lesson builder that we are
developing for Sakai) but I removed it as, it seems to me, that the ability
to shift the release dates forward for the next term should happen at the
site level across ALL tools (perhaps in worksite setup). I don't know if
this is a requirement by other core schools. If not, we (Foothill) will
have to figure a way to tackle it next year. It's a "must have" item to
make the lives of teachers easy. We'll need an API that grabs the base
start date from each tool and then sets the new base date across tools.

-Vivie"
column10: Ability to shift site contents date forward to reuse for future semester
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
And additional comment from the advocacy group on user experience for this issue:

"In our conversations with faculty, having to manually set dates
whenever they reuse a course has been a huge source of tedious re-work
(they're using Blackboard v. 5.5). I would love a feature that would
adapt to different size terms by setting events at percentages of
course time. e.g. 1st midterm at 30%, 2nd midterm at 60%, etc.

regards,
Zach A. Thomas
Software Engineer
Texas State University
http://www.txstate.edu"
column45:
A bit of an extension to this would be to define a "timeline" for a course,
with specific points in the course for things to happen. I first heard this request
in about 1999 from someone working Engineering Professional Development,
Dr. Tom Smith. He wanted the "system" to adjust the timeline to fit the length
of the term. 15 weeks or 8 weeks or even 4 weeks, it's the same material and
assignments/quiz/exams.

That matches how many faculty will design their course and for that matter a syllabus.
"I've got 4 units, with an assignment after each", is one simple example.

My design suggestion is to view this as a "timeline" which is associated with
a course. I can envision a visual interface, with sliders on a timeline bar,
to align points in your "abstract course" with actual time available.

column1: [SAK-392] WebDav MKCOL Request Fails when Client does not accept Cookies
column6:
When a MKCOL request is done to the Sakai WebDav from a client which does not accept cookies, or is the first in a stream of requests from a client which does request cookies, the MKCOL request will fail with a 500 error.

The simple patch to this is to edit the file sakai/dav/src/webapp/WEB-INF/web.xml and add a line like:

<http-method>MKCOL</http-method>

To the section <security-constraint>

In the final fix in CVS, there will also be changes to

sakai/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java

To better check for this situation and issue a better log message.
column10: WebDav MKCOL Request Fails when Client does not accept Cookies

column1: [SAK-384] Deprecate XML storage (replaced by HSQLDB as default)
column6:
HSQLDB has superceeded XML storage as the default OOTB configuration. That is, instead of storing raw XML files for Sakai data, the data is stored in the HSQLDB database by default.

The QuickStart and release documentation need to be updated to reflect this. HSQLDB needs a bit more documentation, and the references to the old XML storage need to be removed.

column1: [SAK-382] Delivery problems via published assessment url
column6:
http://sakai-stable.mit.edu/xtunnel/samigo/servlet/Login?id=marith1109726911678

Action: Take an assessment that's been published to anonymous users and has a published assessment url in the settings.

Go to the published assessment url (example above) and take the test. Click "Submit for grading" when done.

Result: Blank screen.

You'll also get a blank screen if you click "Cancel" on the intro page for the assignment.

(If you take the same assessment from within Samigo as an authenticated user, things behave as normal.)

In the standalone version of samigo, the various exit buttons from a published assessment url (Cancel, Submit For Grading, Save and Exit) all return you to the My Assessments page.

I do see what looks like a related exception in the log (see attached).
column10: Delivery problems via published assessment url
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
just wnat to add comments to this bug. there are 2 reasons for the blank screen

1. after an anonymous users taken an assessment and hit Save and Submit. A SQL exception was throw 'cos the Agent.getAgentIdString() return null and we are forbidden to submit any answer without an agentId. This cause of this problem is that Samigo assigned the anonymous user an identity that is not know by sakai.

I talked to Jarrod and he doesn't think we have a method to setCurrentuser for now.

The work around is to stuff the anonymous agentid in a bean and modified AgentFacade.getAgentIdString() so it will retrieve it from the bean if sakai does not know who is the current user is.

2. when hitting cancel button, you get a blank page instead of the Select Assessment page. The cause is an anonymous user login without going through any sakai site so AuthzQueriesFacade.isAuthorized() throws null pointer exception when it does not know which current site the anonymous user is 'cos there is none.

Anyway, I talked to Rachel and she said instaed of directly anonymous user to teh Select Assessment page, we should direct them to "We are grateful for your contribution". If that is the case, we need to implement branching depend on the agentId.

Daisy

column1: [SAK-380] QuickStart needs fixing for Windows
column6:
The QuickStart needs some special-casing for Windows in 1.5 that it didn't need for 1.0.

This is because the path to the installation directory is specified in the sakai.properties file, and it must be specified differently for Windows vs other OSes.
column7: Only applies to the QuickStart distribution
column10: QuickStart needs fixing for Windows
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Copied from email fully explaining the issue:

In sakai.properties, the path to the HSQLDB database is specified.

The original is thus:
sql.connect=jdbc:hsqldb:file:/usr/local/sakai/db/sakaidb

In Windows, with the QuickStart search n' replace, this becomes:
sql.connect=jdbc:hsqldb:file:C:\dev\quickstart\sakai//localfiles/db/sakaidb

Unfortunately, that corrupts the properties file. The properties files use "\" as an escape character, so "\d" for example becomes just "d".

This will work:
sql.connect=jdbc:hsqldb:file:C:/dev/quickstart/sakai//localfiles/db/sakaidb

Because Java accepts "/" as a file separator even on Windows.

It appears that what we need to do some more sophisticated replacing. I think the following will work:

1. Create a new (properties file) directory string for the quickstart by replacing "\" with "/". For example, if the quickstart directory is c:\dev\quickstart, the new string is c:/dev/quickstart

2. Replace /usr/local/sakai with the new directory string. So for example, /usr/local/sakai/db/sakaidb becomes c:/dev/quickstart/db/sakaidb

This might be safe to do in all files; or instead, it could be special-cased for *.properties.

Even though it is more complex, I would recommend special-casing the replace for *.properties instead of using the new replace string for all files. This will be a smaller change to the existing configuration, and will only affect Windows systems (don't want to open ourselves up to other bugs caused by this change).

Do you understand what needs to be done? I'll look at your Ant script next and see if I can figure out how to do it.
column45: Once the static path "/usr/local/sakai" is easily re-configurable, the QuickStart will become much simpler.
column49: Checked in a fix for this (into the QuickStart CVS module). No CVS tag needed, since the QuickStart CVS module is not tagged.
column71:
I've checked in a fix. It works for me on Windows now. You should check how well it works on *ix, and Mac OSX. (I can't test it on Mac OSX since my laptop crashed and is in the shop).

The code is a little verbose, but its basically doing the right thing - for properties files only, Unix-style paths are now used, even on Windows machines.
column75:
To clarify, this fix does not require an RC12. It affects the "docs" and "quickstart" modules in CVS, which are not part of the code (they will be part of the release website). It does require the QuickStart to be regenerated though.

I'm marking it as fixed and resolved since it is working for me, and it shouldn't be treated as a blocker by Carol, etc. Once Dave is sure that it is correct, it will become part of the QuickStart.
column79: Confirmed fixed. QuickStart works on Windows now.

column1: [SAK-379] User with user-defined role has Samigo creation privilege
column6:
I have a user "daffy" who has type "registered" and has a "test" role (user-created) on the "Gap Testing" worksite. This user, when I assess Samigo, is able to create/edit assessments.

ISSUE: I thought this privilege was limited to users with type "maintain"
column10: User with user-defined role has Samigo creation privilege
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Since the test role has the site.upd permission, the user daffy has the ability to edit the site, and can create assesments in Samigo. The user's type (maintain, or guest) determines whether they have the ability to create new sites. But the type on their account isn't related to what permissions they have in a site - that's determined by their role. And for Samigo, I think the permission to create an assesment in Samigo vs just take the assesment is controlled, for now, by the site.upd permission.

So, I don't think this is a bug.
column45:
<i>I think the permission to create an assesment in Samigo vs just take the assesment is controlled, for now, by the site.upd permission</i>

Where's the site.upd permission set in terms of the user interface? Could you walk us through the steps to create a user who should have assessment creation/maintainer privileges, and then one who should only have access? It sounds like there's something I may be missing. Thanks! – Margaret
column49:
Nadine, I'm presuming John's suggestion that site.upd permisson for a Role matters to Samigo. I don't know myself.

So, how do you set a permission on a role in realm for a worksite?

(1) Login as admin.

(2) Determine the "ID" of the worksite by looking at the URL when you are viewing the site. In this case you'll see ".../site/Nadine's%20site/..." in the URL.

(3) In the admin's MyWorkspace, select the Realms tool.

(4) In Realms tool page to your site or search for it using the "ID" you determined earlier; note that you should substitue actual space characters for any %20's in the URL. So, in this case you could search for "Nadine's site", which will return several realms with that string. Click on the Realm ID for the site, in this case "/site/Nadine's site".

(5) Scroll down to the Role seciton of the page. Click on the role you want to examine permissions for. (Or, if you want to create a new role and define its permissions, then, click on the "Add Role" button at the top of the page.)

(6) In the list of permissions look for site.upd near the bottom of the page. You can then check/uncheck it to see what happens.

(7) To exit this page you can either click on the "Done" or "Save" button. The former will take you back up a level in the Realm editor, the later will save your changes and exit the Realm editor. If you want to save your changes, then make sure to hit the "Save" button at some level in the editor and not the "Cancel" button which will loose your edits.

She came in and started clicking around before figuring out that she had to select the
"New Account" and sign in. There are no INSTRUCTIONS on how to use the system that is
obvious. I even had to point out to her that the '?' were there. She did not notice it.
Maybe you should have a "Were to go from Here" menu option?????

2. Once logged in, she was at a loss as to how to proceed. INSTRUCTIONS ARE NEEDED on this first page. The context sensitive help that you get from the MyWorkspace '?' is related to a worksite, rather than MyWorkspace. The help gives you KEY CONCEPTS, but it does not tell you how to begin using the system.

3. There is no specific help on the Membership tool. Help does not tell you how to add a class or project. Maybe you should changed "Membership" to "Add/Drop Class/Project" so that the user has an idea of what next to do.

4. Otherwise, the system seems okay.

column1: [SAK-377] Rename "Samigo" to "Quiz and Test" in user interface
column6:
In the tools team meeting on 25th Feb 2005, the team decided to rename the Samigo tool in the user interface. It was decided that the new displayed name of the tool should be "Quiz and Test". This was intended to disambiguate Samigo from the Assignment tool, and also to name the tool in a generic fashion based on its function (all the other tools in the default installation have funtionally meaningful names).

This new name should appear in the following places:
Site Info
Worksite Setup
The lefthand navigation bar
The title of the tool

When creating a site, the long description of the "Quiz and Test" tool will still have "Samigo" in it, so that people looking for Samigo will still find it.

Previously created sites displaying "Samigo" as the name of the tool will continue to display "Samigo". If the site owners wish to see the new name, they can remove the tool (in Site Info or Worksite Setup) and add it back again.

column1: [SAK-376] Text documents do not wrap in browser
column6: When viewing Text documents from the resources area, the text does not wrap when you view it in a browser.
column10: Text documents do not wrap in browser
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: update priority
column45:
I can confirm that this is an issue.

There are some technical considerations in getting the browser to wrap text files. The browser is currently doing what it normally does with plain text files, which is to not wrap them.

If the text file is downloaded and saved, and viewed in a text editor instead of the browser, the text wrapping will be up to the text editor. Most text editors will wrap the text file by default.

However, the browser's default behavior for plain text files is to not wrap them. If we need the browser to to wrap our text files, there may be ways to force the browser to treat our text files differently.
column49: Changing issue to a Feature Request: the desire to have plain-text files wrapped by the browser.
column71: At the time this was reported there wasn't the option to add an html doc. Users should be advised to use this type of structured object instead of a text file if they wish to view it in a browser window

column1: [SAK-374] Syllabus content not retained
column6:
Select the syllabus tool for the course site and put in content in the syllabus area.

Please contact me if you need further clarification (ma287@columbia.edu)
column10: Syllabus content not retained
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Lance, other Sakai tools will keep their content when removed/re-added, so its probably set-up an expectation that they all do. Is Syllabus currently capable of that, or would this be a new feature for Syllabus?
column45: Please verify your solution with me before implementing it. Thanks, L
column49: Currently, Syllabus item content is associated with pageId. Each site could have a lot of different pages. If we want to keep all the data users have input in one syllabus tool page for a certain site, we need associate syllabus item with siteId. That means different pages that have syllabus tool inside one site will have the same data. This is a conflict with an old bug saying different pages shouldn't have same data inside one site. I am re-assigning this bug back to Lance. We need the decision from tool design team.
column71:
Tim, currently Syllabus supports placing the tool in a Site multiple times. Thus it is keyed on pageId instead of siteId; this is why removing and adding back the Syllabus tool does not retain data.

The Syllabus used to be keyed on siteId, but we modified the key to resolve a reported bug which was to support multiple placements of Syllabus per Site. We need to make a decision as to whether we go back to only supporting one placement per Site to address this particular enhancement request. Thanks, L
column75: Chen, please modify the Help tool and data model so that Syllabus is keyed off of siteId and not pageId. This change should allow for removal/addition of the Help tool while maintaining previously authored content. Please work with Jarrod on making the data model transition as smooth as possible. Thanks, L
column79: What is the state of the syllabus data relative to this issue in Sakai2? Thanks, L
column83: Syllabus data is associated with Placement and Context in Sakai2.0. It shares the same data for one site.
column92: This has been resolved for 2.0. Thanks, L
column96: Looks good on rc3 on Oracle

column1: [SAK-373] wrong creation time for site object
column6:
I can repeat the problem from IU nightly build machine and my local build, but not on MIT stable build.

Go to Worksite setup and create a project site. The new site in the list view shows creation time of "Mar 3, 2005 3:51 am", even though my local time is "Mar 2, 2005, 12:51pm".

However, the creation times are correct in other tools, "Announcements", "Resources", "Discussion", "Assignments" and "Chat".

  • Zhen
column10: wrong creation time for site object
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
It is confirmed that the problem only happens with HSQLDB implementation, and not with MySQL or ORACLE.

The reason for the time shifting resides in the prepareStatement function inside BasicSqlService:

protected int prepareStatement(PreparedStatement pstmt, Object[] fields)
{
.....
else if (fields[i] instanceof Time)

{ Time t = (Time) fields[i]; pstmt.setTimestamp(pos, new Timestamp(t.getTime()), m_cal); ****<--- The setTimestamp() inside HSQLDB jdbc implementation of PreparedStatement generates wrong time using the given Calendar object, which is set to GregorianCalendar in our case*** pos++; }

.....
}

One possible solution to it is make the m_cal be a null value. So that the driver will use the default timezone, which is that of the virtual machine running the application, and returns correct time value.

  • Zhen
column45: The time specified for the creation of a worksite is almost correct. It is giving me PM instead of AM, but the time itself seems fine. However, if the site is duplicated, the time specified for the duplicated site is NOT correct.
column49:
To my understanding, the fix to this ticket, BaseSqlService v1.53, wasn't included in either sakai_1-5-1-rc1(BaseSqlService 1.50.2.4) or sakai_1-5-1-m1(BaseSqlService 1.50.2.3). That's why you couldn't see it on MIT stable build now.

Please correct me if I'm wrong.

  • Zhen
column71: Creation time is accurate.

column79:
Okay. I think I've figured out the problem.

When editing the Settings, the "Assessment Introduction" area has a description field. In Netscape7.2, I cannot enter data into this field unless I hit the <> button. The first time this <> button is hit, the mode becomes 'text' mode. The second time it is hit, the mode becomes 'WYSIWYG' (or something like that).

I was hitting the <> button only once, so I was entering data in text mode. This caused the system to be very slow, and also, I think, resulted in the eventual logging out of the system.

I just tried it after hitting the <> button, waiting for it to update (which takes a while) then hitting the <> button again (so entering in WYSIWYG mode) and was able to not only save the settings BUT STAYED LOGGED IN!!!
column83: Aha! We use the Indiana WYSIWYG editor, and haven't been given an opportunity to do anything with it, but maybe Ed can see if there's any obvious way to fix this. This is a blocker bug, Ed, could you look at it right away?
column92:
The toggle is a side effect in Gecko-based browsers such as Netscape, Mozilla, Firefox, etc. It is caused by the combination of BOTH the WYSIWYG and the SHOW/HIDE functionality, so it should be restricted to three screens. It appears to be a timing issue that only occurs in those browsers. When they are hidden and opened, they don't "catch up" to the fact that they are in edit mode.

It looks like in some browsers, where there is the toggle, there are also the additional reported problems as side effects, which apparently come from one (as opposed to two) clicks of "<>".

This problem was actually seen in the Navigo Struts WYSIWYG and a similar SHOW/HIDE. In that case we programatically tested that the browser was Mozillish and programatically swiched every WYSIWYG to twice, simulating a toggle. That code will not carry over directly to the current code base. We never saw the reported single-click side effects.
column96:
proposed fix
------------

This appears to be a Mozilla problem inside hideable divisions once they are closed.

We had coded around this in Navigo, but the code was slightly different. However, I think I have a small fix that could go in very fast, and improve the situation.

Doing a quick test with suppressing the body onload (a function that compresses the hideable divisions) indicates that the WYSIWYG settings appear to intialize normally in Mozilla. I propose that we do a quick change to do a browser sniff and suppress the onload for Mozilla, so that the hidable divisions load in an opened state. The Mozilla users need to have documentation to tell them not to compress a section that contains a wysiwyg.
column127:
I made a slightly better solution than the one that I proposed. I am loading an alternate function in the body onload of the settings pages, which have wysiwyg and hideDivisions. This alternate method checks to see if it is a Gecko-based browser and (if it is) turns off both the click handling for the arrow icon on the hideDivision and the hiding of the divisions. I am able to update assessment and template settings in both IE and Mozilla.

The only drawback is that the divisions are not hidden in Gecko based browsers. I suggest that we close this bug targeted for 1.51 and open another one of minor severity and target 2.0. OK?

column188:
We have a correct QA procedure to follow? Cool! Can I see it?

Summary:
I was able to reproduce the problem on sakai-stable.mit using a Mac with Firefox and repeated attempts. (Detailed steps below). It looks as though switching from text mode to wysiwyg mode and back - or something similar - can trigger the bug; once it happens, I can't see or edit text in the wysiwyg boxes using Firefox on a mac. The same text is visible/editable using IE on a Mac or PC.

I could not reproduce the problem on the standalone aam-dev instance. Marc, have you seen the problem there, or only in the integrated version?

Mac 10.3.8, IE 5.2, Firefox 1.0
server: sakai-stable.mit.edu
Site: DISASTER 245 001

Steps:

1. View settings of existing assessment "2.28 Marith open" in FF.
All assessment settings should be visible here, but now they're not - I can only see Assessment Intro, Delivery Dates, Submission, and Feedback. Is this what Marc meant by "collapsed sections"?

2. Edit assessment intro message in FF.
I clicked on the <> button once and added text in text mode, then saved the settings. All the text I typed, plus all the pre-existing text, vanished.

3. View and edit settings for the same assessment in IE.
The settings are still missing, but the pre-existing assessment intro text is back. However, the wysiwyg editor window in IE is so tiny it's almost unusable (see attached screenshot). I can edit and save the intro text in IE with no problems.

4. Create new assessment "3.16 mac test" in IE with all settings visible/enabled.
The intro box is still TINY, but I can see all the settings, edit and save text.

5. View/modify the new assessment in FF.
The settings are all still there. This time I can edit the assessment intro text in text mode (single-click <>) and save it. I tried several times without reproducing the problem.

6. Create new assessment "3.16 mac test 2" in FF with all settings visible/enabled.
(This time I also imported some questions.)Settings OK, text editing OK, publishing assessment OK -where'd the problem go?

7. View/modify the "mac test 2" assessment in FF.
This time I edited the assessment intro text switching back and forth between text mode and html mode, using the <> toggle. When I saved, the text vanished.

8. View/modify the old "2.28 marith open" assessment in FF.
The assessment intro text is now missing. I can't edit it at all, in either text or html mode - the wysiwyg editor won't let me insert text even when I click the <> toggle.

9. View/modify the old "2.28 marith open" assessment in IE.
The missing assessment intro text is now back, and I can edit it and save changes.
column192:
This should now be tracked in SAK-467 Closed .

As far as what I can tell from what you are saying, the original bug is gone.

Reopening this bug is misleading, as it is telling everybody that there is a critical wysiwyg bug involving data loss and crashing.

There are several different issues

1. Marc was running on an "old" version. That is why you asked about collapsed sections. You just confirmed that his report is out of date.

2. Showing 4 sections sounds like the default template, which disables editability of the other sections. How do I know that this is supposed to have more sections? Anyway it has nothing to do with the UI, as the back end is usgion the same settings for IE. Earlier versions of export import will use the default template, even if the original assessment did not. Mabye this is what you are seeing. The latest versions of import turn on all the editable flags and then look at the QTI assessment to see if it has any flags that can be turned off. Only the latest versions of export will set those flags. so the behavior of imported/exported assessments will differ depending on how up to date Samigo is.

3. Are you toggling because you think you cannot edit in FF? That was a workaround until we suppressed the collapse of the sections in Gecko-based browsers. I am able to edit in Mozilla fine without toggling, does the same go for FF?

4. It looks like you have two moderate priority bugs, both of which can be put into SAK-467 Closed
a) intermittent display/editabily bug toggling the view source button (not required for normal editing).
b) infrequent font issue in IE in some versions of the browser with some font settings, with some monitors etc.

I am reassinging back.
column196:
3. Are you toggling because you think you cannot edit in FF? That was a workaround until we suppressed the collapse of the sections in Gecko-based browsers. I am able to edit in Mozilla fine without toggling, does the same go for FF?

Nope. I'm unable to type in the wysiwyg editor box in FF until I click the toggle button at least once.

Could we meet to go over this bug tomorrow, perhaps? I can demonstrate what I see in the ATL lab and you can tell me if it should still go under SAK-467 Closed . Thanks.

column1: [SAK-356] Creating a New Account should check to see if the user ID is in the UserDirectoryProvider.
column6: When a New Account is created, the UserDirectoryProvider implementation is not checked to see if the user exists. The UserDirectoryProvider interface has a boolean method userExists(String id) which requires implementation by a custom UserDirectoryProvider. This method should be called before creating a user through the "New Account" tool, otherwise there can be two users with the same User ID who access the same information.
column7:
Server: Debian Linux, JDK 1.4.2_06, Apache Tomcat 5.0.28, MySQL 4.1.9;
Clients: Internet Explorer 6, Mozilla Firefox 1.0
column10: Creating a New Account should check to see if the user ID is in the UserDirectoryProvider.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This is actually a request to change the way Sakai is designed to work. There are cases where we want to have a shadow account internal to Sakai that matches the account provided by the user directory provider. For this reason, we allow internal accounts to be created and do not reject them if they are defined by the provider.

This could be something we configure into the UserDirectoryService or the Provider.
column45:
If anyone is interested in disabling creation of accounts that already exist in the "UserDirectoryProvider", this is a quick "fix" for the 1.5 release.

In the "legacy-component" source tree (SAKAI_SRC_ROOT/legacy-component/src/java), edit the source file for the class org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.user.BaseUserDirectoryService

In the method: public UserEdit addUser(String id);
add:

// ************************************** BEGIN ADDED CODE **************************************
if(m_provider.userExists(id)) {
throw new IdUsedException("User " + id + " already exists in the directory.");
}
if(id != null) {
// Here you can add some additional logic if you need it. For example: make sure that ID is
// a valid email address (so as not to conflict with your LDAP namespace)
}
// *************************************** END ADDED CODE ***************************************
column49: [Bulk Comment] This issue was reported as affecting versions of Sakai that are no longer supported (1.0, 1.5.x or 2.0.x). It is likely that this issue has been taken care of by redesign or bug fixing since it was first reported, so the issue is being Closed; however, if you feel the issue is still relevant for more recent versions of Sakai (i.e., Sakai 2.3.1), then please re-open the issue and add the more recent version of Sakai to the list of Affects Versions. Thank you.

column6:
I just unjoined from several sites (after I had basically locked myself out of them by changing my access level to 'access'. Not condusive to testing the editing features then huh).

column41:
Are you doing this as admin, by any chance?

I just tried this with a new project site using my individual account, and couldn't reproduce it. After creating the site I set my role to access, unjoined through "Membership", and then it was unavailable to me through Worksite setup as well.
column45:
Sakai is currently caching security information for a configurable time (defaulting to 3 minutes). This means that if your security status changes, it will be up to 3 minutes until this change is fully put into effect. I can see that you could still access or modify a site after you have unjoined it for 3 minutes.

You could confirm this by repeating the process, but waiting more than 3 minutes and see if you still can do what you should have no permission to do.
column49: Cheryl, I was unable to reproduce this issue either, using a non-admin account; admin will of course always be able to access any worksite. Can you provide explicit instructions on how to re-create the issue? Thanks.
column71:
More from Cheryl Wogahn:

I see that no one is able to reproduce the behavior I reported about a 'Next' (or 'Previous' for that matter) button appearing for the next site in the list of editable sites and then not having it produce an error or any message saying I don't have permission to edit a site...

Here was the scenario and some things I have come up with since I did some more testing...

I had three sites I was a member of. The first two sites, I had 'maintain' access. The third site, I had 'access' only access.

When I selected the box next to Site #1 and clicked 'Revise', it brought me to the screen where it showed the members of the site, their access levels, etc.

I saw the next site listed with the Next button, I clicked on it and it went there as if I was to edit it (as expected).

On the Site #2 screen, I saw the Next button for Site #3 to which I did NOT have edit privileges. Clicking Next, I would think would show some indication that I did not have edit privileges, but it did not. I would think it would skip to the next editable site (if I had one) or throw a message up saying I didn't have privileges.

I am now signed up for various sites right now, with Gap Test and Gap Test 2 as the last sites in my list.

I am looking at Gap Test right now and click on Gap Test 2 and the screen refreshes, but I don't move to Gap Test 2, nor do I get any type of error message.

HOWEVER, a new problem has arisen (and I have not logged it in Jira as yet). I edited a site where I had maintain access. I changed my own access to 'access' only and clicked 'Update'.

Even after changing MY access level to 'access', I could still view other members' access levels AND change them! Is this correct behavior?

Also, I was also able to go ahead and try to make changes to the site itself, but it only briefly flashed an error message saying I didn't have maintain privileges and flashed back to the 'Finish' screen. If I looked away briefly, I never saw the error message and thought I had privileges to make changes.

I hope this makes sense.
column75: OK, I can reproduce that first report. The unjoined site no longer appears in the list of Worksite info, and the tab isn't available, but if you try to revise one of the remaining sites in Worksite info, you can access the info of the unjoined site through the "Next" and "Previous" buttons at the upper right. And you can continue to do this beyond the 3-minute time period mentioned earlier. If, however, you return to the sites list and come back after that time, then the unjoined site is no longer available through the "Next" and "Previous" buttons.
column79: I didn't see on stable that you could even unjoin at all. Clicking the checkbox next to a site in the membership tool, then clicking unjoin, didn't remove the site from the list of sites I was joined to.
column83:
This ticket has included a few issues. So I did some testing against each of them.

1. Testing against John's post - can't unjoin at all.

On whisk with newest release

  • unjoining "Joanne Test"(maintain role), or "suiyy@yahoo test"(owner role). The names of the sites stay in the list.
  • unjoining "Joanne Test 456"(member role). It works. Then add back to "Joanne Tes 456" site with the owner role. Then unjoining failed. Back to member, unjoining works.

Conclusions so far: unjoin is based on permissions. Not working at least for the level higher than "maintain".
Issues: do we allow a site owner/maintainer to unjoin a site? There might be only one maintainer or owner.

2. Testing against Cheryl Wogahn's second issue- still be able to edit the site, even she has changed the site permission from maintain to access.

Conclusions: I did some testing on this. Glenn's reply has the answer - "Sakai is caching security info for a configurable time ( default to 3 minutes)". So after changing the permissions, wait for about 3 minutes, then when you try to edit the site again, the page will be refreshed, and you'll see a page without editable fields (as expected).

3. Testing against the original issue of Cheryl - a site still be available in worksite setup tool even it is unjoined.

-I still can't reproduce it on either whisk(with newest release) or CTools. Right after unjoining the site, I went to worksite setup tool. Navigate the list throught Prev/Next. The unjoined site is gone.

Cheryl, and Clay, can any of you give a link of the server where you did the testing? That will be very helpful. Thanks.

column49:
I may have identified the root cause of SAK-333 Closed (and probably SAK-348 Closed as well).

Root cause:
Its a variable name clash on the request variable "pid". Sakai uses it for one thing, Samigo for another completely different thing. In the integrated version, this request variable name clash causes problems.

Recommended solution:
Change Samigo so that it doesn't use "pid" anywhere anymore, and instead uses something else (like "samigo.pool.id").

So the question is, which should we change for 1.5? Sakai or Samigo?

Background: Sakai needs to keep track of which tool a user is viewing. This problem is one that every portal faces, because each request related to a site/page/tool/portlet needs to be associated with that particular site/page/tool/portlet. Keeping track of this state must be done at the request/pageflow scope, not the session scope, because a user may view more than one tool on a page at the same time, and/or more than one site or page (in different browser windows). Sakai keeps track of the current portlet in a request variable called "pid". This request variable appears on every request, since every request must be properly associated with the particular site/page/tool/portlet instance that is being viewed at that time. Samigo uses the same name for a completely different variable; Samigo uses "pid" as the Question Pool ID.

Alternatives:
Disambiguate the request variable "pid". Either Sakai should use a different variable (like "sakai.tool.id" for example), or Samigo should use a different variable (like "samigo.pool.id" for example).

The simpler solution is probably to change Samigo to use a different variable name. "pid" is hard-coded several places in both applications. However, it appears in more places in Sakai than in Samigo, so in my opinion it would be more error-prone to change Sakai at this point than Samigo.

Future:
For 2.0, the Sakai portal should either put all its variables in a documented namespace (like "sakai.tool.id"), or document somewhere which variable names are reserved and shouldn't be used by integrated tools (like "don't use request variable pid").

column1: [SAK-339] SYL: Permission Error: You have no permission for this action!
column6:
There appears to be a permission set-up problem for sakai.syllabus? This error displays: 'You have no permission for this action!'. John Leasia said it looks ok on nightly with the following comment:

> I'm not sure why it's not working on rc10. It is ok on nightly, so
> perhaps the tables that syllabus uses weren't created on the mit
> machine? Permissions look correct - if you have site.upd I believe that
> controls whether you can create a new syllabus item or not, and that is
> set properly on the mit rc10.

I verified these tables exist on stable: SAKAIUSER.SYLLABUS_T & SAKAIUSER.SYLLABUS_DATA_T. However, there are no rows in either table. I don't know how to verify whether site.upd exists on stable. Stable has 62 tables having owner='SAKAIUSER'.

REFERENCE 1: SQL

select * from SAKAIUSER.SYLLABUS_DATA_T;
select * from SAKAIUSER.SYLLABUS_T;

REFERENCE 2: Steps to recreate problem:

Syllabus:

  • Go to Sites on left menu.
  • Click on a Site Id on which you want to add Syllabus feature.
  • In Continue Editing section, click Pages button.
  • Click Page Id having Title=Resources.
  • In Continue Editing section, click Tools button.
  • Click Tool Id having Title=Resources.
  • Click radio button for Feature=Syllabus.
  • In Continue Editing section, click Done button.
  • In Complete the Site Edit, click Save button.
  • In more, select your site.
  • Click Resources on left menu and you'll see Syllabus Tool.
  • ISSUE: This error displays for which I don't yet know solution: You have no
    permission for this action!
  • Alternatively, you can create a new user-defined page having Feature=Syllabus
    (see New Page instruction below)

New Page (adds page name to left menu):

  • Go to Sites on left menu.
  • Click Site Id having Title=<your site name>
  • In Continue Editing section, click Pages button.
  • Click New Page button.
  • Add Title=Syllabus, Presentation, Profile or whatever (This title will show up on
    left menu of your site)
  • In Continue Editing section, Click Tools.
  • Click New Tool
  • Click radio button for Feature=Syllabus or whatever.
  • Click Done.
  • Click Save.
  • In more, select your site.
  • Click Syllabus, Presentation, Profile or whatever to access Tool Feature.

column1: [SAK-333] Broken link in Samigo - take assessment
column6:
The take assessment link seems to be broken in the student view.

To reproduce the bug:
1. Join site "SamigoTest" as a regular user (by logging in, clicking "Membership" on the left, selecting the "SamigoTest" checkbox, and then clicking join).
2. Navigate to the "SamigoTest" project site
3. Click on "Samigo"
4. Click on the assessment "Quick Survey of reactions to Samigo".

Symptom:
Clicking on the assessment name doesn't do anything - it just spins and comes back to the same screen.

Note that logging in as an administrator and taking the assessment does work correctly, it appears to be broken in the student case.

This could be a bug in the authorization, in the student view screen, or somehow in the sakai-samigo integration code. It seems pretty serious, but I'm not sure since I'm only seeing it in this case.

Background: Sakai needs to keep track of which tool a user is viewing. This problem is one that every portal faces, because each request related to a site/page/tool/portlet needs to be associated with that particular site/page/tool/portlet. Keeping track of this state must be done at the request/pageflow scope, not the session scope, because a user may view more than one tool on a page at the same time, and/or more than one site or page (in different browser windows). Sakai keeps track of the current portlet in a request variable called "pid". This request variable appears on every request, since every request must be properly associated with the particular site/page/tool/portlet instance that is being viewed at that time. Samigo uses the same name for a completely different variable; Samigo uses "pid" as the Question Pool ID.

Alternatives:
Disambiguate the request variable "pid". Either Sakai should use a different variable (like "sakai.tool.id" for example), or Samigo should use a different variable (like "samigo.pool.id" for example).

The simpler solution is probably to change Samigo to use a different variable name. "pid" is hard-coded several places in both applications. However, it appears in more places in Sakai than in Samigo, so in my opinion it would be more error-prone to change Sakai at this point than Samigo.

Future:
For 2.0, the Sakai portal should either put all its variables in a documented namespace (like "sakai.tool.id"), or document somewhere which variable names are reserved and shouldn't be used by integrated tools (like "don't use request variable pid").

column1: [SAK-330] Add 'request membership' option to joinable sites
column6:
We have been using dotLRN from MIT Sloan School to support communities for over 2 years. There are 3 site membership options in dotLRN; Open, Closed, and Request Membership. When a user clicks on membership, she cannot see closed groups but she can see groups with a 'Join' option and other groups with a 'Request Membership' option (see attached screenshot). If membership of a 'Request Membership' group is selected, the group admin is notified and the group admin can decide whether to admit or refuse the member.

Approximately one third of our groups choose this option. The Sakai site we are running, which is supporting external researchers (who have not seen dotLRN) is already requesting something similar. I believe it would be a very useful feature.

Action: In Assessment questions, add a new part (let's say part 2) to an assessment. Then use the pulldown menu at the top of the screen to choose "import question from question pool".

Any questions you import will go into part 1 of the assessment. There's no direct way to create part 2 and populate it with imported questions.

As a workaround, you can create a new question and assign it to part 2, or move a question from part 1 to part 2. After that part 2 will have its own menu with an import questions option. But that's slower and not very intuitive.

How about adding a question-types menu to each new part as soon as it's created, rather than only after the first question is added?

Can you provide an example of the characters that aren't working? Could you email me the characters, or tell me their Unicode #s so that I can reproduce it? Is there an existing Sakai site somewhere that shows the bug, that you can point me to?

Clay,

column71: I can go one better: after reinstalling my language packs, everything displays appropriately. My apologies for the red herring.
column75:
This issue teaching something about international characters - they are not uniformly supported by the Windows operating system.

If you want to input and view certain character sets (such as Chinese), you need the correct language packs installed on your system. If the language packs aren't installed properly, Windows won't display the characters properly, regaurdless of Sakai.

Perhaps a note about this should be filed away in the documentation somewhere? Or perhaps this should be filed in the Sakai help system under some topic like "non-Roman (international) characters".
