column1: [SAK-325] inconsistent jar locations and versions in Tomcat
column6:
There are multiple copies and multiple versions of jars in multiple locations when Sakai, help, syllabus, and Samigo are integrated.

While Sakai supports different versions of jars for different webapps the Hibernate documentation clearly says that the hibernate library must be in the web context not in shared/lib. This is to resolve class loader problems. Current we only do this for Samigo. Sakai places it in shared. The help and syllabus tools place it in shared. This gives two different versions of the hibernate jar in the same incorrect directory.

Spring places it in the application context.

We must at least remove one copy of hibernate from shared so that the choice of the jar is deterministic.

To use the common (and therefore most supported) configuration we should move the hibernate jars into the webapps that require them and test that this configuration works.

We need to understand the issues that IU had using hibernate from the application context to see if it is a sign of underlying problems.
column10: inconsistent jar locations and versions in Tomcat
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: We feel like we have a good handle on this issue for the Sakai 1.5 release. We are going to have to compromise for this release and place the hibernate.jar into Tomcat's common/lib directory thus forcing a specific version of hibernate on webapps. We will need to revisit this issue in the Sakai2 Framework. David is currently wresting with SAMigo and QuickStart. Once this issue is resolved, we can close this issue. L
column45: I am removing this as a blocker for the 1.5 release. This problem cannot be solved immediately and we will have to try to resolve this in the new 2.0 work.
column49: The shared jars are now provisioned by the kernel; sakai2 has a much cleaner implementation.

column1: [SAK-317] Unable to create worksite
column6:
This happened twice, so I'm logging it as a bug.

1. Logged in as admin
2. Went to MyWorkspace->Worksite Setup
3. Changed page view to view 50 items on the page
4. Clicked on "New"
5. Selected "Project" and continue
6. Filled in the title, description, and short description
7. Clicked on continue

It took a LOOOONNNNNNGGGGGGG time to get to the next page

8. Selected the tools to be used
9. Selected the import from other worksite option
10. Selected the "Gap Testing" worksite

column1: [SAK-315] url forwarding not working in sakai-samigo
column6:
From: rgollub@stanford.edu
Subject: Re: url forwarding is not working in sakai-samigo
Date: February 23, 2005 1:47:45 PM EST
To: daisyf@stanford.edu
Cc: janderse@umich.edu, esmiley@stanford.edu, dlhaines@umich.edu, melledge@umich.edu

Jon, this looks really critical. Can you take a look? Did you test
the case of reloading the same page with different parameters in URL
rewriting?

Daisy, I know a number of people have taken assessments in the
combined Sakai Samigo with no problems – does this only happen for
one assessment, or one type of assessment? Can you see what the
conditions are for this?

Daisy Flemming wrote:
Hey Rachel & Jon,
Looks like JSF have trouble forwarding in sakai-samigo, after completing one question, it stucks at the same page and not executing the action. This is a problem in delivery and not in authoring. Probably because we use Listener to do the process instead of bean method.
E.g. in the deliverAssessment page, after you click "Save and Exit", it doesn't looks like that delivery.saveAndExit() were executed at all. I didn't find the record in the DB and I got the URL forwarding warning.
<h:commandButton type="submit" value="#

{msg.button_save_x}

"
action="#

{delivery.saveAndExit}

" id="saveAndExit"
rendered="#

{delivery.previewMode ne 'true'}

" onclick="pauseTiming='true'">
</h:commandButton>
SetupSakaiServicesFilter.rewriteURL: OLD URL: /samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces NEW URL: /xtunnel/samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces
Feb 22, 2005 10:46:19 PM org.sakaiproject.component.framework.log.Jdk14Logger warn
WARNING: org.sakaiproject.util.servletfilter.SetupSakaiServicesFilter$WrappedResponse@8e00d.rewriteURL: OLD URL: /samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces NEW URL: /xtunnel/samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces
If you think of anything that I can try, let me know. Thanks.
Daisy

–
Rachel Gollub
Academic Computing
Stanford University
rgollub@stanford.edu
column10: url forwarding not working in sakai-samigo

column41: Please update this entry when you find out more.
column45:
Daisy and I discussed this over the phone this morning. We haven't yet discovered exactly what is causing the problem, we only see the symptoms so far.

Daisy is attempting to workaround the problem by changing from using an action to using an actionListener.

The 'warning' message in the logs is misleading, and should be disabled. The message shows that the filter is doing what it should do, forwarding messages through the /xtunnel to Samigo.

1) Not saving text box entries was fixed last week – you need a later version of the Samigo code.

column75:
>... if I'm real fast, ...I get a bunch of horizontal fields, each of which has to be expanded ...
That is by design. This is the layout that has been defined by the designers and is in the mock-ups.

>I expand that and I'm able to edit the title, but the description area is not editable.

Should be editable in Netscape 7. Are you able to edit any rich text field?

I think what is happening is that in Mozilla-like browsers inside the collapsable horizontal fields, the rich text field is edit disabled. There is a workaround, clicking the "<>" button, should make the rich text editable. I was able to duplicate this problem in Mozilla, and verify this workaround.

Before porting to JSF Stanford/Indiana had a Struts version of the editor, with a fix for this. Unfortunately that version is not TPP compliant and does not play well in JSF. It may be that the Sakai version (Samigo is using the version circa December) has this problem when in the collapsable bars.
column79:
Gecko/Mozilla-based browsers only.

1. Click "Assessment Introduction".
2. Double click the source code view button, toggling it.
3. Enter text.

column1: [SAK-302] Make the "Import" option more visible to users of "Samigo"
column6:
I had problems trying to "Import from Question Pool" in Samigo. The issue was that I did not notice the selection box to the RIGHT of the question that I wanted to import. To be consistent with the other tools in Sakai, it would be more appropriate to have the "Import" selection boxes on the LEFT of the screen, so one knows that one has to select the question to have it imported.

If one selects the "Import" button without first checking one of the import boxes, one gets a screen with the title of the questions and under each question are the following options:
Copy | Move | Export | Preview

If "Export" is selected, one gets a screen with XML formatted information and there is no way to exit this screen gracefully.

column1: [SAK-299] dbRealmService.refreshRealm(...): update SQL to ANSI SQL:92
column6: Update SQL SELECT statements to ANSI SQL:92 replacing sub-selects with JOIN statements when appropriate and tuning queries to improve performance.
column10: dbRealmService.refreshRealm(...): update SQL to ANSI SQL:92
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Resolved as follows:

// read the realm's grants
sqlBuf = new StringBuffer();
sqlBuf.append("select SRRG.USER_ID, SRR.ROLE_NAME, SRRG.ACTIVE, SRRG.PROVIDED ");
sqlBuf.append("from SAKAI_REALM_RL_GR SRRG ");
sqlBuf.append("inner join SAKAI_REALM SR on SRRG. REALM_KEY = SR. REALM_KEY ");
sqlBuf.append("inner join SAKAI_REALM_ROLE SRR on SRRG.ROLE_KEY = SRR.ROLE_KEY ");
sqlBuf.append("where SR.REALM_ID = ?");
sql = sqlBuf.toString();

//String statement = "select USER_ID, ROLE_NAME, ACTIVE, PROVIDED from SAKAI_REALM_RL_GR,SAKAI_REALM_ROLE " +
//"where REALM_KEY in (select REALM_KEY from SAKAI_REALM where REALM_ID = ?) " +
//"and SAKAI_REALM_RL_GR.ROLE_KEY=SAKAI_REALM_ROLE.ROLE_KEY";

column75:
This seems to be an expectation management issue. The WYSIWYG editor is not yet supported in Safari. Any text entered into the text area is subject to HTML browser interpretation. If the user wants paragraph breaks, they should be entered using HTML syntax; e.g.:

<p>paragraph1</p>
<p>paragraph2</p>
column79:
I've got to squabble about Fixed and Resolved here. I understand this as an expectation management issue, but it's more. Our Minimum Requirements state:

CTools is designed to work fully with the following browsers:...

Macintosh:
Netscape 7.1 and newer
Mozilla firebird
Mozilla Firefox

...And then...

Some functions in CTools will not work well or will not work at all in the following browsers (for example, the WYSIWYG editor that can be used to format text entries is not compatible with the following browsers)....

(including Safari)

But that's inaccurate. It's not just that "some funcitons" like the "editor that can be used to format text entries" doesn't work on some browsers, it's that a BASIC function-- adding paragraph breaks to text entries-- doesn't work on Safari.

Granted we are a pretty Mac-centric campus. I think I once read where we have more Mac's in student labs and in faculty offices than almost any other campus in North America. It's the default browser on something like 30% of our campus computing sites machines. And, more importantly, it's the only browser for which some departments offer Mac desktop support to their instructors.

We have never had an expectation that a standard user needed to know html to do post a standard message. How can that be our expectation now? The WYSIWYG implementation breaks that basic function for so many of our users, yet it's not considered a bug.

I'm pounding on this because I know of other, similar applications where you can have your WYSIWYG and eat it too. In another piece of locally developed software, the WYSIWYG is evoked by the user. If it's not evoked or not available, then paragraph breaks are maintained.

THis issue causes a lot of support traffic for us, and our responding recommendation to download a new software program isn't always received positively by the user. Many instructors are uncomfortable downloading applications-- besides, this "USED TO WORK, BUT NOW IT'S BROKEN," they tell us.

Seems like this kind of a basic interaction should work across not only the short list but the longer list as well. Otherwise, Safari users are getting along quite well with Sakai, thank you very much.

I understand that there are deeper reasons for not supporting Safari, but this is the one issue that actually matters to users. I also think I understand that this is expected to improve as the Apple APIs and the third-party widget come together. Is this expected to resolve itself sooner? Later? Never? If never, then we really do have an expectation management issue alone.
column83: Tested this on RC3 and it is still creating this problem. Was this ticket classified as "resolved" because someone tried to fix it, or was it "resolved" because we're not going to deal with it any more at this point? If it's the latter, then should we close it?
column92: For Sakai, Safari is not a "fully supported" browser. It is a "known issues" browser; it can be used, but a user will not get full functionality from Sakai at this time.
column96: Safari is not a fully supported browser.

  • Created new Project site having Samigo tool using admin/admin: SAMP008

column1: [SAK-289] Samigo is not saving correctly
column6:
I create a new project site to evaluate Samigo (John's Samigo test) as Sakai admin
[N.B. 's' after John' does not show up - not sure if this was a typo at setup, or a bug]

[This first problem is probably a separate issue, but is included for completeness]

I try to add my regular account to the worksite as maintainer - Alert: john@caret.cam.ac.uk is not a valid username

The site is joinable so I logout of admin and login as john@caret

I join the site.

I switch user back to admin and upgrade my account to maintain

I set up an assignment "Quick Survey of reactions to Samigo" and publish it

I take the assignment. The last question is free text box and the answer does not appear to get saved.

Later I logout and create a new account for a student (to test student view and to test whether above Alert is due to an upgrade issue where pre-existing version accounts are found invalid)

I login to Sakai with account that has 'maintain' on worksite (john@caret) and try to add new user (john@norman-baldor) to site - Alert: john@norman-baldor.org is not a valid username

I logout again and login as new user (john@norman-baldor) to join with 'access' role

[Main Issue]

I join the worksite (John' Samigo test) and take the assignment as john@norman-baldor - I see the answers given by john@caret (site maintainer) and still cannot get the last answer saved.

I logout of Sakai in firefox and launch IE (in case Samigo is using cookies)

I login to Sakai as john@norman-baldor (student/access account) and open John' Samigo test site. I go to Samigo tool and Samigo Survey assessement. I still see original john@caret responses. I change them and try to save and exit. The last free text answer is still not saved.

I go back to the firefox browser and login as john@caret (site maintain role) and give answers Yes, agree, and "John maintain" - last answer is not saved.

I go to IE where I am still logged in as john@norman-baldor (student/access role) and I see the answers Yes, agree, and empty. I give the answers No, undecided and "John student" and click 'save and exit' - last answer does not appear to get saved.

I go back to John@caret in Firefox and see the student answers No, undecided and empty

It looks as if all answers are saved as the same user and that last answer is not saved (not yet tested if this is only a problem for free text final questions).

column1: [SAK-288] Automatic page view modification
column6:
1. Logged in as admin
2. Accessed MyWorkspace->Worksite Setup
3. Changed view from
"Show 10 items per page" to
"Show 20 items per page"
4. Revised the "Gap Testing" worksite
5. Added the Samigo tool to the worksite
6. "Comfirmation Site Tools" page came back with
You are removing the following site
Site Info
You are adding
Samigo + the list of already added sites
7. Clicked "Finish"
8. It took me back to the "Gap Testing" info page
9. I went back to verify that Site Info was not actually removed
since I had not specified that it be removed. It was there.
10. Clicked "Cancel" and was back to the "Gap Testing" info page
11. Clicked "Cancel" to get back to the list of worksites
12. The view was automatically changed to
"Show 200 items per page"

ISSUES:
1. Why did "Site Info" end up in the remove item list?
2. Why did the worksite view change to 200 items?

I tried duplicating this error. Can't get the first part (Site Info) to be duplicated, but the second part is being duplicated. Now I notice that on the "Gap Testing" info page, the "Gap Testing Participant's List" section has a drop box which indicates 200 items per page view. Maybe this is the problem?
column10: Automatic page view modification
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I was able to duplicate the entire error (including the Site Info "removal") when I tried adding the "Samigo" tool to the "Gap Test 2" worksite.
column45:
I couldn't recreate the first part either.

The page setting is getting set to 200 because that is the default when viewing a class roster via Site Info. The default was set to 200 because, for most classes, that will show all students w/o haing to change the setting, and doesn't overload the browser. Having it set to 10 requires for most classes extra clicks to get the whole roster to show, and it isn't immediately apparant to instructors that they need to do something to see the entire class roster.

So the issue is can there be a separate default for the number of items to show on a list for different pages that use the list control. e.g., have the default when viewing a class roster be 200 but the default for viewing the site list in wsetup set to something else, and not have the setting of the item count change on one page after going to some other page with a list count control.

column45:
There should not be an intermediate "welcome" page. If the URL is valid, then the user should either be forced to authenticate into Sakai then taken to the Begin Assessment page (released to authenticated users) or taken directly to Begin Assessment page (released to anon users).

See attached pdf for this mockup as well as mockup if URL is invalid.
column49:
fixed.

Here is the scenerio:
1. If a user has alraedy be authenticated (has an idenity), the url will take him directory to the BeginAssessment page
2. If a user is not authenticated and the assessment allow "Anonymous login", an anoymous acount will be created for the user and the app will take the user directly to the BeginAssessment page
3. If the user has not been authenticated and the assessment do not allow "Anonymous Login", the user will be taken to the sakai login front page. Note that the mock up that Marc described is not possible in sakai for now 'cos saki do not support direct url access.
4. If the url is invalid, we will take the user to the sakai front page form login

I will cc this to rachel, Jarrod & Marc.

Daisy

column1: [SAK-285] resource (file) access failure
column6:
When accessing a resource (file) from the /access path, sometimes we get an empty resource and the following log message:

WARNING: Sql.dbReadBinary(): java.sql.SQLException: Closed Connection

This is when the resource body binary is set in the database, and slow pool connections are being used for resource access.
column10: resource (file) access failure
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: After each use of the "slow" pool connections, they were accidently closed, instead of just closing their statement and returning the connection to the pool for reuse. On reuse the closed connection was, well, still closed, thus the bug.

column1: [SAK-284] Help tool transforms branding language for localization
column6: The help tool must have the ability to transform KB-specific, tagged wording into localized wording. For example, if the tagged KB word "Oncourse CL" appears in a document, it must be translated locally to whatever name the Sakai instance requires. KB will have to be consulted for proper tagging convention.

column41: This will not make it into Sakai2.
column45: Will this make 2.1.0?
column49: Stephen, is this still an issue for the Help project to address as of 2.2? Thanks.
column71:
Yes, this is a requirement which several sites have for dealing with, for example, renamed tools (e.g. Schedule > Calendar, Syllabus > Course Outline).

Steps required for this include:

  • Agree on tagging convention for documents originating from IU KB (and from tool authors)
  • Develop appropriate XSL for handling the substitution
  • Change the help tool so that the help docs are stored as .xml and the help tool applies the XSL at startup, rather than bundling html (to make it easier for sites to change items, and to handle certain changes such as tool titles dynamically).

column1: [SAK-282] Help tool should be able to use local cached copies of documents
column6: The help tool is presently configured to connect to the KB directly each time it is used. It must have the ability to read documents from a local cache. This ability makes it easier to incorporate a base set of documentation within the download file.
column10: Help tool should be able to use local cached copies of documents
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Jarrod, I want to implement persistent caching for help documents served up from the IU Knowledge Base (KB).

1. We need to create a table to store cached copies of documents (or maybe just a column).
2. We need to move from HSQLDB in-memory implementation to persistent storage.
3. Documents should have an MD5 sum which will be used to determine source document changes.
4. We need a process that will update the locally cached copies, if changed, on a regular basis.
5. We do not want to "swamp" the IU KB servers with synchronization traffic.
6. Sakai out-of-the-box DDL will contain recent copies of the cached data so that Sakai servers which cannot connect to the IU KB will have a functioning Help system.

Thanks, L
column45: This implementation will be delayed post 2.0. L
column49: Will this be included in the 2.1.0 release?
column71: Stephen is this still an issue for the Help project to address as of 2.2? Thanks.
column75: [Bulk Comment] This issue is currenlty classified as a Task scheduled to be addressed for 2.4, however, we are now past the Sakai 2.4 Code Freeze. At this time, work should be focused only on resolving Bugs and addressing release-related Tasks; no features should be added or modified at this point without notifying the Release Mangement team. Please update the estimated Fix Version of this issue to reflect more accurately when it will get addressed, such as in the next release, 2.5.0.000 [Tentative], or set it to Unknown. Thanks.
column79: Stephen, is this still an active issue?
column83:
Help can currently use help content from (1) static files bundled with the distribution, (2) remote files fetched via either REST in XML format or html via an external index.

Support for persistent caching of documents from an external source is not planned at this time (as no sites have expressed interest in such a feature and IU is using an alternate approach).

column1: [SAK-281] VelocityServlet error viewable in discussion tool
column6:
user1 – flmover1 – has permission to create and delete discussions
user2 – mickey2 – has permission to view discussions (no new/del permission)

1. Logged in as "flmover1", accessed the discussion tool
2. Logged in as "mickey2", accessed the discussion tool
3. As "flmover1," created a new discussion category and topic
4. As "flmover1," notice the new discussion entry
5. As "mickey2," notice the new discussion entry
6. As "flmover1," delete the discussion item (not the category)
7. As "mickey2," get the "VelocityServlet:Error processing the template" followed by a bunch of java error statements.

Issue: "mickey2" should not get this page.
column7:
user1 -- flmover1 -- Win2000, Netscape7.0
user2 -- mickey2 -- Win95, Netscape7.0
column10: VelocityServlet error viewable in discussion tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This sounds like a state synchronization issue.

Since the state of the discussion messages can change at any time, the discussion tool should either synchronize state when a change is made (when the item is deleted), OR (maybe easier) notice that the message is not available (in the Java or in Velocity), and fail more gracefully (don't display the message).
column45:
I think the priority on this issue is too high. Why is it "major"? The error won't happen very often in practice.

This is a transient error that depends on the synchronization of two user's actions and deletion of content, which probably won't happen very often in a production system.

This bug should be fixed, but I would recommend its priority be changed to "minor".
column49: This fix seems to be working as expected. This item can be closed.
column71:

Needs more work.
column75: Let me clarify. I went back and reused the name of a category that I had just deleted. The information shows up okay for the user creating the discussion item, but for someone who was already logged in and viewing discussions, the VelocityServlet error shows up.

column1: [SAK-277] realm / external realm provider mismatch causes NPE in realm editor
column6:
In certain circumstances, a Realm becomes un-editable.

This is when the realm has an external provider id, and the external provider grants a role in the realm, and the role it grants is not defined in the realm.

All roles that the external provider might grant in a realm must be pre-defined in the realm. Otherwise a) this bug occurs, and b) the role has no functions so grants the user no permissions in the realm.

Also, if a realm has a role defined, and the role is edited to remove all functions, the role disappears from the realm.
column10: realm / external realm provider mismatch causes NPE in realm editor
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: The realm service is more robust for this sort of mismatch - it will "create" missing roles (as long as the role is a valid role defined in the system) if needed. It will also hold on to "empty" roles better.

column1: [SAK-276] Data not being imported
column6:
controller is a user with a maintain role ie. able to create worksites

1. Logged in as controller
2. In MyWorkspace->Worksite Setup, selected New (for new worksite)
3. Went through the process of creating a new project worksite
4. Specified that Schedule, Announcements, Resources, and Discussions from the "Gap Testing" worksite should be duplicated in this new worksite
5. NOTHING was brought over.

ISSUE: Need to get this working for non-admins who have permission to create worksite. When I tried the same for an admin user, the only tool that had a problem was the Schedule tool, which is being address in another bug report. So this issue has to do with the NON-admin user who is allowed to create site.

I should also note that after creating the worksite as "controller" when I did the MyWorkspace->Worksite Setup and revised "Second Try" (the newly created worksite) and selected "Import" to import data from another site, the information WAS brought over (except for Schedule).

Bottom Line: Issue related to NON-admin user creating a new worksite and wanting to import data on site creation.

[Issue pertains to Gap 209.]
column10: Data not being imported
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This problem is caused by the non-admin users permissions.

First of all, when a non-admin user has no permission to add a site, the site duplicating won't work for this user.

A non-admin user who has site.add permission, can still have problems. That is because the tool hasn't committed the new site when the user needs to add new material to this new site. At that moment, the user doesn't have right permissions to this site, and would get rejected due to permission exceptions.

My fix: I let the tool commit the site first, right after the site id is available. Then the current user would become the owner of the site. Then let edit the site. Now the current non-admin user has all the right permissions to bring over the materials.

The testing against this fix looks well so far. I will check it in when CVS is open.
column45: I verified this fix. Seems to be okay.

column1: [SAK-274] Profile and Syllabus permissions need to be set in !site.template

column1: [SAK-272] Syllabus: HTML appears bolded in student view but preview is fine
column6:
when a user enters html in the WYSIWYG editor and previews this text, it appears fine. however, once the item is posted and one views it in student view, the font appears bolded. I've attached the html entered by the user.

Note: I am using the '<>' toggle to enter HTML in the WYSIWYG.
column10: Syllabus: HTML appears bolded in student view but preview is fine
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Sample HTML attachment.
column45:
This has to do with the way the WYSIWYG component works.

What is happening:

The WYSIWYG component attempts to clean up HTML when it is posted. This includes closing tags, checking for disallowed tags (<APPLET> for example), etc.

When malformed (syntactically incorrect) HTML is cleaned up, sometimes it changes how the browser displays the HTML.

Possible solutions:

  • Don't attempt to fix up HTML entered into the WYSIWYG editor at all. This will open us up to bugs where the HTML entered is broken, and causes other parts of the display to break too. For example, a malformed announcement could cause the rest of the UI displaying the announcement to be off.
  • Find some other way to isolate potentially broken HTML that is entered, from the rest of the portal.
column49: Chen will check with Jon and Ed to see if we can get HTMLArea's getHtml method working well. This function is called recursively. The returned text appears to be truncated.

Subject: WYSIWYG problem

Ed and Jon,
I've got this bug for a while: SAK-272 Closed and tried to get Jon's help last time. I am still not able to fix it. I tried to debug in htmlarea.js. I found out there are some problems with HTMLArea.getHTML = function(root, outputRoot, editor). When I put some html code in textarea and toggle it, it will truncate the href tag. For example: <a target="_blank" href="http://portfolio.iu.edu/lgaretto/PBL_Courses/T502/block45criteria.htm">PerformanceCriteria   </a>
After toggle it, it will give out: <a target="_blank" href="Performance">http://portfolio.iu.edu/lgaretto/PBL_Courses/T502/block45criteria.htm">Performance Criteria   </a>
getHTML function is called recursively for getting the whole html page. But it treats the href tag as two children instead of one. I think this is the main problem in getHTML function which messes up the html code. Attached is one sample html page for testing the wysiwyg toggle function. Could you please try it and tell me what you find?

column1: [SAK-271] Assignments: Email notification once submitted assignment accepted by system
column6:
Brad Wheeler is requesting the following feature request for the assignments tool for 2.0:

"I've had several incidents where students believed that they submitted an exam or homework assignment only to later find out for some reason that it was not there. Some of this could easily be user error, and I realize they can look for a "submitted" flag in the Assignments Tool. Some is a bit more mysterious, and I've not had time to track these situations down.

We all agree that they would ideally like to receive an email confirmation when an assignment has been accepted by the system. I
believe this would increase the peace of mind for all involved."

Please let me know if you need any additional information. Thanks!
column10: Assignments: Email notification once submitted assignment accepted by system
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This was also a HIGHLY requested item in Michigan's Winter 2006 user survey (1,357 instructors & 2,485 students). Both students and instructors want this option.

The problem stems from students uploading their attachment and then thinking that they have finished their assignment. But, they have forgotten to click the SUBMIT button, so their work is lost and the isntructor cannot view their submission.

Notification of a successfully submitted assignment would let students and instructors know that the submission was successfully completed (and will also let instructors know that there's something new for them to grade).

This is a REALLY important request for many users – is there a developer who would be willing to work on this for 2.3?
column45:
Requests such as the ones below are increasing in frequency - sometimes several in one day. If it is not possible to implement notification at this time, perhaps the attachment process should be rethought. I think a lot of the confusion stems from the fact that a student making an attachment ends up at a screen that has a Finish button - there is no indication that this button only completes the attachment process rather than ending the submission process. Perhaps change the button to read "Finish Attachment"?

column83: I would vote for an option to do each, one checkbox for sending email to student and one checkbox for sending email to instructor. In a big class like Global Change, I don't want 168 emails for each lab the students turn in In smaller classes, however, there's always the use case of trying to get feedback to a student as quickly as possible, so being pro-actively notified that someone has submitted something so that I can start work on it right away would be nice.
column92: Actually, from Brad's message, it looks like he would prefer that the student automatically receives an email once the system receives their submission and really mentions nothing about the instructor receiving notification. The point of this request is really to ease the student's mind. We do something similar to this in Samigo by giving the student a confirmation screen with a unique confirmation number. That way, if the instructor doesn't receive the assignment, at least the student has verification that the assignment was received by the system. This would require no UI changes to an already busy interface. If you would like, I can verify this assumption with Brad.

Kristol, brings up a good point. For the students I'm not sure I can envision a reasonable scenario where it shouldn't be checked. I would suggest that the student email "receipt" of submission be a system-wide property, and that it be enabled by default.

On the instructor notification side I can see it going both ways, but I'd guesstimate unchecked as the more common preference and use that as the default. This feature, however, is getting away from the original request, so maybe you should just stick with the student email for now, and we can create another one for Instructor notification emails.

column180:
For the email to students confirming their submission, I don't think it should be an option for the instructor to turn on or off. From the student's standpoint, they want to know if it was actually submitted or not. If the instructor failed to turn that option on, or turned if off if the defautl was on, then we are back to students not knowing for sure that their submission was turned in. This seems like an automatic function that is just part of the system. Students will get used to the email and after receifving one, will know that if they didn't get one, their submission wasn't made for some reason.

If there was an option to email the instructor (or owner, or all instructors, including assistants?) then that should probably be off by default, and they have to opt in. I suppose there should be a permission to control who receives those emails so that they can go to whichever roles, since there is often more than one instructor type in the class.
column184: Setting the option for student notification in the hands of the student makes the most sense as they are the "customer" of this notification. This is also consistent with the message notification preferences. If they don't care to get these emails, then they can turn it off for themselves, rather than the instructor needing to balance the potentially conflicting preferences of their students.
column188: If we take as one of the goals of the notification email to be to provide the students with an "official" receipt that their assessment has been received, then I think we can interpret both the instructor and student as customers. Allowing either one to disable the noticiation email to the student opens things up for more contention; it becomes less clear why a student didn't get an email, did they not submit, did they forget to check a box, did the instructor forget to check a box, did the student just save a draft and not sumbit it? Whereas, a system-wide setting builds an expectation that an email will always be sent, wanted or not, leaving less room for mis-understanding. If a student doesn't get the email, then they can start wondering nearly immediately what's wrong and work on correcting it.
column192:
Agreed, neither the student nor the instructor should have the option of disabling this confirmation message. If you really want to build in a choice somewhere, the only level I believe would be beneficial is to give the system administrator the option of enabling or disabling the notification for the entire system through sakai.properties.

Zhen, I can write up a spec for this if you can give me a couple of days so that all of the information about how this should work is there for all to see. This requirement really hasn't been fully thought out, it was just some quick thoughts put together to get this in front of the community for voting. Now that it seems we have decided to work on this, it makes sense to have a spec to agree to.
column196:
Yes, Kristol, please do. A formally written down spec will help a lot here.

Thanks,

  • Zhen
column204:
A couple things to consider:
This will be setting the stage for other high stakes submissions - for example, we might want such a confirmation email when an instructor submits final grades to the registrar (if/when that functionality is developed).

An alert page that pops up, or is at least very prominant, after the attachment is made in the Assignment tool would go a long way to preventing the problems the email confirmaiton is trying to address. After the student attaches something, an alert would appear notifying them to remember to submit to actually send their work in. Something they have to ok to get by so that they are sure to read it.

That alert wouldn't necessarily obviate the need for the confirmation email - that is still useful as submission proof in case of a system problem. The confirmation email still though is after the fact, and without the alert, there will still be those who don't know they haven't submitted. Once they get a confirmation email successfully, they'll learn to expcet it, but until they do, they don't know, and so it's not much different than the learning curve now - once they have a problem and learn to submit then they know.

The sent date of the email needs to accurately reflect the submission time, regardless of how long it takes for the email to arrive in the student's inbox.

I agree with a system wide sakai.properties function to enable/disable the email confirmation for the entire system. Probably defaulted to on though.
column208:
Thanks John for pointing out the adding attachment != submission issue. The big thing we're coming across is that students will go to a separate screen to add an attachment. To exit this screen to get back to the main submission screen, they click "Finish". This language is problematic, as it implies completion of the submission. All of the faculty that have reported this issue said that their students figured this out amongst themselves in the classroom after the fact, but it seems widely misunderstood.

I agree that the addition of the alert would go a long way to helping with the issue this ticket is trying to address. I would also suggest changing the "Finish" label on the attachment screen to "Done" as it seems (at least to me) to imply that the user is Done adding attachments, rather than having finished submitting the assigment.

I realize this slightly changes the scope with regard to the name of the ticket, but it seems like the overarching issue is better user notification both via the notification system and the user-interface.

Can we expand this issue to address both, or should the suggested UI changes be a separate ticket?
column221: I'd also like to suggest that the spec include the ability to disable this per site, as some instructors may not want this on for their particular site.
column225: Mike (and all), let's keep this issue focused on the email notification issue. They UI change for an alert pop-up or the like should be a separate issue. The attachment confusion is not the only reason to send an notification email, keep in mind SAK-8093 Closed here too; the notion that a student should expect to receive an official "reciept" via email that their assignment has been processed.
column229: I'm -1 on "the spec include the ability to disable this per site". I think leaving students to wonder if their instructor in one course enabled it, but another didn't, as to why they didn't get their receipt for a particular item would lead to too much concern and confusion for the students. I think this is an item for which uniform student expectation and experience should win out over instructor personalization.
column233:
I also vote for consistent server-wide behaviour. There should be some confirmation ID that's provided on submission both on the UI and in the email. This should be verifiable in some way, e.g. match up with the db entries and the event posted.

On the subject of the attachment button, I think 'Continue' might be better than either 'Done' or 'Finish'.
column237: A mock-up intended for 2.2., perhaps part of the solution to the problem for 2.3
column241: A mock-up intended for 2.2., perhaps part of the solution to the problem for 2.3
column245:
From my email to the assessment group.

I understand the nature of this feature request ( SAK-271 Closed ); high risk transactions deserve receipts, and assignment submission is a high risk transaction. But I think that this feature request will ultimately fall short in addressing the problem as it is experienced by students submitting assignments.

The interface for uploading a file as an attachment is simply too cumbersome. Even if students are rewarded with an email receipt for doing it correctly, they will continue to do it incorrectly. Even after failing to get a receipt (Gee, wasn't I supposed to get some kind of email notification if I did it right? Oh well, maybe I deleted it.), the same students will struggle to properly upload the attachment the second time around.

What students need is the field to upload a file right on the same page as the field where they type their inline response... as if we were asking them to upload a resource with a description. The assignment attachment process needs to be completely de-coupled from the attachment widget. The fact is that students will almost never need to attach a resource from the resource area (or from the resource area of some other site). And they will almost never need to point to an outside URL since the text editor now lets them create inline links. Just give them a straightforward way to attach a file.

I'm not just making this up. Our usability specialist did some important work on this, although she has since left Sakai. She conducted interviews, led users through paper mockups, presented to the larger design group. I've attached a slide from a presentation called "Refractored Design in 2.2":

[I attached the screenshot to the issue]]

The current implementation is clearly marked as Workaround.jpg in her work. 2.2 was really about getting it out the door, but it feels like maybe we have some breathing room with 2.3. I don't think this slide is perfect, it doesn't account for the option to Save instead of Submit, but I think this approach deserves another look.

I agree that high-risk transactions deserve receipts, but no receipt is going to improve the UI of this transaction, and adding three more steps (check for receipt, didn't get receipt, return to Assignments to figure out how to do it right, check for receipt again,...) onto the end of the workflow isn't going to make it more efficient nor reduce frustration. It might reduce support calls, but not significantly.

Here's a URL to her archive of documents about assignment attachments:

https://ctools.umich.edu/access/content/group/CTNG-Support/Michelle_s%20Archive/CTools%20%26%20Sakai/Design/Attachments/
column249: Diana - I certainly agree with your (and Michelle's assessment, that the interface for uploading an attachment is cumbersome and that has most likely led to the creation of this feature request. (Note: At IU, we have changed the text for the button in the file picker to Continue rather than Finish in an attempt to alleviate some of these problems.) With that said, I don't believe IU is requesting this functionality to resolve the problem with the file picker. The idea of receiving a confirmation is to give students a peace of mind to know that whether there are file picker problems or not, their assignment was submitted successfully to the system and they now have a receipt to prove this. We use the confirmation process at IU with our test and survey tool and I have to say that it has eased the mind of many a student and an instructor when for some reason the student received a confirmation, but the test is nowhere to be found. This peace of mind is really what we're going for with this functionality and not necessarily a band-aid for the problems with the file picker. I hope this information is helpful and I do support the revamping of the file picker. If there isn't an issue open on this already, we should open one and see if we can get Jim to work on this! Please let me know if you have any questions.
column253:
I agree with the general direction of what I am reading here.

Email notification should be a 'user' preference by each assignment. It is not something that the instructor or sys admin should set or control, but rather something that the user selects. I would like to see the feature implemented in a way that it allows the user to make a choice for email notification, selectively, when creating or submitting an assignment. I seriously doubt that instructors will want all the traffic from email notifications, but it could be an option for them, as well.

I don't know what you have in mind, but here is a possible design that gives users control:

    • For instructors, there could be a checkbox when creating or revising an assignment: "Notify me via email when students submit assignments successfully." They should be able to get rid of the check (under 'revise' assignment) if annoyed after they get spammed with a bunch of messages in a large class. Once they see that all is coming in, they may want to simply turn this off.
    • For students, there could be a checkbox right above the submit button with something along the lines, "Notify me via email when assignment is submitted successfully."

As I reflect on this, I realize that instructors and support staff will probably get lots of new type of traffic from this feature – and that is from students claiming that they check the box but they didn't receive an email notification. This could be due to an invalid email address in their Account, over quota account, spam filtering, etc. This can be an issue with a large size production....

column1: [SAK-269] cannot create user myworkspace
column6:
There are reports of new users not getting their myWorkspace created.

This is due to a permissions problem, where the "site.add.usersite" permission is not found for the user.

This permission MUST be set in the "!user.template.*" realms, in the ".auth" role. These are the templates that users (of various user types) end up using to answer site creation security questions.

The default distribution of Sakai does include this permission in the proper places. But the function "site.add.usersite" is not being registered by any of our reg files. This means that when you use the admin realm editor to examine these realms, this function will not be listed.

And if you use the admin realm editor to examine these realms' .auth role, and save the realm, since the function is not listed, it will be removed from the realm as if you had unchecked it. This is what we assume happened to get into the state of not being able to create myWorkspaces for new users.

To correct this problem for a running Sakai installation, simply edit the !user.template.* realms, and make sure the .auth roles have this function enabled.

column1: [SAK-264] WYSIWYG editor incompatible with toolbar buttons
column6:
The current JSF WYSIWYG editor is incompatible with the current JSF toolbar button implementation. This does not affect button-bar buttons (which display along the bottom of the screen), it only affects toolbar buttons (which display across the top of the screen).

See the attached screenshot.

To reproduce:
1. Enter text into the WYSIWYG editor.
2. Click on a toolbar button (a button across the top of the webapp)

Symptom:
The entered text will be lost.

Why this is happening:
Under the covers, the WYSIWYG editor uses the form's onsubmit() function to marshall the formatted text in preparation to submit it to the server. The current toolbar implementation bypasses the onsubmit() function by calling form.submit() directly (and the browsers don't automatically call onsubmit() if JavaScript calls form.submit()).

Possible solutions:

  • Modify the toolbar JSF renderer to not call form.submit() directly.
  • Modify the WYSIWYG editor to somehow not rely on form.onsubmit().
  • Don't allow the WYSIWYG editor on the same page as a toolbar button, and modify the JSF WYSIWYG component to check for this problem and throw an exception that the developer will notice.

Mitigating factors:
None of the current Sakai tools use the WYSIWYG editor on the same page as a toolbar button. If they are not on the same page, there is no problem. So perhaps a note of this could be made.
column7: New JSF-based webapps.  Does not affect existing tools such as syllabus and profile.

I see what is going on. The items are not lost. They have strayed.

1. An extra part is being created. This is the default part for the assessment.

2. The assessment's parts (sections) are being put into the QTI on export in arrival order from the Hibernate Set, which does not guarantee order; instead they should be sorted by sequence number.

3. Thus we have 3 parts, a default part, the original second part, and the original first part. The items from the first part are there, they are just in the third part.

The behavior in 1 is a bug in import; we need to suppress the default part on assessment creation. The behavior in 2 is bug in export; we need to use the part's section sequence number for the order we put them in the QTI export. Now that I know what is going on I should be able to fix this.

column225:
I have been doing a lot of work on this. Because I have to merge changes back and forth between the 2.0 and 1.5 branch, I have too many changes to document them all.

I have addressed the settings issue by setting some editable metatdata switches in the XML assessment QTI template and setting all editablility on. The old editability flags in pre-Sakai-S/Navigo may'nt correspond one-to-one, so I am not attempting to map them so you may be able to edit thaings you were not able to in the exporting Navigo server. If you have imported and exported using the latest Sakai Samigo the editbility flags should carry over and they seem to.

I have also attempted to address the issues with answer text and feedback, except for number 8. I have requested a copy of several matching questions from Kristal so that I can make the handling match up between the two versions, but haven't heard back.
column229:
Note: Earlier versions of export import will use the default template, even if the original assessment did not. Mabye this is what you are seeing. The latest versions of import turn on all the editable flags and then look at the QTI assessment to see if it has any flags that can be turned off. Only the latest versions of export will set those flags. so the behavior of imported/exported assessments will differ depending on how up to date Samigo is.

In importing exports from Navigo, I am not attempting to model all the editability flags, as they were set up differently in the two versions, so the settings will be all set editable. In external applications, their QTI export will not model the Samigo editabilut metadata, so the same will apply to them.

column245:
Here's some reference for testing.

I have gone through the latest build in the branch step by step on my standalone version and tested the following against export and reimport. I'll do a separate tests against import from Navigo, as some of these bugs appear to be in export.

Here's what I see right now:
IMPORT/EXPORT inside Samigo 1.51 branch
RESOLVED:
1. No longer missing sections. I was able to use a template that defined extra sections such as "Graphics" and they were all retained.
6. No longer missing feedback component settings
7. No longer missing questions in Part. This was actually a bug in adding an extra part and moving questions to the next part, this was fixed some time ago.
10. All feedback for all question types was erased. I see selection level feedback now.
(I did generate an error once in using question level feedback, which caused a session problem, I am investigating to see how prevalent that is.)
BUGS:
2. "Author" field text erased in Assessment Intro settings.
3. "Description" field text replaced by importation copyright blahfoo.
5. In the Submissions section, the # of submissions settings boxes are missing. It does retain the fact you chose to limit the number of submissions, but the number is missing.
8. All the question text for Matching questions was erased.
9. The question text for FIB questions was replaced with "null".
BUGS ELSEWHERE:
4. In the Delivery Dates section, "Retract Date" is gone. I think this is a settings bug, when I use Huong's all template or my Kitchen sink template, I never get "Retract Date" at all.

I'll do some tests against these specific features in Navigo exports, to isolate these issues.
column249:
Because the imports from Indiana seem to work in general, I created an assessment and exported it on a version that is "close" to that running at Indiana (but without matching support: http://aam-qa.stanford.edu:24081/sam-dev/). This assesment had entries in extra sections, MCMC, MC, Essay, FIB, TF, Audio, and File Upload. To supplement this I also tested with matching questions that Kristol sent me recently. I am using the old name "Navigo" to distinguish it from Samigo.

IMPORT FROM NAVIGO EXPORT inside Samigo 1.51 branch
RESOLVED:
1. No longer missing sections. I was able to use a template that defined extra sections such as "Graphics" and they were all retained.
6. No longer missing feedback component settings
7. No longer missing questions in Part. This was actually a bug in adding an extra part and moving questions to the next part, this was fixed some time ago.
9. Fill in the blank was handled correctly, so this was probably an export bug.
10. I see selection level and item level feedback now.
BUGS:
2. "Author" field text erased in Assessment Intro settings.
3. "Description" field text replaced by importation copyright blahfoo.
5. In the Submissions section, the # of submissions settings boxes are missing. It does retain the fact you chose to limit the number of submissions, but the number is missing.
8. The question text for Matching questions was not erased, but the options appear to be missing.
Notes:
Since there is no file upload type in version 1.5x, file upload questions are mapped to short answer. This "feature" appears to be impelemnted correctly. It was requested, so don't treat this as a bug. Also if I import an assessment not exported from Samigo, I turn on all the sections, since it may not have our metadata, and the author may need to add settings.
Additional minor bugs: Model short answer is mixed in with question level feedback. Timed assessment data is not set right.

So to summarize, the remaining issues are: in import there are some errors in some settings, although the sections are there now. In import the matching answers are lost. In export the question text on FIB and matching is lost. :

1. Matching corrupted on import and export.
a. import loses options
b. export loses question and options

2. Fill in the blank loses question text on export.

3. Settings lost on import:
a. author
b. description
c. timed assessment duration
d. number of submissions

I found fixes for 3c and 3d today but just had time to get it into the branch, this turned out to involve the export. So I am recording an awful lot of documentation so I can merge the fixes into the head.

There were a couple of odd things that I found, such as the timed assesment flag is not set by the data model when I examine it, so I changed the code to set the time regardless if there is a nonzero or nonnull duration and set the duration field to an ISO time accordingly; also the MAX_ATTEMPTS was getting reset to the duration seconds in a timed assessment. This leaves a couple of little bugs in the import, as, I will have to make a change to interpret a MAX_ATTEMPTS as 9999 as unlimited and to (you guessed it) reset the timed assessment flag if there is a nonzero or nonnull duration.

column466:
Latest round of testing on the rc2 build, in nightly2.sakaiproject.org.

I exported and imported an assessment with all question types and 2 parts. Here's the problems I found when I compared the exported/imported version to the original version. (I have printouts of the settings and questions for the "before" version with the problems marked in red, which may be easier to parse than this list.)

Settings Problems:

o Template information gone - design choice, I know, just keeping track
o High Security IP address settings gone
o Text formatting in submission message reverted to plain text

Questions Problems:

o FIB questions come out broken. I'm including before-and-after screenshots of the two FIB questions so you can see what happened to them. Also got printouts.

o A space was lost in the question text for the file upload question (minor problem, I know)

o Feedback for file upload question was lost

o Multiple Choice Survey question was lost - replaced by an empty Multiple Correct question.

o Model Short Answer and Feedback lost for Short Answer/Essay question.

o One choice lost from Matching question (but not its pair)
column470: I tried importing the "Matching Questions" xml file attached to this bug, and that one worked fine - no obviously missing choices or matches.
column474:
Well, we're a lot closer!

Let me recategorize these by severity. Item function is the highest priority, I think, followed by feedback, model short answer.

1. One choice lost from Matching question (but not its pair)
2. FIB questions come out broken. I had FIBs that worked, I will have to look into this!
3. Multiple Choice Survey question was lost - replaced by an empty Multiple Correct question. Hmmmm. Should be simply getting the subtype XML template and populating it instead of the matching template.
4. Model Short Answer and Feedback lost for Short Answer/Essay question.
5. Feedback for file upload question was lost.
6. High Security IP address settings gone. This turned out to be very difficult. If the assessment is transported between sites, the IP addresses my not be the same.
7. Text formatting in submission message reverted to plain text. Ooops. Missed that when I made the identical fix for descriptive text.
8. A space was lost in the question text for the file upload question.

I would consider 1-3 to be major, 4-7 minor, 8 trivial.

so that it is easier to track. That would be feedback (4,5) and settings metadata (6,7).

column490:
RAN INTO A PROBLEM, WHICH SHOULD BE FIXED SOON, BUT HAVEN'T BEEN ABLE TO IDENTIFY WHERE IT IS COMING FROM.

Somewhere (and I can't find it yet) a false newline is now getting added at the beginning of the xml export document (at least in my instance). Don't think it was in 2.0 or 2.0 + patch... It is getting all the way to the JSP from the backing bean without error, and the JSP doesn't appear to be inserting a line, so it is mysterious, perhaps in some change in the framework. Please use Firefox for now (IE tosses its cookies) and ignore the spurious error message ("xml processing instruction not at start of external entity"). You can display Page Source("The page... ...contains POSTDATA...", "OK") save and then remove the initial line temporarily to test.

Textually it is a minor bug, but not to the user! I won't close this bug out until I find a fix, so don't add another bug, I know about the problem.

Actually, after some testing, I see that only Short Answer/Essay is making the proper entry on export, although the other two files types are logging as if they did. A subject for further investigation.

However, given that SA/E is working on export I was able to discover the fix for import data extraction. Import code looks like it correctly worked with early Samigo (aka Navigo), because it had a hack to use the InCorrect label for general feedback. However, it needed a little fix to get it to work with both our new, more correct way of doing things, and our older, oddball way of doing things:

column526:
OK, there were two cases where we had problems with fill in the blank
1) the question starts with a blank
2) there are two blanks together

This created problems in that we process text/answer/text/answer... etc.
So now, when we export a question it pads the missing places with nonbreaking spaces.
I tested with the following:
1.
You'd be ____ on the rumble ____ of a ____ built for ____ .
Answer Key:
sweet, seat, bicycle, two

2.
____ do not ____ the means.
Answer Key:
ends, justify

3.
The primary colors are ____ ____ and ____ .
Answer Key:
red, yellow, blue

Previously, 1 woudl work, and 2 and 3 would have errors.

$ svn commit -m "SAM-271 fix for FIBs starting with blank or with blanks back to back: pad with nonbreaking spaces" src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/business/e
ntity/helper/item/ItemHelper12Impl.java
Sending src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/business/entity/helper/item/ItemHelper12Impl.java
Transmitting file data .
Committed revision 386.
column530:
I am hot on the trail of the dropped matching target on export. I already have a solution that exports and then reimports "successfully"--just one BIG hitch, the targets are going in backwards, so that the answer key is messed up.

Counterintuitively the targets are going into the XML in the reverse of the order in which they are written. I should be able to fix that, but it is proving a bit tricky.

column550:
Latest round of testing. The results varied somewhat by build. For each version, I created a 3-part assessment (2 normal parts, 1 random draw part), using at least one of each question type. Exported and then re-imported the assessment, then checked to see how close the imported version was to the original.

After summarizing the problems here, I think I'm going to open a new bug for each problem, so they're easier to find.

Oracle problems:
-------

  • Matching question lost the last answer match
  • Feedback for FIB questions lost
  • MC single-correct question changed to multiple-correct type, feedback lost
  • Model answer for SA question lost
  • The random draw part drew all possible questions from the source pool
  • High Security password setting lost (IP setting OK)
  • When I previewed the imported assessment, the time limit had been reset to 0 (though it was fine in the settings), and so the preview was inaccessible.

Mysql:
------

  • Extra ???s were added to the ends of words in question text, answer choices, feedback, etc in many places.
  • Text formatting (italics) was lost in question text.
  • The FIB multiple-line question with line breaks formatted ok in question creation, but after export/reimport, most of the text had vanished.
  • The random draw part drew all possible questions from the source pool.
  • The text for the assessment introduction setting was lost.
  • The time for the timed assessment setting was lost.
  • High Security password setting lost (IP setting OK)
  • When I previewed the imported assessment, the time limit had been reset to 0, and so the preview was inaccessible.

hsql:

  • All the settings were OK except for the High Security IP setting, which was lost. (password setting OK)
  • selection feedback for multiple choice question lost
  • model short answer for SA question lost
  • FIB question with consecutive blanks put a comma between them in the question display, but was otherwise ok.
  • The FIB multiple-line question with line breaks formatted ok in question creation, but after export/reimport, most of the text had vanished.
  • All the feedback for matching question choices was lost.
  • All possible questions were drawn for the random draw part.

column75:
There are two places to navigate through a list in Sites. The first is in the overview list of search results, and the second is when showing details for a particular site.

In both cases, the "Previous" or "Next" button does not show up greyed-out when it is irrelevant. When you're at the beginning or end of the list, they're simply not there.

On the list overview, when you are in the middle of the search results and both "Previous" and "Next" appear, the "Previous" button appears on the line above the pop-up menu that lets you choose how many results to display. The "Next" button displays on the same line as the pop-up menu. This happens in XP/IE.

column1: [SAK-259] Copyright Flag: Inconsistent behavior
column6:
Comment by John Norman [13/Feb/05 10:22 AM]

[Copied from SAK-13 to new issue by Peter Knoop.]

In testing on 1.5 RC7 I could not evaluate full functionality as the file attachment and hyperlink options in the wysiwyg editor were not available. I simulated the hyperlink option by manually editing the html.

The behaviour described in GAP 137 that I was able to test appeared to work as required. However, there appears to be an incomplete definition of required behaviour in the GAP 137. Expected behaviour when a file is set to 'Public View' is not covered. Current behaviour is inconsistent:

Consider an image which is copyright and which I place in a folder called 'assets' to indicate secondary materials that are reused in other primary files. I now create an html file with a hyperlink to the image. Neither is public. When a logged-in member of the course accesses the html file there is no warning (OK) and when the logged-in user follows the hyperlink to the image there is a copyright warning and acknowledgement is required. So far so good.

Now, if I make the html file 'public' an anonymous user can see the content. If the anonymous user clicks on the hyperlink, they are presented with a login dialogue. If a valid user logs in they get the image, but with no copyright acknowledgement.

If I also make the image public, an anonymous user reading the public html file can access the image after acknowledging the copyright statement.

However, the image file is also visible in the public view and the image can be accessed freely with no copyright acknowledgement and no login.

Finally, if I make the 'assets' folder public (a) all of its contents are freely available with no restriction regardless of copyright status and (b) the contents are all displayed at the 'top level' i.e. no longer in the 'assests' folder so the presentation could be confusing.

column1: [SAK-258] mysql sakai_resources.sql needs upper-cased table names
column6:
reference/src/sql/legacy/mysql/sakai_resources.sql needs upper-cased table names.

Patch attached.
column10: mysql sakai_resources.sql needs upper-cased table names
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: upper-cased table names patch
column45:
Sam,

What problems do the mixed-case table names cause? Does this prevent the script from being executed (perhaps because your MySQL is setup with case-sensitive table names)?
column49: I can easily fix this (if we have a bug fix release before 1.5)
column71:
MySQL is as case-sensitive as the OS it is running on. The queries in sakai_resources.sql will fail on any case-sensitive system (Linux, Solaris not Windows, OS X) because the table was created in uppercase.

chef_content.sql:

CREATE TABLE CONTENT_COLLECTION
(
COLLECTION_ID VARCHAR (255) NOT NULL,
IN_COLLECTION VARCHAR (255),
XML LONGTEXT
);
column75: Fixed in CVS. Will be released in 1.5 rc9 (if there is one).
column79: The fix is in CVS.
column83: confirmed fixed
column92: We've come across this bug before, and fixed it before. For the future, lets try to keep ALL SQL COLUMN AND FIELD NAMES IN UPPERCASE to avoid this problem.

column1: [SAK-36311] scrolling menus problem
column6:
There are a few places in Samigo where selecting a choice from a menu will cause an immediate response; you don't need to choose an option and hit a select button to confirm it.

If you have a mouse with a scroll-wheel (like my new one), then scrolling rapidly through these menus can cause an exception. Unfortunately it's not hard to do by accident.

Example:

1. In Authoring, view an assessment with more than one question. Each question has a number menu that allows you to renumber questions within a part.

2. Single-click on the number in the menu (not the down arrow) and move the scroll wheel on your mouse. If you're not very slow about it, you'll get an exception. (see attachment 1).

I tried reproducing this with the "select a question type" menu at the top of an assessment in authoring, and got a second exception when I rapidly scrolled between question types. (see attachment 2).

I don't suppose there's an easy fix for this, she said hopefully?

column1: [SAK-255] Copyright click-through sometimes displays in wrong window
column6:
The copyright click-through expects to always appear in its own window (since the Cancel button tries to close the window).

However, the link that opens the click-through does not always open in a new window.

The bug occurs with any non-text resource that has a copyright click-through.

To reproduce:
1. Upload a file of a non-text type (example.exe for example).
2. Set the resource to "Display copyright alert below and require acknowledgement." (this is the default)
3. Click on the resource after adding it, to download it.

The copyright appears in the same window. The "I Agree" button works, but the "Cancel" button doesn't work (because the copyright click-through is coded expecting to be in its own window).

Possible solutions:

1. Always display resources that have a copyright click-through in a new window. Then the copyright "Cancel" button will work.

OR

2. Fix the "Cancel" button on the copyright click-through so that it works if the copyright is not in its own window. (In this case "Cancel" would probably do the equivalent of the browser "back" button, instead of attempting to close the window).
column10: Copyright click-through sometimes displays in wrong window
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: SAK-375 Closed is a duplicate report of SAK-255 Closed . I can confirm that the copyright clickthrough screen sometimes does not do what it should, and displays in the same iframe instead of in a new window.
column45:
The copyright popup window should have the normal browser chrome (back button, menu bar, etc). Right now, the popup window has no menu, etc.

This is fine when its just showing the copyright notice. But if the content is going to be loaded into the same window, the browser controls are needed. The user may want to use "File.. Save As..". Or the content may actually be a link to a website, in which case the user definately needs their browsing controls.
column49:
As per Zhen's comment, the current method of operation in Sakai 1.5.1m2 is:
1. User get a separate window (win1) with copyright click-through option
2. If user:
a. 'agrees,' a new window (win2) opens with file content. The copyright window (win1) stays open.
b. 'declines,' the window (win1) closes.
3. If user had previously 'agreed,' when the user closes the content window (win2), the user will still be left with the copyright window (win1).
4. The user now has the option to 'agree' [and get the content window again] or to 'decline' and be closed out of win1.

Checked on sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030 using IE.

Unassigning & closing item.
column71:
John disagrees with my closing the issue, since the current operation is not exactly consistent with Zhen's assessment. Note that the attached file that I was using for this test is a word (.doc) document.

Reopening.

Fixed.
Basically, I couldn't reproduce it on my instance. But I figured from one assessment in the nightly build that has this problem.

It seems the assessment name in the QuestionScore page are generated refreshly from the DB backend. When two published assessments are from the same original core assessment (two different copies for the same original assessment), the assessment may get the name of the other assessment copy.

column41:
Add a UI to display sites in a hierarchy. This all centers around
a new per-site property (sakai:parent-id). This allows the construction
of a hierarchy by having child sites point to parent sites.

This is a latent feature with zero UI impact unless it is truned on
by the addition of a property.

For more info see
https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn//reference/trunk/docs/architecture/sakai_pseudo_hierarchy.doc

See the above document for some next steps.

column1: [SAK-244] use of /usr/local/sakai in config files
column6:
/usr/local/sakai is referenced 141 times in 54 files. This makes deploying to anywhere other than /usr/local/sakai very difficult. It also makes developing and testing difficult if you don't have access to /usr/local/sakai or if you want to run more than one instance on a box. It also makes creating binary distributions difficult. For example, the sakai 1.0 quickstart actually searches and replaces tokens in these files to resolve this. Surely there's a better way.

At least for the references in spring files, there is a better way.

You can use a PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer:

<bean id="propertyConfigurer" class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer">
<property name="locations">
<list>
<value>classpath:hibernate.properties</value>
<value>classpath:system.properties</value>
</list>
</property>
</bean>

Then in spring files you can reference these properties:

<bean id="dataSource" class="org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource">
<property name="driverClassName"><value>$

{hibernate.connection.driver_class}

</value></property>
<property name="url"><value>$

{hibernate.connection.url}

</value></property>
<property name="username"><value>$

{hibernate.connection.username}

</value></property>
<property name="password"><value>$

{hibernate.connection.password}

</value></property>
<property name="maxActive"><value>$

{hibernate.connection.maxActive}

</value></property>
<property name="maxWait"><value>$

{hibernate.connection.maxWait}

</value></property>
</bean>

For more info, http://www.springframework.org/docs/reference/beans.html#beans-factory-placeholderconfigurer

We've been using this approach in OSP with great success.
column10: use of /usr/local/sakai in config files
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I would like to see us externalize the path to the settings folder (e.g. /usr/local/sakai). I have wrestled with this problem for many other applications and it is a bit of a "cart and horse" problem. I suggest we define a java system property like:
"-Dsakai.settings.root=/usr/local/sakai".

We would then add a bean property to the ServerConfigurationService called "settingsRootPath" which would be initialized during startup, reading from the system property. Then if other services needed to know the location of the root, they could simply be dependency injected via a method call to ServerConfigurationService's getter; i.e. ServerConfigurationService.getSettingsRootPath(). While this solutions only allows one settingsRootPath variables per JVM, it is a non-issue since Sakai does support more than one instance of Sakai per JVM.

I am including a snippet from a Spring components.xml file as an example of how to dependency inject via a method call to another component:

<property name="driverClassName">
<bean class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.MethodInvokingFactoryBean">
<property name="targetObject"><ref bean="org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.ServerConfigurationService"/></property>
<property name="targetMethod"><value>getString</value></property>
<property name="arguments">
<list>
<value>sql.driver</value>
</list>
</property>
</bean>
</property>
column45:
I can understand wanting to externalize the path. So what I'm suggesting, wouldn't really do that, its would only bring the 141 files down to 1.

<bean id="propertyConfigurer" class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer">
<property name="locations">
<list>
<value>file:/usr/local/sakai/sakai.properties</value>
</list>
</property>
</bean>

The global nature of system properties is precarious, but maybe unavoidable. What about creating an extension to PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer that could read in the property file from a system property.

<bean id="propertyConfigurer" class="org.sakaiproject.config.SystemPropertyPlaceholderConfigurer">
<property name="locations">
<list>
<value>sakai.settings.root</value>
</list>
</property>
</bean>

Then a deployment could use either use the system property or the standard spring method suggestion above.

That would simplify the spring config to:

<property name="driverClassName">
<list>
<value>$

{sql.driver}

</value>
</list>
</property>

Instead of:

<property name="driverClassName">
<bean class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.MethodInvokingFactoryBean">
<property name="targetObject"><ref bean="org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.ServerConfigurationService"/></property>
<property name="targetMethod"><value>getString</value></property>
<property name="arguments">
<list>
<value>sql.driver</value>
</list>
</property>
</bean>
</property>
column49:
I looked into doing this myself a little and realized that this would require a few changes to Sakai's component manager design. Right now Sakai is only using spring's beanfactory features, not a full application context.

From Spring javadoc:

In contrast to a plain bean factory, an ApplicationContext is supposed to detect special beans defined in its bean factory: Therefore, this class automatically registers BeanFactoryPostProcessors, BeanPostProcessors and ApplicationListeners that are defined as beans in the context.

Since the PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer is a BeanFactoryPostProcessors this would require some change to Sakai's component manager. But probably worth looking into since post processors can be handy for a variety of uses.
column71: Once the static path "/usr/local/sakai" is easily re-configurable, the QuickStart will become much simpler.
column75: Sakai 2.0 now has a much improved methodology to address this issue. The system property "sakai.home" can now be specified on the command line when launching the jvm (tomcat). L
column79:
sakai.home can be set at startup with a command line option and is also available using the placeholder variable $

{sakai.home}
