column1: [SAK-235] Manually Label Tab with Cross-Listed Courses
column6:
Instead of having the tab for a course worksite be labeled with the first course in the list of classes/courses for the site, have the user specify the worksite's tab label (as a separate field, similar to what is being done with the project worksite). That way, for instance, the user could specify an "Algebra" tab, and then have a bunch of
MATH 111 001
MATH 111 003
MATH 111 005
MATH 111 006

classes specified under the tab.

Or you could also go with a "Mathematics" tab and then have
ALG 112 004
ALG 321 001
CALC 211 007
GEOM 210 002

(a bunch of math classes) under the tab.
column10: Manually Label Tab with Cross-Listed Courses
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: [Bulk Comment] This issue was reported as affecting versions of Sakai that are no longer supported (1.0, 1.5.x or 2.0.x). It is likely that this issue has been taken care of by redesign or bug fixing since it was first reported, so the issue is being Closed; however, if you feel the issue is still relevant for more recent versions of Sakai (i.e., Sakai 2.3.1), then please re-open the issue and add the more recent version of Sakai to the list of Affects Versions. Thank you.

column1: [SAK-234] Multi-course worksite setup needs clarity
column6:
As non-admin user, went through the process of creating a course worksite. Was given the option of creating several classes/courses within the worksite. I added/created 3 classes/courses in the worksite, but on completion of the process, the only course information which shows up is the first course. The worksite tab was created with information from the first class/course, and, as far as I can see, the other 2 class/course information were ignored.

What is the current purpose of allowing the user to create multiple classes/courses under a course worksite? Where is the additional class/course information supposed to show up?
column10: Multi-course worksite setup needs clarity
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The tab names and title have to be short and based on something meaningful, so the initial stab at this was to name them after the first course you enter. The full set of courses you've associated with the worksite are listed under Site Info or when revising the site via Worksite Setup.

If there were real course data available to the test server, then you would also be able to see the difference in the Participant List as you added and removed courses. However, I think you've tested things as far as you can on the Stable server with its limited data base, and are seeing the expected behavior.

column1: [SAK-35612] hitting return key in linear assessments = continue
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/delivery/beginTakingAssessment.faces

Action: As a student, take an assessment that's linear (no TOC, only forward navigation.) Example test: Another 2.7 test

When you hit the enter key, the browser (at least IE, probably most of them) interprets that as clicking the "Save and Continue" button.

Since you don't get to go backward in these assessments, if you haven't answered all the questions on the page yet, they are now lost.
column10: hitting return key in linear assessments = continue
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Huong, can you look into this?
column45: Some of browser, especially IE, when you hit enter in the text input field, it read as submission the form. To prevent this I added a script to detect the return key by added function called noenter() which is return onkeypress for input field of fill In the blank questions. It solves the problem now. Thanks for noticing this! Huong
column49: It's fixed now. Thank you! That was a scary one.

column1: [SAK-36281] Text on delivery page for reviewing assessments needs updating
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces

The list of reviewable assignments has changed ( SAK-35299 Closed ), so the text on the delivery page should be updated to match. Right now it says:

"You have completed the assessments listed below and they are currently available for you to review. Click on the assessment title to review your responses (and instructor feedback if available). "

Can Marc or someone change this to describe how it works now? Thanks!
column10: Text on delivery page for reviewing assessments needs updating
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Can you clarify the 1.5 content for Daisy and Margaret?
column45:
For the 1.5 version, the instruction text be:

"You may review the following submitted assessments. Click on the assessment title to review assessment questions (along with your responses and instructor feedback if available)."

For the 1.5 version, we are allowing access to feedback through the assessment title link. Since question text feedback is always enabled by default, at least the question text of submitted assessments is available for review. Therefore, all assessment titles will be links.

For the 2.0, we want the "Review" link to take the place of this assessment title link. If all feedback is turned off (including possibly the question text), then a student will see is:

Assessment Title (no link), n/a (feedback date), n/a (grade), n/a (score), 35min (time), 2004-Oct-01 8:34 AM (submitted)

Also, we are not linking to statistics until 2.0, so along with the "Review" link, the "Statistics" link won't be there for the 1.5 either.
column49: ok, i will change teh screen
column71:
Hi Margaret,

I fixed what I can for that screen to match with the mock up. You wnat links for all title, you got it. There is only one thing that need more work which is sorting by FeedbackDate. I will cc: QingRu and ask her to add that. Thanks.

btw: for submitted assessmnet that has immediate feedback but no date, i display "immediate" in the column just so the space won't be empty and ambigous. Oh, I also use this notation for date on the entire page 2005-Jan-1 1:00 pm as it was not consistent in the mock up. Plaese check with Marc if that is OK. Thanks.

Daisy

column1: [SAK-35894] Settings: published assessment url
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/author/authorIndex.faces

For the "Assessment Released To" settings, the mockup shows a pair of windows that let you release an assessment to defined user groups, as well as anonymous and authenticated users.

There's also a "Published Assessment URL" field that should let you publish an assessment to a public web page.

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The mockup has changed for that, and instead of the windows it lists possible publishing targets with a list of groups to release to. This is according to Indiana's spec, and is all in place for 1.5..

As for the published URL, last I heard from them, they had thought they didn't need it, since they could just create a user called Anonymous User who had access to all of those. But if they need it, they should tell me soon, and I'll assign it to someone.
column45:
The "Published assessment url" is now generated for each assessment and you can see it on the confirmation page. So I guess Indiana does want it after all.

However, is it going to be an always-on setting, or should we put in the setting to turn it on and off, as per the mockup? Thanks!
column49: I haven't seen the mockup, so I don't know, but I don't think it's critical to turn it off and on, so long as it's there. Daisy, can you get together with Margaret and clarify what she should expect to see?
column71:
Yes, IU want to publsihedURL. this is the ONLY url that anonymous user can use to access an assessment. Authenticated can access the assessment either through this publishedUrl or the select assessment page. This is Lance's spec:

1. If assessments are published to the "Anonymous" target, the URL is the only form of navigation that anonymous users have to find the assessment.

2. The generated URL will be used by both anonymous and authenticated users.

3. If a user accesses the URL and the assessment has been published to "Anonymous" then the user would begin the assessment without any additional input.

4. If a user accesses the URL and the assessment has not been published to "Anonymous" then the user would be prompted for authentication, and then taken to the begin assessment screen.

5. We suggest that a new Agent (and AgentId) is generated for each anonymous test taking session. This will help identify unique response sessions; i.e. if the assessment is published to "Anonymous", and the user is beginning the assessment via the URL, then the number of attempts is effectively infinite. However, if the user is not using the URL, then number of attempts can be enforced as the user is identifiable.

6. Number of attempts and Anonymous delivery are somewhat incompatible. The only way I can think to possibly address this issue is to use a browser cookie in an attempt to track state.

7. Remember that we also have an "Authenticated Users" publishing target which can be useful if the behavior described above does not suit the needs.

Daisy
column75: Sounds good. Can you put back the field that shows the published assessment URL in settings? Right now the only time I see that URL is on the publish confirmation page. Thanks!
column79:
Hi Marc,

please let em know where the publsihed url should go in the Publsihed assessment settings. I can't find it in the mock up. Thanks.

dasiy
column83: Check out page 5 in the assessmentSettings mockup. It's in the Assessment Released To: section.
column92:
please check.

daisy
column96: Hey Daisy, I still don't see the published assessment url in the settings of new assessments created today. Did your fix get checked into the branch?
column127:

Just a note: The published url is in the publsihed assessment setting not the assessment setting. There won't be one in the assessment 'cos it is not published yet. OK?

Daisy

column1: [SAK-222] Rename in resource tool not reflected in webdav
column6: renaming an item (File or folder) in the My Workspace resources area does not update to users WebDAV folder, even upon refresh.
column10: Rename in resource tool not reflected in webdav
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Please let me know when this is resolved- mmmay@indiana.edu. Falcon ticket IM189651 will need to be updated.
column45: This could be a bug with Windows XP's webdav client. It seems to be caching the old file name somehow. I have confirmed this behavior is reproducible.
column49: webdav may be displaying file id instead of title.
column71: This might be because a) the resource's id is shown in webDav, not it's title, and b) the resource's id is set to the upload file id and is never changed. Rename is "re-title", and does not change the resource id.
column75:
What Glenn says makes sense. Renames on the network space actually update the file name in storage.

If a user uploads a file via WebDAV, the default title is the document name. If a user uploads a file using the web interface and doesn't specify a title, the doc name becomes the title.

Somehow, it needs to be apparent that changing the title field in Resources doesn't change the document name. I was thinking it'd be great if we could force the title to be the documents name . .

The typical user won't easily distinguish between document name vs title.
column79: This will not be addressed for the 2.0 release. However, we do have a completely revamped resources tool slated to move into production this summer. If things go according to plan, this issue will be addressed.

column1: [SAK-216] Add logic to worksite setup which honors the "helpEnabled" setting in sakai.properties
column6:
If the property "helpEnabled" in sakai.properties is set to true, then worksite setup should not add the legacy help tool to the new site's list of tools. If the "helpEnabled" value is set to false, then worksite setup should behave as it does today and add the legacy help tool to the new site.

Zhen - Glenn and I talked about it and this task is based on his suggestions. If you have any more questions, please see Glenn.

Thanks, L
column10: Add logic to worksite setup which honors the "helpEnabled" setting in sakai.properties
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Comments from Glenn:

There is one technical task left to do, and I have volunteered Zhen to do it. Worksite setup needs to be changed as follows:

  • read the helpEnabled configuration setting. If help is enabled, do NOT include the "help" site page with our old help tool when new sites are created. If help is disabled, the old help site page / tool will continue to be added.

With this change, then Sakai with help enabled will no longer show two helps; and CTools with help disabled will continue to work.

column1: [SAK-36059] XML display in Mozilla
column6:
This is just for documentation purposes, and confirmation. I discovered a bug in Mozilla that displays an error message when exporting QTI.

The issue is that any blank lines at the start of an XML file are considered bad by Mozilla, and may cause some parsing problems.

I fixed this by crunching up the initial lines of the JSF.

Fix version (went in tonight):
$ cvs commit -m "removed line breaks in jsp headers to fix error message on Mozilla XML display" xmlDisplay.jsp
Checking in xmlDisplay.jsp;
/cvs/sam/webapp/jsf/qti/xmlDisplay.jsp,v <-- xmlDisplay.jsp
new revision: 1.5; previous revision: 1.4
column10: XML display in Mozilla
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
For confirmation (should be in next build).
Should no longer display
"XML Parsing Error: xml processing instruction not at start of external entity"
No error message will be displayed.

Note: Mozilla has an informational message that there is no stylesheet when it displays XML that is does not have one. This is informational only.
column45: I think you should keep this bug.
column49: should be done.
column71: OK - I can export an assessment in Mozilla with no errors now, just that informational bar about the stylesheet.

column1: [SAK-35946]  "Default" part title  still visible in delivery
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/author/editAssessment.faces

http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces

Action: In authoring, add a new part to an assessment. The Create/Modify Part page says:

NOTE: Part headers with the title "Default" will not be visible to assessment takers.

So name the part "Default".

Expected: In delivery, that part should show up with no title.

Actual: In delivery, that part shows up with the title "Default".
column10: "Default" part title  still visible in delivery
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Hey, could you send mail to me and Lydia and Daisy about how this is supposed to work? I can hide part information if the part is called Default, but I'm not sure that's actually what we want to do?

Thanks!
column45:
If there is only one part and its name is "Default" then in delivery, the blue header bars for this part should not be visible on the TOC (just all questions, no toggle) or on the questions page.

"Default" should be the default name for the first part in a newly created assessment. If other parts are created and the first part's name is "Default", it should be changed to null and all subsequent parts default to null.

If the first part is not named "Default" or there are more than one parts, then show the blue header bars.
column49: Looks like we need to change the wording on the page – "Default" should only work if there's only one page. This also means the default name for the first section should be "Default" instead of "Section 1". When all that's changed, Lydia, assign it back to me and I'll fix delivery.

column1: [SAK-214] Discussion toolbar doesn't display "New Topic..." or "New Category..." when it should
column6:
The discussion tool doesn't display "New Topic..." or "New Category..." in some cases where it should.

Here is one way to reproduce the bug; there may be others:

1. Create a new discussion channel
2. Create a new topic
3. Delete the category by clicking on the trash can icon next to the category.

Symptom: The toolbar now does not display "New Topic..." and "New Category...", which it should do.

Workaround: Click on "Expand All", and then on "Collapse All". Then the toolbar will be back to normal.

Sakai 1.5rc6

column10: When setting up an email alias it accepts an "!" in the email address

column41:
An exclamation point is a valid character in the user part of an email address, so this is not a bug. You can use all sorts of fun characters according to RFC-822, as as noted in the Sakai alert you would receive if you did use an illegal character, "Alert: The Email Alias must be made up of alpha numeric characters or any of !#$&'*+-=?^_`

{|}

~. (no spaces)".

column41: That's correct behavior. When you submit an assessment, you start over from scratch the next time you take it.
column45:
Reopening issue after talking with Rachel.

The correct behavior should be:

Student saves and exits, retakes: answers NOT reset
Student submits for grading, retakes: reset answers
Student submits for grading, reviews: answers ARE visible

So it's still a bug that the assessment is blank when you review
it. There's no point to a review feature if all you can see is the blank exam sheet

column75:
Right now, the most recent time I take an assessment is showing up in the review list, whether it is submitted for grading or not.

Example:

1. I take assessment, submit it for grading, see assessment with submitted-date in the list with the link for review.

2. I take assessment again, but this time I choose "save and exit" instead of "submit for grading". The review list has updated - now the assessment is there without a link and with a submitted date of n/a.

According to Marc, that second time should not have changed the review list because it was not submitted for grading. Does that make sense? Thanks!
column79:
Hi Maraget,

the submitted list should only contains submitted assessment. Take a look at the assessment Marc 1, it is saved but never submitted so it does not shwo up in the submitted list. You must have at lesat one submisison for it to show up in the submitted list.

Note: if you never submitted and feedabcak date & retract date has arrived. You missed out. I checke dthat with marc and he said it is ok. Below is his reply. Thanks. Let em know, if there is still things that need fixing. Tahnks

daisy

>>>>>
Hi Marc,

suppose if I have never submitted the assessment for grade and now the feedback for this assessment is available. Do I get to see the feedback? with the current logic, it would be a NO, right? 'cos the assessment won't appear under the "submitted assessments".

– marc's reply
It won't appear in submitted assessments, correct. If immediate feedback is on and the student clicks "Feedback" link, however, they will get feedback while taking the assessment.

suppose the lateHandling is on and the retract date is not set, then perhaps I can submit a blank page and then get to view the feedback.

— marc reply
If late handling is on and it's passed the due date, the student can take and submit the assessment once more. If immediate feedback is on, they will be able to see feedback.

What if this is way passed the retract date and i can't get to the assessment anymore, am I losing out?

– marc's reply
You could be, but if the instructor set the retract date correctly and communicated this to the students, it's probably the students fault.

I wanted to mention one note on the "submitted assessments" list that Rachel and I discussed after we talked to you on the phone: If an assessment has been submitted, even if it is currently passed the retract date, it should show in the "submitted assessments" list. I'll include this in the spec.

-mARC

column1: [SAK-1911] minor but important: directions for submitting assessments
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces

Test-takers need to know that their assessment will not be submitted until they click the "Submit for Grading" button, and where to find that button.

If the assessment has a TOC, the submit button can only be found on the TOC page. In some kinds of assessments, the TOC page is the first page the test-taker sees; in others, the TOC page is not displayed unless you click on its link, which you might never do.

(Example: When the whole assessment is displayed on one web page, the test-taker goes right to the assessment instead of to the TOC first.)

So it's very easy for the test-taker to click on "Save and Exit" and think they're done, when in fact they aren't.

Could we put directions in the begin-assessment page that explain what the buttons mean and where to find them?

column45:
Well, as one of the simplifications I made to get the date picker in with the new date specifications is that entering an hour+12 value will switch the hour from am to pm. It is using the hour value and interpreting it as a 24 hour clock, which the popup is using right now, unfortunately.

To change 7am to 7pm you need to click on the clock component and enter 19. This is not very self explanatory, I agree.

I will have to make a fair number of modifications to the JavaScript popup, so it isn't a quick fix, but not really difficult. I don't think I can get this in before the Indiana release, but will try to get this in as soon as I can.

Can we make this a 2.0? It should certainly be added when the drop down lists (that meet the mockups) are put in the control.
column49:
There are two separate problems going on and I think I have fixed them both. It took some research to find this out.

1) when you have a PM time in a date loading the calendar "clips" it to an AM time. For example, "04-08-2005 07:00:00 PM", open the date picker, and it showed "07:00:00" which is AM on a 24 hour clock. When you submit the picker popup (not the page) the control switched to "04-08-2005 07:00:00 AM".

2) Even when you have "04-08-2005 07:00:00 PM" and submit the page, and go back in the field will read "04-08-2005 07:00:00 AM".

Fix for 1):
Now AM/PM time now correctly shows in popup as 24 hour time.
Prompt added at bottom explaining 24 hour time.
When you select a valid hour greater than 12 in the popup time, it is now correctly translated and displayed as h-12 PM. In addition, if you directly edit the field to incorrectly show "04-08-2005 18:00:00 AM", and hit the popup, it will swap it to the correct "04-08-2005 06:00:00 PM" when you select without changing the time.

column1: [SAK-205] 2 Help buttons showing up
column6:
In the nightly 2/1/05 build, two help buttons show up when creating a new site. The 2nd help points to the KB doc. We should eliminate that 2nd help button to avoid confusion.

The 'old' help button brings up an intermediate page with FAQs on it, and a Help Guide button. The Help Guide button on that page goes to a URL specified in the properties file. So an adopter can hook up whatever help system they want by changing the URL in the properties file.

An adopter that wanted to use KB docs would change the help URL to point to the kb docs, and leave the ? icon mechanism as is with registrations pointing to kb docs as they do now.

An adopter that wanted to use their own help docs would point to the URL for their help docs in the properties file, and change the ? icon registrations to point to their help docs rather than kb.

column1: [SAK-202] possible deadlock from site and realm updates
column6:
The realm service methods:
refreshUser()
refreshRealm()

and the site service methods:
setSiteSecurity()
setUserSecurity()

could be run concurrently by different Sakai users, and could possibly overlap in the records they modify. This could under unpredictable circumstances lead to a deadlock in the database.

These methods, which might do multiple deletes and inserts of different records, and were doing so in a transaction, have been changed to reduce their likelyhood of getting into deadlock.

The change is to assure that each delete or insert is handled by a separate transaction, each with a commit.

column75:
Hi Rachel:

I am reassigning this to you because I have a question to ask.
I tested all columns (yes, name is sorting by last name). Sorting works fine for every column except "Comments". The reason is that the coments are in WYSIWIG, so the actual string for sorting is something like "<p>fffffgdfgdsfgdfgd</p>", "<h1><font face="arial,helvetica,sans-serif">ccccc</font></h1>", or just "erwerwerwerwe". So sort will recoganize "<" as the first letter of string.
I tried to trim the string to the only string we want. But it is hard to know if there is only one matched pattern, like <p></P>, or more than one, like <h1><font></font></h1>.
Do you have a suggestion on how to deal with the sorting for "comments"?

Thanks,
Qingru
column79:
As a matter of fact, I do! I just ran into this problem somewhere else.

Sort on commentText.replaceAll("<.*?>","");
column83:
Thanks, Rachel.
Fixed.

Qingru

column1: [SAK-198] "no state found for key" warning messages
column6:
We're getting loads of "no state found for key" warning messages in several different actions. These seem to be preceded by IllegalStateException begin thrown. I think that this is related to the CalendarAction blowing up with an NPE since it seems to not be finding the calendar that it's expecting in the state. (The code in question should be checking for a null, but the root cause seems to be a missing calenar.)

Also, the following trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.sakaiproject.tool.content.ResourcesAction.buildMainPanelContext(ResourcesAction.java:431)
at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor179.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
at org.sakaiproject.cheftool.VelocityPortletPaneledAction.toolModeDispatch(VelocityPortletPaneledAction.java:330)
at org.sakaiproject.cheftool.ToolServlet.doGet(ToolServlet.java:158)
at org.sakaiproject.cheftool.VelocityPortletPaneledAction.doGet(VelocityPortletPaneledAction.java:915)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:697)
at org.sakaiproject.vm.ComponentServlet.service(ComponentServlet.java:82)

makes me thing that things are being lost from the tool state.

Also, in the AnnouncementAction at line 1036 we're getting an NPE:

((EventsObservingCourier) sstate.getAttribute(STATE_OBSERVER)).justDelivered();

It certainly looks like the sstate.getAttribute(STATE_OBSERVER) is returning a null. This could be another example of state problems. There may be more cases that I'm missing.

While it is possible that these are all isolated bugs, it seems odd that they'd all start occuring at once. Someone (Glenn?) who has a better idea of how the session state (or its contents) may be coming/going needs to take a look at this. I haven't been able to reproduce this on my own machine with the XML database, so it's a bit hard to debug.
column10: "no state found for key" warning messages

column1: [SAK-197] Fix the distribution of realms to make sure that untyped users can create, and typed cannot
column6:
This is item 3 from Glenn's hit list for 1.5
We need to change the OOTB distribution of realms, and user creation, so that the default is that a user created with no account type gets site.add. The !user.template would have site.add checked.

An account that is typed as 'Guest'(for example) does not get site.add - so the !user.template.guest would not have site.add checked.

The current release has !site.template without site.add, and !site.add.maintain with site.add, but if I change my account type to maintain, I do not get anything showing up in worksite setup - just a blank tool frame - no toolbar or content.

column41:
>> 3) check/fix the distribution for realms to make sure that users can
>> create (untyped to get create like maintain, non-maintain type for
>> example?)
>>
>> Some issues have come up from the testing - we need to make sure that
>> the proper site.add permissions are set in the user template realms,
>> and probably re-define it so that the untyped user has site.add like
>> the "maintain" type user, and that we have an additional user type
>> called "no-maintain" or something without the site.add
>> permission, just
>> as an example.
column45:
Talking to John Leasia I believe that the deliverable is:

  • Add site.add to the !user.template permissions.
  • Add a new realm !user.template.guest which is just like !user.template was before site.add was added.
column49:
What we need to do to resolve this is:

keep site.add OUT of the !user.template realm. It must NOT be there.

Make sure there is a !user.template.registered realm, that is just like !user.template.maintain.

In this way, new users, who get "registered" type by default, will be able to create sites.

column1: [SAK-196] Netscape vs IE site access
column6:
I have noticed that when using Netscape 7.0 to run the Sakai application, I cannot log in as more than one user on the same machine, even if I open two instances of Netscape. The same is NOT true for IE. Using IE, I can log in as different users on the same machine if I have different instances of IE. Any ideas on what Netscape does differently?

Here's what happens with Netscape.
I open one instance of Netscape and log in as user X on the Sakai site.
I open another instances of Netscape. As soon as I access the site, I'm already logged in as user X. If I log out of either one, I'm automatically logged out of the other.
column10: Netscape vs IE site access
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This the expected behavior.

Many Windows browsers (e.g., Mozilla, Netscape) share cookies between all of their instances – they are all running in the same process – and that's where your authentication information is stored. So, each time you login you are replacing the information with whatever identity you logged-in as most recently in all of that browser's windows.

Under Linux (and I believe MacOS X), and for IE on Windows, each browser instance runs as a separate, independent process, so they do not share cookies between instances. So under those circumstances you can adopt different identities in different browser instances on the same machine. (Note that for IE-Windows, you will only have non-shared cookies for browsers started independently; if you start IE by selecting New from within an existing IE window, then those browsers will share cookies.)

column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/evaluation/questionScore.faces

In the "Questions" section of Grading, you see each response to a question with its raw score.

Matching questions are treated as though each pair was a separate question. If the matching question has 4 pairs to it, and the question is worth six points, student "rachel" will have 4 separate scores for every time she answered that question. Each score will be marked as 6, giving her 24 points for the question.

column1: [SAK-194] HSQLDB database support for legacy services and QuickStart
column6:
Update legacy services to work with the HSQLDB database.

Make HSQLDB function as the default database of a default Sakai installation. Then the default Sakai installation will use a reliable, persistent database when first installed (instead of the outdated XML persistence). This also allows the legacy services and new Hibernate-based services to coexist in the same starter HSQLDB database.
column10: HSQLDB database support for legacy services and QuickStart
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
We need some concerted effort to test a new configuration of Sakai 1.5rc7 backed by the HSQLDB database. We are looking for regressions that may have introduced in this new configuration. We have switched the nightly server from the old XML storage implementations over to the database implementations. The database implementations are the ones that are used in production with an Oracle backend. For those of you that what the technical details let me be clear on how this is different from running against Oracle: We are using new DDL which has been ported to HSQLDB, and have introduced a new set of HSQLDB configuration files.

This change has some great benefits:
1. NIGHTLY will now provide a better test environment as it is running the same implementation we are using in our production systems and STABLE.
2. Once we get our developer community weaned off of the XML implementations, we can retire that code.
3. Developers will now also be using the database implementations during development with further stresses/tests those implementations.
4. The database implementations backed by hsqldb will provide a much improved quickstart and actually use the out-of-box quickstart to run small "production" installations of Sakai.
column45: The HSQLDB support is Held up (for the moment), because of a bug on nightly. The bug may or may not have to do with this issue directly.
column49: I am pleased with the current state of hsqldb support. If we run into issues from here on out, we should file a new bug report. Thanks! L

column1: [SAK-191] iCal export support in Schedule Tool
column6: Export of calendar data in iCal format (note import feature request moved to SAK-7342 Closed ).
column10: iCal export support in Schedule Tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: In addition to import/export of calendar data in the icalendar format, proper subscription of icalendar calendars would be very useful. Subscription as opposed to import would enable institutions with centralized calendaring software to have calendar data hosted outside of Sakai. However, the opposite would also have to be true; pushing changes in the calendar to an external icalendar-based service using e. g. WebDAV or file system.
column45: Keep an eye on http://ietf.webdav.org/caldav/ too.
column49: This issue should belong to the Schedule component.
column71: Removing Calendar Widget component (not relevant)
column75:
Suggested implementation:

1. Add admin option to "publish" a calendar via iCal. The calendar will then be publically accessible via an iCal file. Optionally add an alias for the iCal file.

2. If published, an iCal file will be generated, upon request, given the site name or alias, at "/access/calendar/ical/<site-name-or-alias>.ics". The HttpServletResponse.setDateHeader() method will be used to set the date/time stamp of the generated file to the last add/change/delete date of the calendar. The Schedule tool should also handle HTTP Head requests, which will return an HTTP header with the correct date/time stamp.

3. For every add/change/delete to the site calendar, the calendar should update it's date/time stamp. This wil be a new "DAV:getlastmodified" property in XML field of the CALENDAR_CALENDAR table.
column79: iCal4j provide an ical implementation with a license compatible for distribution with Sakai. See http://ical4j.sourceforge.net/
column83: The first pass of the iCal export has been checked in. The ical export of event metadata is not yet complete, nor is there a datestamp for subscriptions or an admin option to enable/disable the public ical export. This is next. Kudos to Naomi Miles for her work to date.
column92: The 2nd pass if iCal export has been checked in. The iCal export now works with the exception of recurring events and miscellaneous metadata (e.g. description, location, etc). Any iCal request will have a "Last-Modified" HTTP header reflecting the time of the last event added. A new "export-enable" option has been added. Permission to configure iCal export is tied to permission to import.
column96: [Bulk Change] This issue is currently Unresolved, however, it has a Fix Version set. In keeping with the newly added Target Version, Fix Versions should only be set for Resolved Issues, and only after it has been merged to that version specifically. The Fix Version is being reset to Unknown for this issue. Please use the Target Version to indicate when you plan to address this issue.
column127:
iCal export/subscription implemented excepting reoccurring events see ( SAK-11487 Closed ).

Export will not be enabled on server unless "ical.experimental=true" in sakai.properties

Export can be enabled/disabled per site by selecting new "Export" selection from Schedule tool

Once Export enabled and iCal alias defined, the "Export" selection will document the URL for downloading ics.

column45: Jon, is there any chance this could be caused by not going through the tunnel servlet? I am just looking for a gross analysis of my theory, so don't feel like you have to own this one. Leave me some comments and reassign back to me. Thanks, L
column49:
I have extracted the Hibernate stuffs from Spring to
be managed by JBoss Hibernate Service.

After that, both chef-tool and other spring beans can access
the bean that using Hibernate.

Thanks.
column71: So you have a working configuration? Thanks, L
column75:
The error is happening because the bean is being resolved in a different servlet context than the one in which it was defined. I don't yet have a solution, or know why the bug is occuring; but a workaround has been reported.

Example of how the bug happens:
webapp XXX defines a bean MyBean that needs the classpath resource XXX.properties from XXX.jar. If the bean is resolved in the context of webapp XXX, then XXX.properties is found. However, if webapp YYY tries to resolve/instantiate the bean in its own YYY context, then the classpath resource won't be found (because YYY.jar doesn't contain XXX.properties).

Perhaps someone (Glenn, Craig?) can figure out why the bean isn't being instantiated in the proper context.

-Jon
column79:
Wong, could you please verify that this problem does not exist on Tomcat 5.0.x? This is the only app server we currently support.

Thanks, L

column1: [SAK-35687] "Submit for grading" button missing
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/delivery/beginTakingAssessment.faces

Action: Take assessment as a student.

Expected: There should be a "Submit for grading" button on each page, or at least on the last page, which when clicked takes you to the Assessment Submission page.

Actual: There isn't a "submit for grading" button anywhere at the moment, just "Save and exit".
column10: "Submit for grading" button missing
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: That's correct – only "linear access" assessments have a submit button. Random access (the default) only has a save, and you have to submit from the table of contents (the link at the top of the page).
column45: Okay, I can now see and submit for grading from the TOC page, so both kinds of assessments can be submitted. Thanks!

column1: [SAK-35345] Assessment setting "continuous numbering between parts" doesn't work
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/delivery/beginTakingAssessment.faces

Action: Create assessment with the "Continuous numbering between parts" button checked in Assessment Organization.

Then, take the assessment as a student.

Result: Parts are not continuously (or even accurately) numbered. My test assessment had 7 questions distributed between 3 parts, and had "continuous numbering between parts" on. In delivery, the numbering went:

Part 1 of 3
Question 1 of 3
Question 1 of 3
Question 3 of 3
Part 2 of 3
Question 1 of 2
Question 2 of 2
Part 3 of 3
Question 1 of 2
Question 2 of 2

This bug is for the continuous-numbering problem; I'll hunt down more information about the duplicate question 1s and file another bug on it.
column10: Assessment setting "continuous numbering between parts" doesn't work
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I redid numbering everywhere. Please test?
column45: Looks good now - I moved questions around a lot in authoring a new assesment, and in both authoring and delivery they are numbered right. "Continuous numbering between parts" setting works. I'll keep this open through one more assessment to make sure.
column49: Yeah, this looks good now. THanks!

column1: [SAK-35625] "Show Feedback" link shows answers for some questions
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/delivery/deliverAssessment.faces

Action: While taking an assessment, click on the "Show Feedback" link.

Result: Answer key is visible for some types of questions.

(See attached image for example FIB question.)

...Do we really want feedback to be visible while taking the assessment? Should that just be a review thing? When should the answer key be visible to the student?

Observed for FIB, Matching, will add comments for any others.
column10: "Show Feedback" link shows answers for some questions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Also true for MC and TF questions.

Short answer and survey questions don't have an answer key, but
the "model answer" does show up for short answer questions.
column45: That's correct – immediate feedback means you can see the answers as you fill out the assessment. If you set it to immediate feedback, you should see that link, and clicking it should show you the answers. If you set feedback by date or none, that link shouldn't appear.
column49: Ohhh. Another one for the documentation list, then.

Thanks!

Okay! Here's the one from the assessment I created Thursday (see attached screenshot). That's assessment "Marith security-off", the answer choices for question 1.

Seeing the problem again in a new assessment (Marith Jan31 linear).

column71: This was a really complicated fix, because labels for radio buttons in JSF don't support HTML. I created a separate radio button group for each button, and then coordinated them using javascript. Please test it well?
column75: Fixed! html tags no longer showing up for mc answer choices.

column1: [SAK-36269] Assessment Settings: anonymous vs. authenticated users
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/author/authorIndex.faces

More a question than a bug: Should the "Assessment Released to" settings be left in the upcoming release, or be commented out for now?

According to Rachel they don't do anything right now in the standalone Samigo, but we should define what they're supposed to do when a school writes code that hooks into them.

(What should the behavior be when neither box is checked? Assessment is released to nobody, or can't be published?)
column10: Assessment Settings: anonymous vs. authenticated users
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: They need to be there, but should we just list Authenticated Users and disable the checkbox?
column45: If we are implementing the assessment delivery via URL to anonymous users, then authenticated users needs to be uncheck-able.
column49: Okay – that doesn't really answer the question, though. What do we do if neither box is checked?
column71: Rachel and I decided that our solution for now is to have have authenticated checked by default.

pls checked. tahnks

Originally reported by Craig Counterman <ccount@MIT.EDU.
column10: Display announcements in MOTD using last-modifed date (instead of creation date)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Announcment currently is designed to display (and sort) announcements by creation date, rather than by last-modified date.
column45: [Bulk Comment] This issue was reported as affecting versions of Sakai that are no longer supported (1.0, 1.5.x or 2.0.x). It is likely that this issue has been taken care of by redesign or bug fixing since it was first reported, so the issue is being Closed; however, if you feel the issue is still relevant for more recent versions of Sakai (i.e., Sakai 2.3.1), then please re-open the issue and add the more recent version of Sakai to the list of Affects Versions. Thank you.

column1: [SAK-35963] Assessment settings:  Assessment creator  not editable
column6:
http://aam-dev:8080/samigo/jsf/author/authorIndex.faces

Action: Create a template with the "Assessment Creator" value set as editable, in the "Assessment Introduction" section.

Then create an assessment based on that template.

Result: Assessment Creator is displayed as "Administrator", and is not editable.

Either the assessment creator field should be editable, or the option in Templates should be removed.

I agreed with you Margaret. This is probably one of the thing that Marc missed out.

In the AssessmentSetting mock up, creator is not editable. However, there is indeed a "can edit" check box in theTemplateSetting mock up. Given that Rachel assigned this bug to me, I am going to based this on the Assessment Setting mock up and I went ahead and hide that "can edit" check box.

I will email a copy of this comment to Marc & Rachel. Thanks for spotting it.

Daisy
column45:
creator = is someone who created the template/assessment (e.g. instructor)
authors = I am not sure. I imagine that it could be anybody who have added work to the template (e.g. instructor and TAs)
